description:
Decent sushi place in the Nob Hill area. I had a cucumber salad, the Naruto roll and the Potato Bug roll. Naruto was a sashimi roll, wrapped in cucumber and sans rice. Potato Bug is basically an eel cucumber roll topped with eel. I prefer mine without extra unagi sauce and no aioli so I can actually taste my food. 

Portions were decent and the food was good, if unremarkable. It's good sushi. Just not outstanding sushi.
author: Kate D.

description:
This is the very definition of drunk college student sushi, with slathers of mayo on every mushy, sub-fresh bite. I was most offended when, after ordering red snapper nigiri, I bit into what was most certainly TILAPIA, which has that unmistakeable gristly, muddy taste, and is commonly used as red snapper substitute in Chinese speaking countries like Taiwan and Hong Kong where I grew up. I should've known better to order red snapper at cheap places (google it: Red Snapper is the most commonly mislabeled seafood in America, and often tilapia is passed off as "izumidai").

So yea, eating raw mud-grown tilapia - the pigeons of polluted farm waters - made me really gag.

I suppose certain concessions must be made at this price point, but geez.
author: Ken H.

description:
The idea that Sushi Toni is a "must" is pretty laughable. If you are craving sushi but want to keep it cheap, Sushi Toni is a good choice. 

The atmosphere is very casual and a bit lacking. 

The sushi is your standard Americanized sushi options-- some sashimi and nigiri combo plates, some deep fried rolls, and some standard rolls. Everything is decent, but nothing will blow you away.

Service was nice and attentive.
author: Shauna B.

description:
If your in San Fran, Sushi Toni is a must! Great sushi and sake restaurant, we're so happy this restaurant was nearby our hotel. Had the sushi combo came with miso soup and shared a dragon roll.  They have specialty rolls but I tend to stick to my favs so I can compare. 

Service is good and the sushi is reasonably priced, a great find!
author: Julie Ann I.

description: Good food. Small portions. Nice customer service. I got spicy tuna with avocado and cream cheese. And a few avocado rolls. I don't really recommend their edamame. If it wasn't for the load of soy sauce I probably wouldn't have finished it.
author: Avi K.

description: Great location to where I was staying, nice-enough staff, but high prices for the food quality and portions received. A friend and I ordered take-away and it was highly disappointing. The miso soup was bland, the little scoop of rice was a joke, and my Dragon sushi roll smelled fishy/not fresh and wasn't deveined (shrimp poop inside). Yes, I realize it's not harmful to consume, but I'd rather not. Hard pass on this restaurant!
author: Jennae H.

description:
Slightly disappointing.

I wouldn't recommend this place to a vegetarian. The veggie sushi options are quite limited (only 1 roll is vegetarian), but there are other options on the menu (noodle soups, etc).

I'd probably avoid the sushi rolls in general at this place -- the portions are quite small for the prices.

Also, the service was on the slower side even though we were one of only 2-3 parties in the restaurant at the time.
author: Benjamin C.

description: Near cable car .At bush&powell st. Walk from union square 5-7 min .Good place nice staff .clean and delicious. I like volcano rolls it always awesome .
author: Warongkarat F.

description:
I've been looking for an affordable, good sushi spot and it took a second. A friend of mine recommended Sushi Toni as one of her favorites and I decided to give it a shot. I was not disappointed. The sushi rolls were fantastic! I tried the Red Dragon doll and the Volcano Roll - both were really yummy. We also got a sashimi platter which had a few different types of tuna, yellowtail, and salmon - delicious and healthy!

The restaurant is no frills, which is fine by me if it means affordable, quality sushi. Our server (who I suspected was the owner) was so nice she even threw in a free dessert for us (also delish).

You can also BYOB for a corking fee of $15, which is not bad at all.

Definitely planning on going back- excited to have found our spot!
author: Maansi D.

description: 4 stars and over 500 reviews? I've to check it out. I wasn't impressed. Salmon roll was tiny (6 pieces per order) for about $6.50. I told myself it's SF, so it's normal and a lot of people said it's a pretty good sushi spot in SF compared to other places so I'll just judge it on the taste of the food itself. I expected more, the salmon wasn't as fresh as I had before and there just wasn't much salmon in each piece of the salmon roll.
author: Elizabeth L.

description: Gave this place another try because its directly on my way home from work and I was craving sushi. Rice was slightly improved from last time, but still meh. It was kind of cold and reminded me of grocery store nigiri rice. I would say this place is decent for the price. To be honest I'll probably come back for pure convenience of location, but it's not my favorite place.
author: Cynthia M.

description: My friends and I popped into Sushi Toni walking out from an entertaining performance at the Masonic. It helps compose an eclectic row of small businesses, starting with a ritzy and festive looking French hotel, an "adult theater," and then Sushi Toni. Never fear, the poster in the kitchen says Sushi Toni has an "A" for hygiene. I was feeling hungry and ordered the dragon roll as well as the regular spicy tuna roll. I could actually feel the heat in the spicy tuna roll. I not uncommonly inhaled every last crumb of my food, so it was up to par. A total of $20+ for a meal is on the pricey side, but it is the city and also sushi, and there are not a lot of interesting food options in that area.
author: Amy G.

description:
I came on Friday evening around 5-6pm and there was no wait. We ordered shrimp tempura, fried chicken gyoza, unagi nigiri, chicken teriyaki, and beef teriyaki. The soup and salad came out promptly, followed by the shrimp tempura and gyoza about 5 mins later. The unagi nigiri was brought shortly after. The entrees took about 10 mins to arrive to the table. The portion was a little small for the price but the meat was very fresh and cut nicely. The beef could have been more tender and I would have liked more teriyaki sauce. The shrimp tempura was nice and crispy and not overly breaded. I really enjoyed the fried gyoza and it had a nice texture. My husband said that the unagi was very good. 

In regards to customer service, it was okay. i think our waters were refilled once and we were only checked on once after all the food was brought to the table. The party of 6 behind us seemed to be waiting awhile for their check. 

The atmosphere is very casual.
author: Christina S.

description: Really fun and interesting local place to get some good sushi as you are going about your day in San Fran! The dynamite bowl was a new sushi concept we had never tried before that was delicious. Highly recommended!
author: Alessio S.

description: Great Sushi and very reasonable. Service was spot on, our server even gave us complimentary green tea ice cream, which was delicious!
author: Smriti T.

description:
The food was fantastic! Fast and fresh! The restaurant is lit dimly and perfectly sized for the space. 
The service was great and the bill was way cheaper than we expected. Would definitely 
Recommend this place!!!
author: Kacie B.

description: I popped into Sushi Toni tonight for some takeout and the app that I use to check into places notified me that it was my 80th time checking in to this place... and I often forget to check in to places... So I'm going to go ahead and guess that I have been to Sushi Toni probably 100 times! I've been grabbing takeout from this place for about 9 years, and I find that it is consistently delicious. Why would I go to a place 100 times if it weren't?? If you're in the neighborhood and craving sushi, Sushi Toni is a solid choice. Bonus- the staff is very warm and kind.
author: Liz M.

description:
Okay this was a real disappointment!
Not sure how this place has 5 Stars. Seriously it makes no sense. 
I have only order a miso soup and a salmon roll then I left without looking back ( after paying off course ).
Miso soup was absolutely tasteless; how is that even possible? I mean how can you mess up miso soup?? It was basically water with some tofu and maybe 3pieces of seaweed. 
Salmon Roll was also tasteless. Salmon is my absolute favorite food. I happily eat it in anyway but truly this was not so fresh and tasty, perhaps cause there was barely any in my roll! As of that wasn't enough sushi rice was way over cooked, kind of mushy and just Not good! The cheapness of this place is a huge Turn off. Didn't need or want to try anything else, cause if the basics are off, I m out!
Sushi, chef and waiter were kind and attentive, probably underpaid according to the direction given over the quantity/quality of the food served.
If you are looking for a good, affordable sushi then you are much much better off at Ono sushi!!! Will soon review it. I order the same thing over there and everything was great and very tasty. Particularly the salmon roll which is even 50cent cheaper the Sushi Toni yet was filling, super fresh and pretty abundant in salmon and the rice off course cooked as supposed to. Ended up ordering another salmon roll indeed , as I was very satisfied with it.
I feel like mentioning Ono Sushi because as a true sushi lover I like to , at times, have more affordable options available. You know to satisfy that craving even after rent and bills were just paid 
Sushi Toni is a scam. Was happy to have sushi right by my hotel but I m actually never coming back. I d rather walk a couple more blocks to Ono Sushi or even explore other sushi spot around me!
My warm suggestion is skip this and safe your $ for a much better sushi experience.
author: Hosna A.

description:
Our order was included 3 nigiri dishes, an assorted sashimi, and two rolls. The uni was good but can be very expensive - when we ordered it was $16.50 for two pieces. I don't recommend the assorted sashimi; 5 small slices of fish for $13.50 -- you're better off ordering a different sashimi set.

The rolls were good and most reasonably priced. We ordered the lion king and potato bug rolls. Compared to other sushi places I've been to (not in Bay Area) the size of the rolls are on the smaller side.

I enjoyed our meal, but overall it was too expensive for the amount of food we got. However, maybe this is as good as sushi places get in the Bay Area.
author: Angela I.

description:
What a find of a hole in the wall! We were looking for a sushi place after having drinks at the Top of the Mark, and we wanted it to be walking distance, and new instead of one of our usual casual sushi haunts like Godzilla (see separate review). So, like a good yelper I pulled this place up and decided to try it.

We walked in and it was busy being a Saturday night but not crazy busy, so we had our pick between table and sushi bar, so we sat at the bar.

They surprised us by having sparkling wine and the hot sake was good. We ordered nigiri sushi, and the shrimp tempura roll.  Everything was delicious and fresh, the service attentive and fast.

The ambiance is super casual, in a world of San Francisco Japanese restaurants going crazy on the next new thing like this Omakase BS trend that has taken San Francisco sushi restaurants by storm lately, Sushi Tony is a traditional sushi restaurant - thank God!

Only ding is they did not have ankimo. Sorry, in SF that'll cost you a star.

San Franciscans and visitors alike. Check this place out!
author: Massimo M.

description:
People, 

If you're going to be in San Francisco GET. YOUR. SUSHI. HERE. Not only will you be dazzled by Chef Toni's delightful conversation, you're gonna get a lot of amazing fish for prices that make you feel like Toni is just in it for the love of the game. Every time I go I get the Chef's special and it is always something unique and delicious. Also, how can you not love that sign?!

Try him out.
author: Dan C.

description: Great sushi and really great atmosphere. Feels like having sushi in a Tokyo sushiyasan. Definitely recommend their rolls and great selection of Japanese beer! Next time you're in the area take the time to step away from Union Square and make the hike up to Sushi Toni and I guarantee you will be very pleasantly surprised.
author: Yoshio B.

description:
I don't why this place get so many 4 stars.  It's just okay.  Don't get the udon.  We got the tempura udon and it's very naked and almost bland.  Luckily I have pretty sensitive taste bud so it's not completely hot water but I would say some of the worst I have ever tasted.   Also only one tempura shrimp and absolutely no veggie in the soup just 4 pieces of tempura. 

The Romeo Juliet roll is good.  The family affair roll is ok.  The onions on top throws me off a little. 

The waitress barely speaks English.  It seems to owned by Chinese and not Japanese.   Must be a tourist place.  Will not be back.
author: Lei H.

description:
Just finished eating to go.

I came in to pay, and its a pretty cute small place!

I ordered the mixed tempura appetizer, better deal than the entree. There was a bell pepper slice, and i love bell pepper, but ive never had it in tempura. I know ordering tempura to go is a bad idea because it gets soggy, but it was fairly good. The broccoli was unpleasant, it had too much batter and it was cooked but cooked and extra mushy. Definitely needed to drain out thhe batter more.

I also ordered the dragon roll. It was pretty nice. It has crab in it and it was topped with the imitation crab. It also had green onion. Nice twist and decently priced. 

This is a pretty good place. However, minutes affter finishing my meal, my throat started getting swollen and my head started throbbing. Im not sure if they use msg, but i usually get these kinds of reactions to it. I could have just been allergic to something else.....
author: Lynn C.

description: Good sushi.  Rated 100 points by health Dept.   Service was friendly.  I can't say that sushi blew me away but it was a good value.   I would go back.
author: T C.

description: Thanks Toni! This is my second favorite sushi spot I've discovered in the city. Reasonable prices for sushi and good quality. Pretty small inside but it wasn't too crowded for a Saturday night. They were quick to seat up and quick to serve us. Toni came out to see how everything was. They have cool shirts of cartoon Toni riding a fish.
author: Kelly G.

description: Very good service. The Red Dragon Roll was delicious. Miso soup was very good. Would definitely go back when in town again.
author: P F.

description:
We went to this place because the other sushi place "Akiko" was booked, apparently we needed reservation...a whhhha?

Anyways.
This was our second choice and this place is quite small so if you have a party of more than 4 people it is not a place for you and your group. We only had 3 people and they had to sit us at the bar because all their 3-4 people table was taken...some by 2 people. Odd.

We got sat and we ordered. I would say this place doesnt seem busy but I guess it is for the server to forget about us. Our water was never refilled and she never checked on us. For a small place I don't know how you forget about the customers honestly. 

Aside from the service. The food was ok. Portion was average. Nothing really special.

The only amazing thing I could say about this place was that their bathroom is very clean. It didnt smell. WOW.
author: Jade L.

description:
Interior - Moist, attacked by bugs throughout my meal.

Portions - Small; Yellowtail and salmon sashimi looked twice as large on Yelp than in person. 

Philadelphia and Volcano rolls - Average. 

Service - Good. They reheated the hot sake for us when it got cold.
author: Ee Vonn Y.

description: Small portions, mediocre food. Can't say I am too impressed with the menu. This spot is one of the few sushi restaurants in Downtown, but like the  others, cater to the tourists and those without much of a choice. Their salmon teriyaki was good but small, the California roll was typical, good flavor but lacking in presentation. Miso was watery and lacking ingredients. I have a few suggestions in this part of town that beat this by a mile.
author: Fiona Y.

description:
I've had Sushi Toni on my bookmarked list for the longest time.

We came here on a Thursday evening around 6pm and it was entirely empty. We ordered the Dragon Roll, Dragon Boom Roll and Steamed Gyoza appetizer.

The gyoza was simple enough where I can make it at home. I enjoyed Dragon Roll for the fish toppings and the crunchiness of the cucumbers inside. The Dragon Boom Roll was a bit of a disappointment. The rice was completely hard and clumped together, the octopus was extremely chewy and the spicy sauce on top was extremely spicy!! I'm sure the "boom" in the name should've given it away but if you're someone like me, that likes sriracha but can't eat a whole bag of hot Cheetos in one sitting, this is not the roll for you.

I read in the comments that a fan favorite is the Lion King roll, so I look forward to trying that the next time I'm in the area!
author: Linda K.

description:
Solid place to grab a quick bite but was neither cheap nor super amazing. Service was friendly and there was no wait which is nice in the city. I think if the price point was just a little lower I would come back, but its a bit high for the quality.

I wouldn't recommend the salad, it tasted like it had gone bad.
author: Diana T.

description:
The boyfriend and I came here for the Naruto sushi. We weren't too hungry, but still wanted sushi, so we got that one because we liked the name, and that it looked pretty healthy. This was a hole-in-the-wall kind of sushi place in FiDi. The service was good, and the guy who waited on us was really nice.
 
However, when we got onto Bart, we started experiencing nausea and headaches. For me, it was getting worse and worse. I got a painful stomachache, and vomited a little when I hiccuped once I got back home. Because both of us had felt fine all day, so the fact that both of us felt uncomfortable once we got into Bart made us believe that this place was the source of our conditions. It's a shame, but at least the people working here are nice.
author: Jo W.

description:
Thanks Yelp for helping us find this little gem of a place. Like others have said, small restaurant space...about 8 small tables and I think there's a small sushi bar area.

We ordered 3 rolls to share: spicy tuna, Yum-Yum and the Lion King roll. We really enjoyed all three rolls. I took pictures of the menu section of all their Special Rolls they make. The menu is as of May 2016. Prices were pretty good. 

The workers there were quick and efficient. We sat down, ordered, sushi arrived quickly, ate, paid and we were on our way to explore the city. Very pleased with this restaurant and we're glad Yelp led us in the right direction.
author: Cynthia L.

description: I had a dragon roll, rainbow roll and tempura shrimps. the staff is nice, but the food is not so impressed.
author: Szu-chi H.

description: Local sushi place with very fresh seafood. Seems like a family owned place filled with lots of locals who come often. The 49er roll was my favorite. Service was fast and friendly.
author: Liz S.

description: This place was delicious, cheap and had great (quick) service. My bf and I came here for a late dinner and they were able to seat us right away. The place was pretty crowded for it being nearly 10pm. We ordered three rolls, sushini, and miso soups. They all came out very quick and were delicious. My favorite was the lion king roll! Definitely is a joke in the wall place but still pretty large with a good amount of seating. Good place to get yummy sushi for a decent price if you're not in the mood to go to the fancier lounge type places.
author: Alex S.

description:
My girlfriends and I wanted sushi as our first meal during our visit in SF for the weekend, so we Yelped places that weren't too far from our hotel. To be honest, Sushi Toni wasn't our first pick (only because there were several options and it was hard to choose). The first place we went to was just a nightmare, there was no standing room whatsoever in that place. It was so crowded and the hostess was so flustered that she wasn't very friendly to us. So I went back on Yelp and searched some more until I came across Sushi Toni.

We called to make sure that we would be able to get seated promptly and then made our way over. We all agreed that we made the right choice in going to Sushi Toni instead! We sat at the bar and just had a lovely, fun-filled dinner with great conversations the entire time. 

Service was very accommodating. The chef kept checking to see how we were doing and had the server bring out anything that we asked for. We felt like we made a new friend by the end of our meal, and will definitely be back!
author: Lisa N.

description: Our quest for reasonably priced and good sushi continues! I think when we went they might have had an off-day. The fish itself was good, but the rice... on a whole 'nother level. The rice itself was mushy. We got an eel roll and two of the special rolls. The eel roll was fine and the rice was marginally okay. However, the rice for the special rolls was even worse. Imagine a sheet of rice that has been melded into a uniform layer; it wasn't that great at that point. I do at  another point want to give it another chance!
author: James N.

description: Visiting San Fran this weekend. Wanted to eat sushi but didn't have formal clothing. This place fit the bill.  The sushi was also excellent.  Curb appeal isn't the greatest but this place is great. Loved the low key atmosphere and people. Red Dragon, BTS, and Spicy Yellowtail is what ordered. The beer was very cold and matched perfectly with my sake! Don't miss out, tourist!!
author: Junior E.

description: Great service, food is good & affordable. Place is small but cozy. Also enjoyed the playlist of background music. (':
author: Jasmine G.

description: Came here for sushi due to large number of reviews and 4*  Got sashimi and lion king roll but it was just okay. not terrible but not 4* either. Good for a casual lunch
author: Jeremy T.

description: This place is AMAZBALLS!!!! Excellent service, amazing food, great wine and Delicious dessert.... on the house. Can't say enough great things about this place. Definitely coming back with every trip. !!!!!
author: Shannon S.

description:
Got the chef's choice sashimi dinner meal. Soup was from a pre-made packet (plus a few slivers of fresh onion), the salad was drenched in a white dressing, and the "chef's choice" was extremely mediocre: A lackluster presentation (no effort was put into the slices) and old tough seared tuna were a couple of his choices.

With all the sushi options in this town, I won't be back.
author: Bo L.

description:
Soft and tender pieces of sushi. The salmon was "melt-in-your-mouth" good. The rice was just the right texture. I inhaled those suckers!

Definitely a place I'll be coming back to. One of the other sushi joints in the Union Square area that I used to frequent has closed. So needed to find a new regular spot. And this one is more than satisfactory as a substitute for the previous place.

It's a small cozy, little joint, right next to a place that has dancing dudes, apparently. But don't let that distract you. I've had to venture into seedier areas before, and this location ain't too bad.
author: Crissy C.

description: Great sushi, location good, small place, not very fancy, but clean and very friendly staff. I had the nigiri combo (chef's choice), and enjoyed everything.
author: Fahim R.

description: A tiny shop but delicious sushi! It's not cheap but it's worth the price for it's quality and friendly service. Basic casual shop setup.
author: Kira L.

description:
Probably the best sushi in downtown. Very small place but of course surprisingly good. Amazing sushi, u can appreciate the taste. 
Could be lot  of waiting over the weekend .  But worth coming back.
author: Smartyr R.

description:
Pretty solid little sushi spot in the City!

Came here because we were hungry and we just happened to walk by and go, "Oh this place looks fancy" and dropped in for some eats.

Sushi here was very fresh and tasty. A tad bit more expensive than other places in the city but it seemed like it was well worth it. 

Good spot if you've got that sushi itch that you just have to scratch if you're in the area!
author: Sean H.

description: I order the dragon roll and rainbow roll for my friend and they are tested great! Next time I will order more and sit inside to eat here!
author: Momoko S.

description: Walking around from my hotel on a business trip looking to be mesmerized by a local joint I happened upon Sushi Toni.  Very good experience from the sushi bar where I sat to the tantalizing food I consumed.  The chef's sashimi was fresh and oh so tasty and the Dragon roll was perfect!  I will be back and highly recommend a chat with Rogelio if you stop by!
author: Jeff C.

description:
Very good sushi and decently priced! I had the black and white roll and the spicy sauce was really good with the shrimp tempura in the center.
This place doesn't have the most romantic atmosphere, but it's good food, friendly staff, and really fast service! I was in and out in less than 15 minutes.
author: Stephanie P.

description: This is a hole in the wall in the best way.  The service was great. The food was spot on. Who could ask for more?
author: Amy S.

description: Been passing this place for month before finally deciding to give it a try. The place is a bit nondescript but the sushi is surprisingly good! They have many different types of rolls and the price is fairly good.
author: Michelle C.

description: I like the quality of the sushi here but unfortunately the variety is very limited. I'm a huge fan of raw fish-seaweed rolls, but unfortunately most of the items on the menu is either soy bean paper rolls or baked rolls. Another down side is, it only opens after 5pm. Worth trying but I prefer Maru sushi which is right around the corner and is open 11am-11pm.
author: Selen A.

description:
Very good food!

The Dragon and the swamp roll are excellent!

I will come back again when in town
author: krista t.

description:
I try sushi everywhere I go because I'm an addict but it's been the first time I've been disappointed tasting sushi when traveling. The rolls just weren't that amazing. Got two signature rolls which were pretty mediocre. The regular spicy tuna roll was alright too. 
However, my brother got the chicken teriyaki plate and it was super delicious!
author: Laura T.

description:
Sushi Toni was an alright place for Japanese food, but I do believe that there are better places to go for Japanese food in the area. In terms of atmosphere, it feels a little bit off for some reason that I can't fully pinpoint. But in terms of the food, it's a very average place. I got shrimp tempura, edamame, and chicken teriyaki and there was nothing special about any of those dishes.

The prices were decent so I guess that's one thing the restaurant has going for it, but I probably would not eat there again considering the other Japanese restaurants that were in the area.
author: Michael L.

description:
Trying to find decent, authentic, non-touristy sushi around Downtown SF is more difficult than expected. We finally settled on Akiko but had problems locating the hidden, nondescript storefront; we made our way inside, only to find that it was packed before 6pm and that reservations one week in advance are recommended o.O You can thus imagine our gratefulness to find the no-frills, authentic-looking Sushi Toni with no wait (there was a wait ~7pm when we left! I have a theory that the crowd always follows us)

In our post-SF-explorations hunger, we splurged on 2 appetizers and 2 rolls--looking at the extensive menu with pictures of specialty rolls just makes you hungrier.

(+) Hamachi kama $12.50: Quite tender (though I've had better) and decent portion. You have to poke around to find the fleshy parts... I've never understood fish anatomy, especially the kama (collar)
(+/-) Spinach oshitashi $5.50: Tasty with the tangy sesame sauce, but gone in a few bites. Such elusive oshi.
(++) Caterpillar roll $11.50: Perfect balance of avocado and eel. The generous avo adds a nice buttery taste and texture.
(+++) Lion King roll $10.50: Baked mozzarella cheese in a sushi roll sounds strange to me every time, but the Lion King is the comfort food of sushi rolls and Toni's version is flavorful and delightfully savory... like crab mac n cheese in fusion sushi roll form.

Service is friendly--we received an extremely sincere apology when there was a bit of the wait for the food. As you would expect, the server was a very nice mama-san, and the place has a family-run vibe.

Overall, the food is good and the restaurant is clean. I would suggest going for sushi/sashimi and passing on appetizers, which are quite pricey and were responsible for racking up the bill to ~$45 for 2. (But then again, when have appetizers ever been a bargain? Why do I never learn)

Fun fact: This reminds me of my favorite sushi place in Mountain View, called Sushi Tomi (also no-frills and authentic). I wonder if Toni and Tomi are cousins :3
author: Edna C.

description: Small sushi place with decent sushi. I'm not going to lie, expected more from San Francisco as far as fish quality goes but this did suffice for the evening. The service was great and the food came out in a timely manner. We would go back but it won't be our first pick.
author: Diana G.

description: Great small place for quality fresh sushi. If you are looking for a pretencious spot go somewhere else, but if your focus is on the sushi you will enjoy Toni's.
author: Alejandro V.

description:
Super casual place conveniently located downtown in the touristy center of San Francisco. The rolls are pretty decent size and they're delicious. 

My sister and I came here for dinner on a whim after watching some swing dancers at Union Square Park on a chilly SF summer day. 

We shared the pan-fried chicken gyoza to start - you get 6 dumplings. We then shared 3 different rolls. 

Volcano Roll - which comes out hot. I've never had hot sushi rolls before, so it was a bit of a surprise. But it actually worked and tasted delicious. 

Rainbow Roll - awesome

Dragon Roll - also awesome. 

The fish was very fresh, the rolls are filling, and the service was polite and efficient. 

This restaurant is really casual and plain. Not sure I'd come here on a first date! Good sushi!
author: Priti K.

description: After searching yelp for some much needed sushi, we landed here at sushi Toni. Only regret is that we ate wayyyy too much sushi, but we couldn't help it! The sushi was great, and we were shocked at our bill because it was super cheap for all the food we ate. Amazing stop for sushi!
author: Samara R.

description: Sushi Toni is a cute quaint little spot that was right across from the hotel we stayed at in San Fran. I was pretty impressed by the uni and had some pretty good udon. Romeo and Juliet roll and Black and White roll are highly recommended. Cute graphic shirts for souvenirs too if you're interested.
author: Kim M.

description:
Really had a good time at this restaurant last night. Good, affordable, and inventive sushi rolls that I haven't had anywhere else. Get the cilantro roll - it has thin sliced lime on top. It's my absolute favorite. 

The head chef is really cool and approachable. Give this place a try in the Union Square area. I wouldn't recommend going with a group larger than 4 since it's a small place.
author: Wesley M.

description:
Don't let the divey facade and inside atmosphere deceive you-- this place is legit!  

The service was prompt and very friendly.  The menu is very informative and contains photos for the sushi rolls.  This was very helpful to me because the menu contains some very nontraditional and creative rolls. 

We ordered the cucumber salad and two rolls.  The portions were perfect for a lighter dinner for two.  I strongly recommend the cucumber salad-- holy cats that was good!  It helps offset the starch and protein intake from the rolls.  We ordered the Philly and Volcano rolls.  The Volcano roll takes an extra 20 minutes to prepare because it's baked.  Both the rolls were very rich and satisfying.  

I hope to be back to try more rolls.  Oh, and to have some sake, heck yeah, sake.
author: Andrea H.

description:
Would post worse but I have to give one - horrible rude service ! Makes a dining out experience that you have to pay for feel like a slap in the face -  if you are into that kind of thing !!!
Too many other options to ever go back '
author: H-D E.

description:
I came here with my boyfriend around 9:30 pm. When we got there we got seated pretty quickly. I had to wait in line at the bathroom. There is one bathroom and it is unisex, it was pretty clean. I give kudos to places with clean restaurants. Anyways I came out and they asked if I was ready to order. The green tea there is good, except the service of waiter/wAitress is slow. I don't like places where I have to constantly call them to refill my tea. At any location, on average I can drink 7-8 cups of tea if not more. So at this location I only drank 2 cups and I had to request one time which is kind of disappointing. Anyways, we ordered 3 rolls California, Hannukah, and family affair. The California came wkrh6 pieces, overall it was great. The only thing was that the wasabi was not that strong, it was very under powered and eating a scoop is completely doable. Next came the family affair roll, wow it looked like a master piece of artwork. I really enjoyed taking pictures of it, the taste was unique as the top was spicier than the wasabi. I loved the sprouts on top, I felt like it was very well made. Next, we wanted to try another roll and my bf picked Hannukah it's made of salmon and salmon skin. When it came we were kind of surprised. The salmon skin was inside the roll and the top of the salmon was topped with 2 popping balls. I felt like it was very interesting, but the taste was a bit too strong for me, it was a little too salty. 

Overall if you ask me, I suggest iyakaza ninja that is a block away for some better sushi.
author: Amy Y.

description: I ended up here because Sanroku was full and was a 30+ minute wait for one person. The waitress first tried to seat me at a dirty table with the dishrag on it and old napkins, too, when there were plenty of other spots open. I elected to sit at the bar instead. I ordered a chirashi (sashimi over rice, usually 2-3 pieces of fish per type of fish). If this wasn't the most stingy chirashi I've ever eaten...they threw about 5 pieces of thin-ass low-quality fish plus a shrimp onto some rice that was a bukakke of furikake. And for $27? Ain't nobody about to order more food to get full JUST because of their withholding-sushi ass. How about most other sushi spots where this costs $20, you get more sashimi, better quality sashimi, and better types of fish? Don't waste your money here.
author: Jacob J.

description: Got quite a few rolls which were mostly rice with very thin fish slices. Was pretty upset about it since we are on west coast where fish are fresher. Business seems pretty good as people kept coming in.
author: Ivan C.

description:
By SF standards - very mediocre place.
Rolls that are not very creative or even traditional, with way too much rice and not that much fish.
Sashimi was fresh - that's about it.
author: victoria c.

description: Great, unpretentious, sushi with good prices. Had a quiet family dinner with great service. Fish was very fresh!
author: Sharlynn C.

description: We started with green salad, gyoza, and edamame. Then had a Philadelphia roll and a swamp roll. Everything was ok, nothing to write home about. Rolls were on the small side and I left still hungry (average appetite, not a huge eater) Everyone in the restaurant was friendly and attentive plus it was very clean (including the restroom!). There's an interesting adult venue next door if that's your thing. We walked but I imagine parking would be tricky.
author: Mysti R.

description:
Sushi itself was good quality and well constructed. 
However.
When we walked in it was pretty busy. full tables but no line. so we ordered to-go. 1 roll, 1 sashimi. They didn't give us a predicted time. MORE than 30 minutes later we didn't have our to-go order. If it's going to take that long let me know, i'll wander the street or get a drink.

GF friends- Be aware the rainbow roll has tempura. This was a surprise to me, but i'm from seattle and maybe we just do it differently up there. 

Between the long wait and accidently ingesting an allergen, i'm sad to say i'm not impressed. my tips?

- if you're getting to-go, call ahead.
- read THE WHOLE description. they have taken some license on the classics.
author: Bonnie B.

description: We got there after a long day in sf ready to eat. They accommodated my shellfish allergy amazingly. Once my food came I ate two pieces of my rolls and noticed a hair in my roll. Grossed out I told my waitress who brought it into the back and I asked to get a new roll. She brings me my roll and then once i start eating She BRINGS THE HAIR BACK AND PLACES IN ON A NAPKIN IN FRONT OF ME. she told me that it wasn't her hair or anyone that works there and told me that there would be no compensation. So when I left I paid my bill and decided not to tip because of how she handled the situation. I am usually a generous tipper because I am a waitress. My friends WERE TIPPING. Then the waitress came back up to us and said it wasn't okay that I didn't tip because "they don't work for free".  And started trying to guilt trip us, which is extremely unpleasant. All and all it was a pretty bad experience and pretty gross.
author: Charlee L.

description:
Tasty Japanese food in Downtown! 

FOOD: My friend and I shared the Dynamite boom roll ($12.5), the Dragon roll ($14.5), and Tamago ($4). I really liked the dynamite roll, which had unagi, lobster, and a bunch of other things topped with a nice spicy sauce. It was my first time having tamago, which is suppose to be sweet dish. The egg block tasted sweet but we are suppose to still dip it in soy sauce and wasabi. Not bad though. 

SERVICE: We came in a party of 8 and the staff worked hard to bring all of our dishes out in a timely fashion, which I really appreciated. 

SETTING: The restaurant is pretty small and doesn't look too fancy. It's located on one of the hills close to Union Square, so any time you are craving for Japanese food you know where to go.

PRICE: With tip and tax we each paid around $18. Japanese food is suppose to be pricey so I wasn't too surprised. 

OVERALL IMPRESSION: Pretty good sushi, but I think I had better quality and quantity food back home in Texas so my standards are pretty high.
author: Wendy F.

description:
Summary:
Miso soup costs extra. One roll was excellent and the other was subpar. The atmosphere and service were less than okay, and the price was less than okay.  Go find somewhere else, as there are literally dozens of other options! 

I had a hankering for sushi, and Sushi Toni seemed to be a decent place to try, being close and supposedly cheap. It was really cool that their website had a digital copy of the menu, so I was able to take some extra time to look through and think about what I wanted to eat. 

Service:
I got there at around 5:20, as they open at 5pm. There were two other single customers sitting at the bar finishing up their meals, so I took a seat at the bar and waited! I should note that I made it all the way to almost being seated before a staff member addressed me, even though the chefs were behind the bar chopping away. I was helped rather quickly though and my food was prepared quickly, so that was nice! However, it seemed a little odd to be sitting right across the counter with the sushi chefs and never interact with them save for getting my plate handed to me. The staff didn't seem to give off a particularly welcoming attitude, and the sushi chefs were practically silent the entire time I was there!

Food:
I ordered a bowl of miso soup to start along with a spicy yellowtail roll and a specialty caterpillar roll. The miso soup was pretty good, although the tofu had no solidity at all. I guess that is just a preference though. I think I also bit into a piece of onion in the soup, which was an interesting addition I hadn't come across before. 

The rolls were very interesting, to say the least. Really hit-or-miss. The spicy yellowtail roll came in six pieces and was pretty poorly rolled, unfortunately. Two or three of the pieces had the wrapper visibly cutting into the center of the roll, and fell apart upon picking up. They tasted okay though, but were nothing spectacular. 

The caterpillar roll, on the other hand, was really good! A true sushi experience. In terms of texture, there's sliced avocado on the top that is super creamy and delicious, and the roll itself had a good mix of crunch and fish. In terms of flavor, it was something else. My first bite was unexpectedly sweet, and the remainder of the 7 pieces was similarly sweet and filled with flavor and texture. It was great!

However, that bowl of miso soup, a regular roll, and a specialty roll ended up being over $21 for just me, so it definitely wasn't the cheapest sushi I've ever had (which was two starters, miso soup, two regular rolls and three specialty rolls for ~$50 between two people)
author: John B.

description: They didn't really have a good selection of sushi, it felt pretty dirty inside, the waitress reached over us to grab the phone, the sushi was pretty good, the water was super gross. Altogether not really a fun experience.
author: Meghan H.

description:
Good value, sushi is fresh, but its super-sized rather than refined.
Nigiri is meant to be eaten in one delightful melt in your mouth moment.
If its too big you almost need a steak knife to eat it without gagging,
which defeats the purpose of nigiri style.
author: David T.

description: Stopped by here for a quick bite to eat before a show.  The place is a little grungy and old.  The chirashi is a bit overpriced, with the fish being ALRIGHT. I guess it's not the MOST overpriced sushi place considering the location.  Does the job in a pinch but I wouldn't go out of my way to come back
author: Gloria S.

description:
I have been craving udon curry for so long and haven't found a good one yet. Yelp reviews are so confusing plus not many option for Japanese restaurants (affordable one). Finished packing and gathering miscellaneous stuff, I had 4 hours to spend and was hungry with no curry. Seriously, any yelpers read this review, pls recommend a good place for udon curry and noodle in general that also offer sushi (basic rolls are fine).
Anyhow, while swiping through yelp, I realized I had bookmarked Sushi Toni for quite awhile and never been. The reviews are completely opposite, some are extremely positive and some are even 1 star only. Oh well, I decided to give it a taste and did not regret at all.
First of all, the place is cozy and lovely, unlike others yelped that too small or corky. The sushi chef and most of the staff are Koreans, except for two Mexican sous chef. I guess, they just make the name Japanese;) but knowing they are Koreans, I was relief coz some reviews said they were sick or so after eating. However, Koreans are known for their cleanliness and details (well, most of them). My ex is a heavy case of OCD :))
*I came about 6pm so the place wasn't that crowded. Waiter seated and watered me right away. Food took less than five mins to be served. Oh my Gosh, de-lizzz. Who ever said the portion was small are greedy. They are just fine. You probably order a Cali roll, the biggest of them all, but usually, rolls are not supposed to be to big. A even mouth size is fine. I love it! Like many recommendation, Romeo-Ju rolls are the best!!! Must try. Salmons were fresh. Yellowtail fin weren't so much but taste alright. I had a bit fun with myself and ordered as I would usually go for sushi weekend one a month. Waiter came check on me several times to see if I wanted to cancel any dish ('coz he thought I ordered too much ;)) he even recommended to cancel my tempura noodle) man, I can eat more than my body look ;))
Friendly atmosphere, I ended up having a great conversation with a couple and their daughter, who recently got a job in SF so she moved from NYC to here, whereas I am about to move to NYC. The family was fun and lovely. 
A great experience for my last night in the city life. ;) will come back for some excellent rolls
author: Bao V.

description: Was really expecting better after some of the reviews. Miso was tasty but didn't have any of the tofu or seaweed bits that you want. Cucumber and seaweed salad was partially frozen and swimming in melted water. Veggie tempura arrived w undercooked soggy batter. The rainbow roll was good but much more rice than fish. The spicy tuna hand rolls come as a tuna mince w siracha (no mayo) so they tasted dry. Service was good and we thanked her for working a holiday. Extra star for leaving a Scrooge review on christmas
author: Jenna S.

description:
We YELPed for a good sushi place open on Sunday in San Francisco that wouldn't break the bank, and we are so glad that we decided on Sushi Toni. 

Sushi Toni has a nice, cozy and authentic vibe, and the service was exceptional! There are maybe ten tables and a sushi bar, so it is great for an intimate date or dinner.  We had our 8 month old daughter with us and they even helped navigate our stroller in and out of the restaurant! So polite and attentive throughout the meal. 

Sushi was tasty and reasonably priced. We will certainly be returning!
author: Peter L.

description:
My husband and I had dinner here one night during a recent trip to SF. Not being from the area, of course I went to Yelp for a recommendation. 

We were there on a Thursday evening around dinner time and the place was pretty dead. Only one other table had customers at it. I was hoping that this was just an off day and not a testament to the quality of food, but we were greeted and sat right away. 

Overall the service was pretty good. I wouldn't say the restaurant was dirty, but I also wouldn't say it was super clean either. The building and furniture are just older and it's starting to show. It also wasn't the best sushi I had, but it came out quickly and the price was good. 

If I lived in SF near here, I could definitely see popping back in here for a casual dinner.
author: Kristy P.

description:
Sushi Toni, where everybody knows your name.

Or at least, where everyone knew my name because the only people here late on a Sunday evening were a couple of creeps I had been trying to avoid, drinking in the back. I suppose you could call them "friends" of mine, but I was definitely hoping never to see them again.*

They had already finished eating, but the sweet, competent server had no problem with me joining them and ordering up a little food. Under the intense scrutiny of said creeps, I panicked and ordered a Dragon Roll, which can only be called 'sushi' in the loosest sense of the term (this thing has crab, avocado, eel, shrimp tempura, cucumber, tobiko, eel sauce, green onion, and sesame on it). I added on some shumai because shumai is what I order when I want gyoza but think I've been too unhealthy lately.

And it all tasted pretty good. 

Overall, Sushi Toni is affordable, conveniently located, and not bad at all. I'd come back, but only if I was sure my creepy friends weren't there this time. 
_____________

*I will send them this review, and hopefully they'll take the hint.
author: Peter D.

description: Went after a long day at SF Pride! Was cautious that it might be overrun with people after Pride, but we were seated right away. We ordered the Rainbow Roll, a salmon sashimi dinner, and the Family Affair Roll. The Rainbow Roll was interesting because they used a shrimp tempura instead of crab for the inside. Definitely made it more memorable and was very enjoyable, a good twist on the usual Rainbow roll. The salmon sashimi dinner was 9 pieces with a bowl of white rice. We mostly just ate the sashimi by itself and it was very tender and melted in your mouth. Sometimes sashimi is a bit tough and cold, and this was not that, very good indeed. The Family Affair Roll had white tuna on top and red tuna inside. It had sprouts and onions as well on top and was very good and fresh as well. Overall, a nice dinner to relax after walking around all day. A good casual, inexpensive spot for dinner if you're around Market street for dinner and don't want to pay $$$.
author: Isabel C.

description:
Seriously?  We got yelled at by the sushi chef because the "fresh" hamachi tasted bad.  There were 5 of us and we all tasted it and agreed.  The chef started yelling at the waitress (making sure we heard) and said something in his language and she sent it right back and she said "he said he just cut it" and placed it back on our table.   We were forced to keep it and eat it.  (Which we did not eat).  

I told the waitress that I thought that was SO rude.  Please send the check.  The chef finally comes out after we pay for our bill and asks "wait... did you order hamachi or something else"? I said "What does it matter?  You come out after we pay the bill?  You yell at us, send the food back expecting us to eat it?  That's RUDE! It's not like we have never eaten this type of food before.  We know what bad fish tastes like and we can't all be wrong at our table.  We are the customers."  At that point I didn't care what he had to say.   All this over a measly 2 piece nigiri.  

Psshhhhh.... We will NOT be coming back! 

If you decide to come here... think twice on sending your food back.
author: Delilah B.

description:
I'm pretty sure the guy that put my 49ers Roll together was only using one hand because that ish was more delicate than a Faberge egg 

I think I got *maybe* one piece in my mouth whole and the rest ended up a very deconstructed version of what sushi normally is. I basically would have been better off if they'd given me a spoon instead of chopsticks.

I loved my massive bottle of Asahi so much that I think I might have finished all 22oz in like 4 minutes... which I do not feel effected my ability to use chopsticks or properly eat the sushi, though it did seem odd that literally every single piece fell apart as soon as I touched it.

The 49ers roll was good but I'm also a sucker for thinly sliced lemon on my soosh so that played a big role in my feelings towards the 49er. 

The staff here are pretty sweet. They let me and my hobo friend stay here for hours after we'd finished and let us add a third and open up a new bill after we'd already settled up once. 

I don't know if I'll find myself back here often with so many options in the city, but this isn't a bad spot to soak in some extra large beers and sushi on the fly.
author: Candice G.

description: so happy this place is open til midnight!! they served us pretty quickly. the chicken potstickers were good and the 49ers roll was good as well. will definitely have to come back when i'm in the city again
author: Ruth V.

description: Delicious sushi. I got the Rainbow Roll,  Red Dragon Roll, tuna roll and edamame. All were great and I'd def recommend this place.
author: jordan s.

description:
Sushi Toni is an interesting spot. It has a divey atmosphere, and the menus look like something that a fast-food restaurant designed, but the sushi and service was decent. The prices as well were excellent, especially given the location is within walking distance of a lot of main hotels near the Union Square area. 

The inside was dim when we arrived for dinner around 7pm, and jsut missed happy hour. The place wasn't packed, but it was definitely busy, and the waitress sat us and took our drink orders right away. The hubs and I split several different roles, and the food and service was all around fine. I wasn't blown away by anything, but nothing was bad either. Our glasses were kept full, and our bellies filled up quickly as well once the rolls started coming. 

For the two of us to eat 5 rolls and 2 beers, it came out to a little less than $50 total- total win in my book. It might not be sushi that will change your life, but if you're hungry and looking for a place to eat, Sushi Toni isn't a bad stop.
author: Melinda R.

description: When in SF without a thought this has been the finest Sushi place. It is the "go to" owned and operated by a wife and husband combination. The fish is always fresh and extremely well prepared. It's not a fancy place but the fresh food overtakes the atmosphere. Usually the owners are on premise and make sure you are happy. If you're not a Sushi knowledgeable person just ask Toni to make suggestions that you should try and he will assist you with your selections based on your tastes.
author: Hugh B.

description: Super delicious black and white roll and vegetable tempura roll!!!  We had the warm sake too, and there is nothing more satisfying than warm rice wine!  We will definitely be back!
author: Amanda G.

description: Foods really good! Their rolls are actually very tasty I can taste the difference from each roll that I ordered! Staff is very friendly as well! I really enjoyed my dinner here I will for sure come back.
author: Mimi P.

description:
i had the lion king roll ($10.50) and the salmon/avocado roll ($7.50). the former was so creamy and rich that i had a hard time tasting everything else, and the latter had so much avocado that the salmon got lost.

the portions were super small; in what world is 6 pieces of a lion king roll worth $10.50? sushi can be expensive (hi, sugarfish), but when the fish is super high quality, not run of the mill stuff.
author: Heather F.

description:
Quick, tasty and pretty! 

Small restaurant space but not crammed. We were seated immediately. We order weed and got our sushi in less than ten minutes. Beautiful presentation! It wasn't the BEST sushi I have ever had but it was so satisfying. Like it really hit the spot. Great place for tourists!
author: Ashley H.

description: Bento boxes aren't worth it. I got the chicken teriyaki, tempura, and California roll. It was little over $18 and there wasn't a lot of food and it wasn't high quality. Got two rolls but they were not worth the price. Overall, not a great value for the food.
author: Tiffany O.

description: I ordered from them to go couple of times. Always fresh and tasty. Prices are reasonable, especially for union square. Very friendly and fast.
author: Daria M.

description: If you want very fresh sushi, come here. Good, quick service despite the pretty small space. I absolutely enjoyed the Dragon Roll and would recommend it as the first roll for you to try.
author: Safiya N.

description: Not a ton of seating, but staff is attentive and friendly. Sushi is excellent and very reasonably priced! Great atmosphere! Showed up here after a long flight from the Midwest needing a bite before crashing. Fit the bill perfectly!
author: Ben D.

description: My girlfriend and I had the best salmon sashimi, maybe it was the fish they received that day but damn, melted like butter in your mouth! Will definitely come back again!
author: Don N.

description:
Recently my friends and I were looking for a place to grab dinner after work. One of them suggested "a pretty solid sushi place with no wait near my apartment" to which I responded "There's no wait? That's crazy. Let's go!" And that's how we ended up at Sushi Toni at 6:30pm on a Wednesday. And he was right, there were plenty of empty tables! How does a place in SF have 4 stars and still plenty of empty tables at dinnertime, I have no idea. I'm actually a little worried that if I write this review and hype it up too much, that might change...

In any case, Sushi Toni serves pretty decent sushi at pretty decent prices. It's pretty unassuming and a little hard to find, but in a good location near downtown. The atmosphere is quiet, calm, and "homey." Definitely nothing fancy, but I appreciate that (and I think it's reflected in the prices). The sushi is pretty high-quality and fresh, with well-portioned sizes. The rolls have a bit too much flavoring/sauces for my taste, but I could tell the fish was pretty fresh. Probably just means I should order nigiri next time. In any case, I think the food is more along the lines of 3.5 stars, but I'm bumping up to 4 just because of how easy it is to just walk in and get seated.

Head over to Sushi Toni when you want a convenient and quick fix of sushi without busting your wallet.
author: Brittany C.

description: I loved this place!  Nothing special just good, solid Japanese food at a great price. I got the chicken teriyaki bento and we got a couple of rolls.  Mine came with four pieces of tempura and miso and a salad and a few pieces of California roll. My spouse got the teriyaki salmon. I never order salmon at a restaurant that doesn't specialize in seafood. This salmon was very fresh. We both thoroughly enjoyed our meal here. Plus it was close to our hotel. We'll definitely come back here the next time we're in town.
author: kathy m.

description: This place was only a couple of Susji joints open late downtown.  What a find the place was packed when we arrived at 10:30.  The rolls where priced right and the food was 5 stars.  We will be back
author: Johnny W.

description:
Oh my god!!! it's very very good. I almost cry when I ate my first bite. I'm a sushi lover, I eat sushi once a week.

this place serve u very good and fresh food. it's so awesome!!!!! I love this place. 

Naruto, 49er and cilantro roll are the BOMB!!!!
author: Duangta M.

description: This is a really nice sushi spot. Not very big. But didn't seem too Crowded a Friday night. The fish was great and it was very well made at tasty. Will come back.
author: Sisse L.

description:
I love this place. Your quintessential sushi restaurant, complete with framed anime posters, a good roll selection and kitschy t-shirts.

My boyfriend and I were looking for sushi close by and as others have said, that's surprisingly difficult in one of the busiest areas of the city. We were desperately hungry, so my expectations were low, but I was pleasantly surprised when we were greeted with excellent customer service and seated right away. The food was good, I had the swamp roll and he had the sushi combo. I am the most heinous person to take an order from because I am gluten free, but our server handled my questions like a champ. He even, unprompted, brought out a bottle of gluten free soy sauce. Gluten free soy sauce!! It's a thing, and as a wheat-averse person, I was almost moved to tears. 

I also thought the prices were very fair, maybe even cheap for San Francisco, at least in my experience. Yayyy sushi toni!!!
author: Kathryn P.

description:
I have really mixed feelings about this place ... I'll break it out into a few categories. 

Atmosphere: 6/10
The decor was interesting, weird yellow sponge paint that was a little assaulting to the senses, and an eclectic mix of picture frames filled with images of either animated Japanese schoolgirls, stills from Pokemon, or cuts of fish. The music seemed incongruous as well and featured a mish-mash of late 80's/early 90's one hit wonders. If you like to listen to *slightly too loud for conversation* ABBA, New Radicals and hear "Come on Eileen" at least twice in the span of a meal, this is certainly your place. 

Service: 3/10
They seemed genuinely concerned and kept asking how we were and if everything was ok while we were eating our appetizers (miso soup and salad) but that seemed to expire very shortly as it took over 30 minutes for me to receive my SINGULAR roll. My boyfriend however received his Chicken Katsu in about 5 minutes which lead to him picking at it for 25 minutes as it got cold to be polite and wait for me. When I asked the waitress what the deal was, it seemed that she forgot to put the order in, and as soon as she went up to check with the sushi chef it was miraculously ready in seconds. 

Food: 8/10
I was angry eating by the time I received my food, but it was truly very good quality. The sushi rice was nicely spiced and adequately sour, and the crab salad and spicy tuna were of better quality than most comparably priced locations.  

So if you are an extremely patient ABBA loving sushi connoisseur with a penchant for the color yellow, be sure to hit up this spot. If not ... don't .
author: Hailey H.

description: This is one of the most underrated sushi places in SF in my opinion. The food is great. The place has a no fussing and cozy ambience
author: Martha S.

description: Incredibly fast service and reasonable prices with fresh and tasty sushi. We were driving around struggling to find somewhere to park when we found this just a couple blocks from a parking garage. Cozy atmosphere for small groups.
author: Travis T.

description:
Fast service, cozy environment, and reasonable prices for being so close to touristy Union Square. 

Lion King roll: BF gave it a 5/5. The combo of warm crab, lemony goodness from the salmon, and melted mozzarella cheese was a delicious change from the cold rolls he ordered.

Yum Yum roll: A 5/5 from me! So crunchy and so yum yum. The sauces and crunch added to the cool taste of avocado and crab. 

We also ordered a standard Philadelphia roll, shrimp and crab roll, and a shrimp and asparagus roll. The three were a bit small but still good and fresh-tasting. 

I'm sure we'll be back again, Sushi Toni! I look forward to visiting again.
author: Marissa F.

description:
Great place for decent priced sushi. My brother and mother and I came here Monday night to dine in. We ordered the beef teriyaki dinner set, Nabe udon, Romeo and Juliet roll, black and white roll and unagi nigiri. 
Lets start off with what was good. The romeo+Juliet roll was really good. I recommend it to evertone. The black and white roll was good too, I like the amount of spice they add to it. I just enjoyed the romeo and Juliet a lot more, though. The unagi nigiri is just like anywhere you can go for sushi. I would come back here if I'm ever in the neighborhood, but that's probably not going to be often. The service here was meh, we did come an hour before closing, so that could be why.
author: cadence p.

description:
First time here and tried two sushi rolls.
Yum yum roll is crunchy and creamy and the 49er roll is refreshing. The miso soup and salad are also good! 

The service is good but kind of slow with the orders. We had a part of 6 so it may have been that but we all got our orders 10 mins apart.
author: Marilee A.

description:
Sushi Toni is cramped in a small, low lit area that feels close to the street while you're inside. The atmosphere gets a 1 out of 10 from me. My boyfriend and I agreed to stay simply because we were starving, really wanted sushi and it was Christmas Day so not a lot else was open. 

The sushi itself was alright. Of course it tasted good, but it wasn't the freshest, cleanness fish I've ever had at a sushi place. And their selection of rolls didn't excite me. We asked for a recommendation of a deep fried roll and the waitress recommended a roll that turned out not to be deep fried but rather just topped with odd deep fried bits of crunch, which I personally did not enjoy. 

What I can say is that the service was fast! I was so impressed with how every time we finished one roll they would bring out another at almost the exact moment every time. I don't know if this was dumb luck or excellent planning but we were never sitting there hungry wondering where our food was. 

Overall :
Atmosphere - 1/10
Sushi- 5/10
Service- 8/10
author: Tamara S.

description:
One of my go to sushi spots in this area. The fish is fresh, prices are reasonable and there are always tables available.  The servers are all very nice and attentive. 
Tonight we had two miso soups, five orders of nigiri, two rolls and a bottle of sake for $70.
author: Gloria N.

description: One of the best sushi place's I've tried! It's located in downtown SF and it's a hole in a wall place. Pretty casual too. Toni, who is the owner/chef makes their sushi SO FRESH and tasteful. Everyone I ordered here melts in your mouth. They also have a great selection of sakes too! Great sushi, and not overly priced. Deff will come back here again! Thanks Toni!
author: Jenn L.

description: Delicious. I'm surprised at some of the negative reviews. The sushi, rolls, and nigiri were delicious. I tried the salmon and octopus nigiri and found it tasty with a good texture. Next up was the family affair roll which had a great fresh taste to it. I finished with the naruto roll. The naruto doesn't have rice so the favors are delicate. The service was spot on. Overall it was very good.
author: Nancy L.

description: It's a tiny restaurant, topical Japanese style! Nice and confortabile, you can sit at table and/or sushi bar! Roll are amazing: Delicious taste and very beautiful!!!
author: Elisa P.

description: The Lion King roll, BTL roll, and fried gyoza were very satisfying. The banana tempura with green tea ice cream hit just the spot. All of this plus non-exceptional service for a decent price. Not bad.
author: John F.

description:
My review is long overdue!  This restaurant has served us so well.  My husband and I met here while dating,  then got married and often visited.  Then got pregnant and often visited.  We have wonderful memories here since many years.  It is a small and cute place to eat some freshly prepared sushi and etc.  Given the awesome service that we receive each time,  we often visit this restaurant for special occasions too.  If you,  the owner is reading this,  then we want to let you know that we asked for you the last time we visited (which was last week) to let you know how much we love dining at Sushi Toni.

Coming back to Sushi,  we usually order the Cilantro Roll,  California Roll,  Lion King Roll and Donbura - all of which have the freshest seafood and taste fantastic. If I could give these guys 10 stars,  I would!  Please keep doing what you are doing.  We look forward to visiting your restaurant for decades and decades [ incl future generation :-) ]

Hats off to the owner for having such an  awesome restaurant and staff!  We are highly impressed by both their service and food each time.
author: Sun B.

description:
I came to eat here because of the good reviews. I've eaten at more sushi joints than most sane people so I'm giving it a rating in comparison and note that I generally only eat nigiri so that's what I'm reviewing. Maybe the rolls are awesome.  Anyways, I always start any sushi experience with a sake nigiri as I consider that to be the staple and I knew the experience was going to be sub-par from that first taste.  The sushi was meh.  Very little flavor and the texture was off.  Maybe the quality of the fish was low but I immediately regretted coming here.  I also ordered a green salad and it was drenched in dressing.  Way, way, way too much dressing.  

Service was great and the people very friendly.
author: John K.

description:
Can a person dream of sushi? Why, yes. Jiro dreams of sushi, and I have dreamed of sushi since my visit to Sushi Toni.

I was so excited to indulge my west coast sushi craving that I basically ran up to the sushi bar, where Rogelio was the sushi chef on duty. After establishing that his mother tongue is Mayan (WOW) I got in an order for some of the most delicious sushi of my life. Do you see me posting any pictures of it? No? Because I inhaled it immediately upon arrival. The best-prepared, most succulent and fresh sushi of my whole life. I've run into chewy sushi before, sometimes accompanied by lukewarm rice (I seriously just shuddered at the memory), and it's made me die a little bit inside. This fish was perfect. 

Mine was an insanely-priced dinner meal (under $25) for a roll and at least 8 pieces of sashimi. All the while Rogelio entertained me in Spanish, no less. We talked about his training, the insane cost of living in CA, and how to make it in America. The whole thing was a flippin delight.

Are you still reading this? You shouldn't be. You should be eating here. Or you could be reading this while eating here - that's also excusable. But if you're trying to choose between Sushi Toni and another place, you know where I stand on this issue.
author: Deji M.

description:
This is a small hole in the wall just two blocks north from Union Square. I am glad I read the reviews or I would have never walked into this place. Staff was very friendly and accommodating, portions were big enough for sharing and the flavor was the king of the night! Try the dragon roll; so fresh, so yummy, plenty of meat.
The green tea ice cream was good... The red bean ice cream not so much. They probably and most likely so not make it there... So they could easily switch brands.
Did I mention that it is VERY affordable?  
Did not give them 5 stars as the place could use a little renovation, especially the restroom and maybe the chairs. If they cleaned up some more I would have given it 5 stars.
author: Alejandro R.

description:
Sushi Toni is my first sushi experience in San Francisco and boy has it set the standard high. The rolls were all super fresh and delicious. All of the specialty rolls are to die for! The service can use some improvement however - We asked to be seated near a window where we saw an open table, but the waitress refused because she didn't want to serve that area.. in a tiny restaurant! 

Would highly recommend this place!
author: Taron G.

description:
Good food. Very polite service. Nothing elegant about this not very modern looking place.  

The menu is oldish but it seems like it has a good flow of customers. 

Great place to have a late bite when staying in the hotels
author: Gregg A.

description: Good place to grab some sushi if your in the area.  Relatively cheap for sushi.  Atmosphere and service was good.
author: Josh B.

description: I look forward to laundry only because on the way, bf treats me to Sushi Toni :) Every time we come here all their fish are fresh!  Staff usually welcomes us every time we enter and they are very attentive. Chirashi bowl and Naruto roll is always fresh and delish but not enough to fill me up. We usually get the other fulfilling rolls like dragon roll, rainbow roll and sake maki's (salmon basic roll). I think this is the only sushi place nearby that is fresh, affordable and gets us full! We are pretty much a regular here.
author: Sharmaine M.

description:
Ordered pick up on a Saturday night and was pleasantly surprised.

1. Quick service
2. Fresh fish and absolutely delicious rules (me and my boyfriend ended up playing "which roll is your favorite") 
3. Red dragon roll, lion King roll were our favorites

Ordered 5 rolls plus Gyoza for pick up and total came out to be $80 including a $6 tip.  Well worth the price to get my sushi fix and spend a great date night at home with my boo!
author: Anjoleen S.

description:
I got the White & Black Roll and the Salmon Teriyaki. Both were extremely delicious. I had never had this combination of fish on sushi and the result was divine! WOW. That salmon meat was cooked so so well. They served the salmon on a hot plate, which kept it and the vegetables warm and delicious. The service was quick and good. 

I did not like the decor of the place and the seats were kind of uncomfortable, but hey this is about food what am I talking about.
author: Vernita G.

description: Surprisingly good!  I ate solo here so did not try too much.  I had two rolls for dinner and they were excellent- yum yum and 49er.  I eat a lot of sushi and this place pleasantly surprised me.  Thanks to Yelp for the good recommendation.
author: Keith B.

description: Delicious! Very cute a friendly staff. My friend and I met up for food here and loved every bite and the ambiance was delightful
author: Reina G.

description:
Not a bad spot, not super memorable either. They use quality ingredients, the rice is sticky and soft.

Total $33 including tax/tip, for a light dinner for two.

* Romeo & Juliet roll - 3.5 stars
pic: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/sushi-toni-san-francisco?select=VmapT0TjLtfx5lmc2BPcfA#rPDS6zkIM16WF_au9zD92g
(soybean paper with salmon & avocado, scallop outside with tobika. $9.95)
I love salmon + avocado, and this had a hint of sweet flavoring.

* Single Sushi combo A ($15.50)
pic: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/sushi-toni-san-francisco?select=VmapT0TjLtfx5lmc2BPcfA
Just tried a piece of nigiri, and it was good! Can't really rate the whole thing based on one little piece but my friend enjoyed it and it's his go-to dish here.
author: Ziyan C.

description: I'm honestly not sure why this place has 4 stars. I got the "yum yum roll" and it was pretty horrible to be honest I was super disappointed since I took Uber just to get there I felt very ripped off. Total waste of money I can get way better sushi at many other places in the city. Sorry guys :-(
author: Rita A.

description:
I highly recommend going here for a quick bite. This place is not too much and not too little when it comes to a sushi restaurant. I came here on New Years Eve before going out for the night. My girlfriend and I needed a place to eat but didn't want to spend too much or waste a lot of time. There wasn't a wait for a table, the prices were competitive, and the servers were nice and responsive.

The food wasn't excellent or worth ranting about, but it was good. The food was good enough to be satisfied with our dinner and go on about our day. The service was polite and the experience overall was good. I if I am around the area and need a quick bite, I would definitely come back to this restaurant.
author: Brandon F.

description:
Got to the city for work. Wanted sushi. Wanted Akiko's on bush. Don't go. Rude and before I was finished, they hung up on me. 

But this. THIS Is one of the best, best places I've had. Chris at the sushi bar will rock. Your. World. 

Much, much better than Akiko's on bush!!
author: Paul B.

description:
Did not exceed my expectations at all. 
It is a small sushi restaurant and the owners are Korean. 
Sushi rolls were mediocre and they were definitely on the pricer end. 
The service was good though.
author: Brenda Jiwon L.

description: Not the freshest. Sashimi pieces were not big. Service is a bit weird. Price is not particularly cheap. For $14.5, the Uni nigiri was very disappointing. It was not fresh :(
author: E H.

description:
During our most recent visit to San Francisco, I was seriously craving some legitimate sushi. Sushi Toni was just a couple of streets up from where we were staying, so weren't in.

The place is cozy, but not cramped, and has a nice, small bar area, which is where we sat. The servers and the chefs were all very nice and fast to deliver. 

We ordered the Crunchy Roll, which was in the shape of a star (bonus points for awesomeness), a Philadelphia Roll and a Volcano Roll.

First of all - everything was SO fresh! From the rice, to the fish and crab to the ginger. Potions were perfectly sized and everything was uniquely crafted. Also, I was really enjoying watching the chefs prepare everything - plus, they're hilarious.

If you're in the area and want some good, late-night sushi, this place is where its at.
author: Molly M.

description:
I'm a some what fan.   Pretty good sushi and decent menu.  I really liked the location to our hotel and with in walking distance to just about anywhere in the bay.

Fresh fish is important to come by.  I do wish they had more options in regards to spicy!  We really loved the different rolls however, no spicy.  I did ask about a spicy roll and the server said she can make any roll spicy.   Still a good experiance and good times.
author: Robbie S.

description:
Came here with my hubby and we didn't even eat! We pretended we got a call and had to urgently leave! 

First of all the place was dead empty at around 2:30pm. We sat at the bar, and as we looked as the fish in front of us we knew we had to leave. The fish looked old and not all appetizing. The tuna and salmon looked brownish as if they were sitting there for days! 

And on top of that, the sushi chef was not Japanese! We didn't even wanted to try the food, we just bailed!
author: Tamara S.

description:
As good as I remember it.  

I only get to visit about once a year, and when I do I make a point to visit Sushi Toni. It's a quaint little place that is always jumping. The sushi is fresh and you can beat it.
author: Lenny F.

description: Great sushi. We walked in based on good yelp reviews. It was very empty which always makes you suspicious. But the sushi was fresh and very good. Toni is the chef and he completely interacts with us at the bar, which I love. Nothing worse than having the chef in front of you but having to order fish from the waitress.
author: Jeff H.

description: Found this place just down the block from our hotel. I'm not a big sushi person, so I got the chicken teriyaki platter which came with miso soup and salad with a delicious ginger dressing. The wife got a California roll and a Philly roll. My platter was delicious. The soup and salad came out quickly and by the time I finished enjoying, my teriyaki was at the table. The teriyaki was served on a sizzling platter, similar to fajitas and was on a bed of vegetables. It was fantastic! My wife loved her sushi and said it was some of the freshest she's ever tasted. The dining area was a bit small, but it wasn't crowded, so no issue there. The service was extremely friendly. At one point, a couple came in and left their dog outside. One of the workers went outside with a treat and cold water in a bowl for the dog. I thought that was sweet!
author: Tawny A.

description: Love this place.  Casual sushi bar near Union Square.  I was in San Francisco last week and went there twice.  The sushi is always fresh and the staff is always attentive.  Would recommend the Cilantro Roll.
author: David M.

description: This isn't the most exquisite sushi in SF but if you want good, fresh and relatively cheap rolls, udon and more, check this Nob Hill home in the wall place. Phenomenal service plus cocktails, saki and vino.
author: Linda G.

description:
This has customarily become my second stop after arriving in town. I get off the train from the airport, I drop my stuff at my hotel, and I go grab dinner at Sushi Toni. Why? Because it's convenient, the people are friendly, I don't feel rushed, and the food is solid. Every time I come here and sit down at the bar, I know that there will soon be a cold beer in my hand and fish in my face.

Is it the best sushi in the world, or even that I've ever eaten? No, I can't say honestly that it is. But it's good. And comfortable. And no matter what, I always end up looking forward to dropping in for a bite. Sushi Toni unerringly converts me from worn out traveler to having a smile on my face. What more can I ask?
author: Rob N.

description:
Korean owned sushi restaurant. Small, and intimate so probably a party of four max. 
House warm sake- $4 (S) $6.50 (L)
Spicy Tuna roll (6 pieces) - $7
Udon (vegetable and chicken)- $11-13
