The sushi was so fresh. I know spicy tuna roll, how wow could that get? BUT WOW. it wasn't the can tuna. It was actual cuts of good tuna. It melted in your mouth and they just have a way with their fish. Udon portions are large and the soup warmed me right up. It's not the kind of soup where it's just soy sauce and some other spices, it's actual udon soup. 

Service was great, server asked if he could take the dish with wasabi and ginger. I told him I liked to complement the udon with ginger and right away without me asking, he gave me a side dish of ginger. 

Def will be back to try the other rolls and sashimi!
author: Christina O.

description: Loved this place, very friendly staff and owner! The sushi was very good! Great little drop in spot
author: Kaylie L.

description:
This review is, ironically, not really about the sushi since I don't really eat sushi (I don't like seafood much).  So, take this review with a grain of salt.

This restaurant seems a little bit homey but divey at the same time.  It's dimly lit.  There's a sushi bar but of course you can sit out in the main area.

Their ikura (salmon roe) was rather fresh, which is great!  I did like their house salad and the dressing that came along with it.  Some Japanese places have really good dressing, and I'll put this one on that list.

The vegetable udon I got was rather bland.  The soup had no flavor and even after adding soy sauce I felt like I wasn't getting much out of the flavor (besides soy sauce, which is not really what you want from udon).  Definitely pass on this item.
author: Danielle C.

description: Loved my experience here. We arrived at about 9:45 and got seated right away by our friendly waitress. We got the sushi combo A, Dragon roll, rainbow roll, sake nigiri, unagi nigiri, and a couple appetizers and they all tasted great. The fish was quite fresh and the service here was amazing. Definitely will come back again.
author: Tim P.

description: Great rolls with a relaxed atmosphere. The family roll & swamp roll are great and you won't be disappointed with their chicken udon either.
author: Nate R.

description: Service was good, but got food poisoning the next morning, not pleasant.  Had the rainbow roll and yellowtail small roll (very little fish in the yellowtail roll, mostly rice)
author: Mike B.

description:
I LOVED this sushi place!! I'm a sushi fanatic so I'm very picky about my sushi, but their rolls were amazing! My sister got the avocado roll (very simple) and said it was the best roll she's ever had

I ordered the yum yum roll and the spicy tuna and the spicy tuna was so fresh and had amazing spices, you can tell the fish they get is fresh and the service was awesome!

We were in and out of there in no time but they do not rush you at all, I was incredibly pleased with the service there and I will 100% go back.
author: Jackie H.

description:
Don't know why they have such good reviews. Perhaps for their plates, but their rolls are subpar at best. 

We ordered a Dynamite Boom roll, and it came with both avacodo and fish, which were not listed as ingredients (it was supposed to be squid, octopus, mussel, and shrimp). In addition, my wife can't eat fish, and I'm allergic to avacodo. Furthermore, the fish was not fresh at all; it tasted rotten! Definitely a shady practice sneaking old fish into a roll (with lots of sauce to hide it). Later they said it was part of their "secret recipe" sauce. 

They acted as though they would take it off our bill, but still charged us $3.70 for it!

We ordered a spider roll, which didn't taste great, but wasn't as bad as the first. We also ordered an asparagus roll, which was the best roll we ordered (not saying much). 

It's one thing to have subpar rolls, but it's absolutely unacceptable to change the ingredients in an order.

We felt sick to our stomachs afterwards. 

For a four-star comparison, try Aniki's Sushi, in Fremont.
author: Josiah L.

description: Best sushi I've had in a long time. Real attention to detail with subtle and delicious sauces. Very fresh, very high quality ingredients. Sakura Tai and Hotate like candy.
author: T V.

description:
Saw that it had 3.5 stars wanted to give it a try. No regrets! Just a cool place to get some really good Sushi - no reservation required and the atmosphere is super relaxed. The Chef was friendly, I swear he should have his own TV show, big character. 

Service was great and the price wasn't bad at all. We took a chance on the fried bananas and ice cream - AWESOME! You have to try it. The bananas were warm and the red bean ice cream mixed together with some chocolate - excellent combination!
author: Eric W.

description: We ordered take out of the Lion King roll and Yum Yum roll. Both were delicious. Lion King roll was only 6 pieces though, but very unique and tasty. Loved the tempura bits on Yum Yum roll. Well priced for sushi near Union Square.
author: M L.

description:
By far the worst sushi place in SF.
Not only was the sushi bland, tiny, and fishless, but the service was miserably terrible. 
Every time we asked the waitress for a sauce or extra of something, she would give us a dirty look along with some attitude. The teriyaki chicken was served with no teriyaki sauce. The only thing that was good were the CANNED sodas. Terrible spot.
author: Oren G.

description: My second time here. The first time was take out and the food was good. Came here tonight for sit down meal. It was 4 adults and 1 toddler. Everything was good up until we got the bill. They charge us 18% Gratuity fee because they said we had 5 people in our party! What!!!! Is this the norm in SF to rip the tourist off. Beware of this place! Not coming back or recommending to friends that live in SF.
author: James K.

description: This place is walking distance from Worldmark San Francisco. Tried their sushi (avocado and salmon rolls), veggie tempura and sake.
author: Pat C.

description: Rarely am I impressed by both service and food, but this place was spot on for both. The staff was friendly, responsive, and brought cloths to wipe our hands prior to eating. The sushi was delicious and not the type full of fried shrimp and covered in sauce that so many sushi places seem to offer now. Lots of flavor and the fish tasted so fresh.
author: Susan G.

description:
Spicy tuna ordered as hot as you want. I picked #7 in a scale up to 10. Seven Was just about right. It gave plenty of kick without loosing the flavor.

I returned to this place, the tuna was out of this world. Ask chef Toni to prepare something special and spicy, you will be amazed. If you're feeling adventurous, in a scale to 10, ask for number 9 spicy tuna.
author: Daniel V.

description:
Sushi Toni is my favorite local sushi spot. I go here at least 2-3 times a week. The staff is extremely personable, and very accommodating. 

Also, their specialty rolls are excellent. If you are looking for great sashimi, I recommend the Salmon sashimi dinner as it comes with miso soup, salad, rice, and 9 pieces of sashimi. 

Love Sushi Toni!
author: Alli R.

description: If you want decent late night sushi in the area and don't mind servers telling you it's raining while they piss on your head I say go. My Hus gives it one thumb down and a snarl.
author: mandeep M.

description: Great place to spend a evening with some sake and sushi rolls. Toni is also quite happy to chat with customers at the bar and he is fun to talk to.
author: Raghavendra P.

description: Had pretty rude service and one of the people in our party had to wait 45 minutes after we had gotten our food to get theirs. Took 4 times of asking to be served a water. Food was good, but it was overshadowed by the horrible service.
author: Wylie B.

description:
This place is kind of expensive for a divey sushi restaurant. Had a salmon avocado roll and a few nigiri pieces that costs close to $50. The fish was not bad but the rice was dry and did not stick together well. 

Open late and was close to my hotel.
author: Elizabeth N.

description:
Ugh. Yelp, you have been letting me down a lot lately. This place was disappointing, to say the least, after seeing all these great reviews. Sushi was just not fresh and for the price I paid, I expect it to be decent, at the very least. 

Ordered a chirashi bowl, sashimi combo, and spicy tuna hand roll. Sashimi looked and tasted old. Sushi rice in the chirashi wasn't sushi rice. 

Server never refilled our drinks or came around once.
author: Annie L.

description:
I hate to give this place 2 stars because the server was completely on top of things, but the sushi was just not that good here. Sushi is definitely one of my favorite foods, but it just didn't make the cut.  

I ordered the sashimi dinner and decided on albacore tuna.  It came with 9 pieces: 3 seared, 3 belly, 3 body. It didn't taste all that fresh to me, and I wish it was stated on the menu that it was a variety. I would rather not eat albacore seared, but oh well. Another person in my party ordered the 49er roll and it was made with way too much rice. My kids got the California roll and shrimp tempura. California roll was your typical fare, a little on the small side. Shrimp tempura was also small and didn't have the flaky panko texture.

What I can say about this place is their uni nigiri is perfect. As I stated in my previous reviews, I absolutely LOVE uni. It tasted like it was just caught. 

So they deserve 2 stars. Perfect service, perfect uni. But the sushi was just ok...

Tip: This place is really small so I wouldn't suggest it for large groups.
author: Char D.

description:
The Japanese food there are among the worst I've ever had. Neither authentic, nor Americanized.

"Yucky" is the word. Sorry.
author: Wendy G.

description: Sushi was badass. I'm from Florida so I was looking for the best of the best on my trip to Cali. Every other restaurant had a long ass wait so I settled for this place. But wow, I ate way more than I should have bc it was great.
author: Colin M.

description: Great sushi, very tasty. Its a cozy place to sit and have dinner, music was good,the service was quick.
author: Mina G.

description: If you're over 21, you must get the demon slayer sake. It's pairs perfectly with all the other dishes. The Romeo and Juliet roll is perfect. It's melts in your mouth like butter
author: Mark D.

description:
Sushi Toni is a solid sushi place in an area that is lacking in this most important food department. I've been here a handful of times, and each time I have had a pleasant experience. 

The service is lovely - perfectly friendly yet laid back. The kind of place that takes a second to wrap your hot sake bottle in a napkin. The dining area is clean, and has that cozy sushi-humility that I gravitate towards. Two basic requirements. I even sort of like the CD that always seems to be on repeat - nothing like Al Green and the BeeGees to complement your raw fish. 

The food is nice -- it's definitely fresh and tasty, but it hasn't knocked my sushisocks off yet. The nigiris are alright. I find they lack the moisture that exceptional nigiris have in the fish itself and in the texture of the sushi rice. I also miss the detectable yet subtle lick of wasabi. 

I usually head for the sushi combos which offer either a smattering of sashimi or nigiri paired with salad and miso soup. It's a little pricey coming in at $15, but you get fresh fish, yummy salad and decent miso. 

The rolls are dependable, and you are offered the basic set of rolls along with a few special ones. In the basic department, you have the Dragon Roll which is decent. It has a little too much artificial crab for my taste, and is a little heavy on the avocado. It also clocks in at around $14. Maybe the price is due to the eel which I hear is quite unsustainable, but that's just a guess. 

The Crunch roll is interesting -- it is wrapped in white soy paper instead of the traditional nori, and it is practically buried in fried flakes. It's definitely tasty, but the combination of the white soy paper and the huge pile of fried toppings kind of throws me off. 

I was a fan of the 49er Roll which features salmon garnished with lovely thin slices of lemon. Perfect flavor and not too inundated with extra ingredients. I've been a fan of the seaweed salad -- it's the perfect amount to give you a taste of this delectable Japanese dish. Crunchy, savory, comforting, delicious. You can get some special stuff here -- a friend of mine once had live uni. I am not at that level of food bravery yet, but he swore it was a wonderfully tasty experience. 

Not a go-to place in my San Francisco sushi-book just yet, but if I'm with some buddies in the area and we have sushi-sized holes in our tummies, we'll probably head here for a cozy experience with great service and fresh ingredients.
author: Chelsea B.

description: Friendly staff, decent sushi. The family affair roll wasn't my favorite. But the salmon sashimi was amazing, and so was the dragon roll. The swamp roll is good but you need to take the seaweed salad off or it over powers
author: Sombrero Q.

description: Walking around here and walked into this awesome place! I was seated quickly with my party. Not such great decor but that didn't but me bc the quality and price of the food was awesome! Our waitress was very friendly and attentive. She checked up on us to make sure we were ok. The food was delicious. The sashimi tasted fresh and the Mia soup was to lick your fingers for. Also had a couple of rolls and it did not disappoint me at all. The seaweed salad w cucumbers was also to die for. Parking is awful so make sure you give yourself enough time if you are driving.
author: Stacy G.

description: I dont understand why this dirty restaurant has so many stars. The service was non-existent. None of the less common fish were fresh. Nothing novel on the menu to try. I love sushi. Not this place.
author: Dan G.

description: Overprice for the amount & serving of the food. Place is too small. Menu price is different from the menu posted by the window.
author: JohnVey Rose Dhejan S.

description: Went based on a recommendation from a friend and have no desire to go back. Food was mediocre at best and very little choices on menu.
author: Terry B.

description: This little Japanese restaurant was like an oasis after climbing up the mountain that is Powell Street. Fish tastes fresh and sushi was delicious. Make sure to check out their combo plates, we decided to share one but after our first taste of the delicious food plans need to be altered. They have a very extensive menu to choose from.
author: Jan Orhun A.

description:
I have a whole different rating system for sushi in SF. I'm spoiled by Vancouver sushi where it's fresh and super cheap. So I had to get over my initial *gulp-this-is-HOW-much* reaction. Thankfully, I come to SF for business so work covers the tab. So my review is based on the food, not the actual price. I probably wouldn't even eat sushi if I was paying out of my own pocket!

Anyway, on to the food. I'm a big fan of the 49ers Roll. It's the little slice of lemon that pairs nicely with the salmon. Also can't go wrong with staples like Rainbow Roll or Eel + Avocado. Sampling of various nigiri is also a thumbs up. The fish is fresh and nicely presented.

All in all, a good experience if you're craving sushi and in this part of town.
author: Colene C.

description: Small great place. Service is as expected and we didn't have to wait forever for food for a place hat was packed lol. Not the fanciest place but it is a great place. Price didn't break the budget too much. An appetizer, 4 pieces of sashimi, and 2 special rolls for 2 people came out to $50 bucks. Not bad for a tourist in SF lol. I would come back! Get the Dynamite Bang Roll!!!! I promise you won't be disappointed!
author: Jonathan L.

description:
My boyfriend and I decided to come here since we were in the area and we just Yelped it on my phone.

I did enjoy their sushi, but I feel like it's a hit or miss with what you order.  You'll either get an amazing roll or another which is not great at all.

We ordered the 49er Roll, which was good.  It's basic so you can't really fail.  
We also ordered the Crunch Roll, which was pretty bad.. I thought.  The rice paper that they put on it really just dries the entire roll out.  It's not really a crunch roll either, they just put the crunchy stuff in the middle of a spicy tuna roll.
The Eel & Avocado Roll was good too.  The eel was pretty good.
My boyfriend had the Red Dragon Roll and that was the best one.  It was flavorful, the tuna was fresh, it was just an amazing roll.  

I don't think I'd come back here because I love the spend money at a place were ALL the sushi is yummy!

On top of it, it's super small in here and it gets pretty packed.  The service is pretty good, but they're letting their son work there and he's probably like 14 or something.  He spilled my water all over the floor when he was pouring and some on my phone.  It was fine, I just think they shouldn't put that responsibility on a kid.
author: Stephanie B.

description: Awesome! Very cool vibe, awesome staff, and delicious food. It is laid back but funky too. Love the sushi chef.
author: Mike L.

description:
2.5 stars - not that impressed at all but i will say that they were very nice and accomodating but food wise NOT IMPRESSED...

We got the gyoza - standard

I asked for a chirashi sans rice and if you see the picture. It was SO NOT worth $20. I got like 2-3 pieces of tuna, salmon, and another fish. I also asked for an order of nigiri unagi which they put in the same to go container so I'm not sure if they subbed out the other pieces but compared to the normal Chirashi that my fiance got, it was very much on the week side. 

Naruto roll also was standard and nothing special. I feel ike they cheated though because they used a piece of soy paper whereas other restaurants usually do not do that.
author: Tao Tao W.

description: Really great sushi!  My husband and I were on a mission for sushi and happen upon this place ... cozy seating and great food.
author: Jennifer R.

description:
When I'm craving a no-frills, casual, local sushi spot w/ some of the friendliest waiters and waitresses I've met, I come to Sushi Toni.

I am a huge fan of specialty rolls and am not really into sashimi or any type of raw fish so Sushi Toni is quite perfect for me. They have some of the best specialty rolls - the Volcano Roll here is seriously incredible - it's fatty, creamy, filled with freshly baked salmon and a special sauce that will make you ecstatic. Close contenders are the Dragon Roll, the Lion King Roll and the Crunch Roll. 

I've also had the Chicken Donburi and while I did enjoy it, I don't think there was anything really unique or enticing about it. It's quite plain. So I'd recommend sticking to the specialty rolls and the actual sushi items instead of the rice bowls. 

Happy Eating, Yelpers!

P.S. It's conviniently located about 2 blocks from the Sutter Stockton Garage for all the drivers out there and it's within a 3 - 4 block radius from Union Square.
author: Priya S.

description: Nice ! Nice ! Nice !  well worth walking a few blocks (two miles) in the rain to eat the wonderful fish.  No snooty reservations here.  Staff was pleasant and accommodating, and the fish.......yes sir, the fish was fresh,and delicious.  Not a fancy place, but a great place to relax and enjoy superior quality food.   Good value for the money.
author: Steve W.

description:
Came here for dinner and was lured by the great ratings.
This place is okay.  Our sushi didn't taste fresh.  It just was not up to par compared to all the sushis we've had before.  I was expecting more from this place and it was a disappointment.

The price we paid was too much for the mediocre sushi that we ate.  We won't be going back to this place.
author: DJ P.

description:
We stopped in here again at this mom & pop sushi bar and, yes, Toni was behind the counter.

We had a tempura and a tempura dinner. We're not really tempura nuts; it was just a coincidence. Everything was absolutely delicious.

The only distraction was our waitress, a clueless gringa - hopefully she was merely a temp or a fill-in. She was all-American breezy, lacking in sincerity and attention to detail.

Food - 5 STARS
Ambiance - 4 STARS
Location - 4 STARS
Service - 2 STARS
author: John D.

description:
I like Sushi Toni. It's nothing fancy, and I don't think it's the best sushi in the area, but they are a great spot for out-of-towners who a) have kids in tow and b) don't want to spend an arm and a leg on the bill. Obviously, all sushi can get expensive, but I think their menu is quite mid-range for a sushi spot where you know you're not going to get sick. Great rolls and a decent selection of sashimi (great red snapper the last time I was there).

The location is perfect for those visiting/staying downtown, the staff is very friendly and unobtrusive. It's a really nice spot to sit and linger and not feel like you're going to be kicked out when the bill comes.

Bonus fourth star: my friends had kids w/them and the staff sent over a beautiful dessert that we didn't order for the two girls. It was the fried bananas dish. The girls freaked out, they were so happy. I think that says something about Sushi Toni and how they operate.

I gladly come here time and time again.
author: Meredith R.

description: Good quality food! Fresh ingredients very nice staff. Located in a very convenient area. Since we got in late to SF it was a great pick for the area! First timer in SF we are from L.A. And we were very impressed with the quantity, quality and price. When in SF again we will be having us some sushi/ tempura rolls from here again!
author: Malissa D.

description: Visiting San Fran for work and walked into Sushi Toni craving sushi. My friend and I split the seaweed salad and the yellowtail sashimi. The seaweed salad was a nice large portion and I thought perfectly dressed (not too overwhelmingly) and the sashmi was amazing... very smooth and fresh. I then had one of the special eel rolls and my friend had the spicy salmon. Both were very good and no complaints. I'm sure there are a ton of amazing sushi restaurants in San Fran but I think this is a great place to stop if you're in the neighborhood and craving sushi!
author: Aryn C.

description: A small place that got pretty overloaded at 8 pm on a Sunday night. The fish was good. The steak teriyaki was OK, veg tempura roll and other specialty rolls were good. Not super friendly or fast.
author: Morris S.

description:
Awesome nigiri, a nice quiet bar to eat at after a long day, and a relaxed atmosphere ---  Sushi Toni is now my favorite sushi stop in SF (although Manpuku in Berkeley might still hold the Bay Area crown).

Toni's may not rank especially high on the "classy" scale --- much of the wall art is anime rather than classic, and the music is unpredictable --- but the nigiri is some of the best I've had.  Fresh, tender rice with just the right tang of vinegar counts for a lot, but the fish really is a cut above most of what I've sampled.  Never got any overly-oily cuts either.

Maybe not my choice for a date dinner, but my favorite pick for a big plate goodness.
author: Ken M.

description: Sushi was very good and tasted fresh.  Service was very friendly and prompt.  Even though we came in late, we never felt rushed.
author: John D.

description: Small but welcoming atmosphere.  The sushi was good but not amazing.  The staff was very friendly, though we had to educate them on the gluten-free diet which made my wife rather nervous - all ended well though.
author: Trey C.

description: Great place can't wait to go back the spicy mayo sauce was the best I've ever had.great service friendly sushi chefs.
author: B ..

description: Miso soup is extra $2 per person.  It should be free.  Other than that, the rolls were on point and the service was quick and efficient.  I would come back.
author: Chris L.

description: Good food, great service. Fresh food, highly recommended if you're looking for a quick and solid dinner for a reasonable price.
author: Asaf R.

description: Really good sushi here. We came on vacation from Georgia and normally eat cooler rolls. But here all the rolls were warm and tasted amazing. If your ever in the union square district you should come here for a bite. Also good reasonable prices per roll.
author: Tarence M.

description: We really enjoyed this place! The food was great, though, a tad pricey for the portions. Didn't take away from the experience at all. If you're hungry and want some sushi, check Sushi Toni out!
author: Patrick K.

description:
I've been eating sushi in SF for ten years and Tony was the worst experience so far. 
If you ran out of sushi options in the city only order baked rolls there.

Philly roll had fish about to go bad. Tuna was uneatable also bad. I can not believe that chief actually put bad smelling fish on the plate. Disgusting.
author: Andrew S.

description:
Good sushi.. keep in mind that the rolls are HUMONGOUS!! Hubby and I can kill 8 or 9 rolls on an average when we have sushi for dinner.. we ordered at Sushi Toni by the same standard. 5 rolls was all we could stuff ourselves with..
The nigiri, instead of being a 1-bite piece, were 3-bite pieces.
The fish was fresh, and this could be a regular go-to place for those days you crave sushi..
author: Jenny G.

description: Conveniently located close to all shopping in Union Square. Great stop after a day of buy buy buy.  They have a great selection of baked Sushi rolls. I love baked hot rolls and they have a handful. Relatively inexpensive but certainly not cheap.
author: Kimia R.

description:
Sushi Toni really did the trick for us.  We had just arrived and were looking for a simple light meal and they fit the bill perfectly.

I went with a small order of some sushi and some sashimi.  It all tasted fine and I had some small regret that I didn't try the tuna belly.  Unfortunately, I was already full.  Our server was pleasant and service was quick.

For a no frills but very enjoyable meal, I recommend Sushi Toni.
author: Vinny P.

description: I came here last night by myself, around 10 pm. I was feeling very tired and just wanted to grab something quick to take out. I ordered the Volcano Roll. When I paid for my order, the server rudely told me to wait outside of the restauran for my food, on the street! I am a petite lady, alone at 10 pm, a PAYING CUSTOMER and now I feel I am being kicked out onto a chilly, dark street in the middle of downtown San Francisco. I understand that this place is very small but she could have at least asked me to sit at the empty sushi bar. You can imagine how shocked I was. Anyway, the Volcano roll was not too bad. The fish was fresh and it tasted okay but was not worth $14 USD-especially paying that much for fish in San Francisco. I have eaten better.
author: Melody M.

description: cute little sushi place. service was a tad bit lacking, but they meant well. if just a little spread thin and hectic, server-wise. totally understandable though, and we still had a good experience. food was fantastic. lion king was amazing. Loved it. - Mikaela J.
author: Cortez C.

description: The Dragon roll is really good! The other rolls we ordered were the Volcano and Rainbow rolls. They were a little sweeter than I had expected but we're good nonetheless.
author: Ashar W.

description:
Overpriced and quality of seafood is low. Also, no hot water in the bathroom? 

Service was fine.
author: Sierra M.

description: Very pleased with this place. Terrific service and reasonable prices! Just a short walk from Union Square. Will return.
author: Andrea M.

description: I've had the udon, sashimis, and many of the rolls quite a few times. It's always at least okay. Compared to other options in the neighborhood and city, though, I don't think this place has much going for it other than later hours (and, for me, being around the corner).
author: David S.

description:
This is a small place, decor is meh, menu isn't super special.... BUT their sushi is great.  It is fresh, it is light, they aren't RICE rolls but actual sushi.  

We came here after hitting up sax in hopes for a "live food" fix.  And by live food we mean something that doesn't taste dead or is fresh.  This place delivered.  

They had a good variation of rolls (although they could use some more spicy healthy  rolls).  They had baked, fresh, mayo ridden (i tend to avoid those) and even a cucumber roll.

They were all great.  A def recommendation for anybody who just wants simple, fresh, non $1000 sushi
author: Tiana S.

description: Most sushi places were packed at 10 on a Saturday night but this was luckily not. We were seated right away and we didn't have to wait long for our food either. We tried a spicy tuna roll, the 49er's roll, and the love affair roll. We also tried the chicken teriyaki. It was an overall good experience. However they were all out of tempura ice cream.
author: Emma M.

description: Great food, but a bit expensive (as to be expected though). Their shashimi is just like in japan.
author: Eric N.

description: Delicious sushi, I ordered eel and ikura sushi and the rainbow roll. Service was efficient.
author: Tricia P.

description: I really enjoyed this sushi restaurant. On my own so I didn't opt for any sake but the sushi was fresh and delicious and Toni behind the sushi bar was voluble and friendly. I had one of the preset sushi dinners and the choices of nigiri were excellent, the California roll had real crab and the Miso soup was great.
author: Adam B.

description:
I came with my parents a month ago and sat at the sushi bar. The rolls here are very clean and good-tasting, but the quantity of food you get for the price is lacking. The three of us spent about $55 for four rolls, but we were nowhere near finished matching our appetite. We closed our bill and walked to Great Eastern Restaurant in Chinatown to finish our meal.

The only other note I have for this place is that the salmon skin here is a little bit strange. It's kind of chewy and not very crispy. Otherwise, if you've got money to spend, the other rolls here are pretty decent.
author: Andrew S.

description: Even though our hotel front desk hadn't heard of this restaurant and tried to get us to go elsewhere, we decided to come anyway. So glad we did! BEST sushi we have ever had! (Don't tell our regular sushi place in NC!) BEAUTIFUL plating of the sushi and outstanding flavors and textures. Prices were good too, esp, for San Francisco. The staff was awesome. Took care of us like we were regulars. Can't say enough how good this place is, will eat here more before we leave town!
author: Amy D.

description: The volcano roll is to die for. The service is good and all the special rolls are delicious and served beautifully.
author: Maya K.

description: Great little hole in the wall sushi place. We loved everything we ordered. Everything came quickly, and was also pretty affordable. Friendly staff and great food can't go wrong.
author: Garrett S.

description: Very good fresh sushi! Were lucky to have the last spot at the bar as the place was crowded. Would definitely eat there again!
author: Stephane B.

description: Food was decent and priced appropriately for location. I was surprised that no one spoke Japanese. Not as authentic as I expected, but good choices and attentive staff
author: Mitsu D.

description:
Solid little spot and pricing is fair. I like that they have the classics, but also get creative on other items. For example, B.T.S. Roll is straight cray - the American in me loves that its deep fried and spicy, and the presentation is in sort of a teepee pattern... tastefully tacky (I posted a picture). Not at all authentic, but extra credit for taste and creativity. Oh and the Lion King roll is one of SF's top five rolls IMO, please order it. 

Sushi Toni loses a big star in its poor service. My girlfriend and I were served water once, and never received a refill throughout dinner. The place was half full, and it was an early dinner - 6pm on a Friday. When you're eating spicy sushi and sampling a vast array of rolls, cleansing the palette is key. After we finished, our waitress glanced at our plates (with napkins on them! hello!) twice after I had to flag her down to get the check. Once I got it, I had to flag down again to get her to take it to the register. According to other yelpers, I'm not alone in this sentiment. 

Lastly, they could update their dishware to glass; plastic plates really unnecessarily flaunt their mileage.
author: Jon S.

description: Found this place off Yelp of course as we're tourists.  Very inconspicuous location and not too large.  The staff was very friendly and accommodating.  The sushi was really good and reasonably priced.   I especially enjoyed the Lion King roll as it had melted cheese on it which I had never experienced on sushi before.  Try this place, you'll like it.
author: Joe C.

description:
Little hole in the wall of a place with the *Cheesiest* sound track ever. Like a high school dance in the 80's. 

Tasty sushi. Bad music.  Good service.
author: Rob R.

description:
Sorry, didn't like it. Not the freshest sushi. No interaction with the chefs, waitresses take all orders. Usually sushi chefs are funny and talkative. 
Not many special rolls In my opinion.  
I think nearby locals like it because it's close. 
But nothing good about the experience stands out.
author: Richard S.

description:
I went back for the chirashi and it was actually pretty awesome. The portion was decent and most of the fish were fresh. What I liked the most was the variety. In addition to the typical hamachi, maguro, ebi, tamago, sake, I also got walu and saba. Oh and they sprinkled furikake on my rice. Yum! 

Side note: Apparently my friend Josh's uncle owns this place. HOOK IT UP UNCLE TONI!
author: Beverly T.

description: Sushi Toni deserves 100 stars not just 5. If you are looking for fresh and delicious sushi this is the place home made by the owner.
author: Ivelin I.

description: Probably some of the best sushi I've ever had. I tried the Romeo and Juliette and the Naturo roll -- amazing. I don't recommend the miso soup. It was basically warm water. But the sushi was amazing.
author: Mike R.

description:
I only really stop and take the time to write review for the places that I really love.  Sushi Toni is high on that list.  It may not be the swankiest date spot in SF, but it is absolutely perfect for sitting at the bar when you have a sushi craving.  I've been coming here the better part of 4 years, it's never let me down

The fish is fresh and well prepared, the staff is friendly and welcoming (and pretty funny if you are lucky enough to drop by when Toni is behind the bar) and there always seems to magically be one stop waiting there for you.  I don't know enough about Sake to comment on their list, other than coming pretty often has turned me into a big lover of the stuff.

For my particular taste, I don't know if you could find a better roll than the Crunch Roll anywhere on the planet. If you are looking for hip/modern, go down the street to Ryoko.  If you want a no frills, great sushi experience, it's tough to beat Sushi Toni
author: Andrew J.

description:
Very good sushi! I got the sushi combo C and everything on it was high quality and tasty. The sushi chef toasted one of the nigri with a blow torch and it had the most amazing flavor. I'd order that again and again!

The miso soup and salad that came with it were only OK... I actually had better last weekend in Front Royal, VA. Who would have thought? Definitely not me.
author: Brenna H.

description: Probably my favorite sushi in the Union Square area.  Nice assortment of rolls and all the sushi very fresh.  Also surprisingly fast turnaround on take out orders.
author: Lloyd M.

description:
The bf and I used to love this spot (close to home).  But, recently the prices have gone up and the quality has gone down.  Usually, the fish is decent but recently the fish has been tasting a bit like frozen fish, thawed, then kept in the fridge one too many days.

The dinner entrees are also of low quality.  Around $15 for a salmon combo but the salmon "fillet" (if you can even call it that) was literally less than 1 ounce.  The shrimp tempura are also super dinky (approx 2 inches long, and very thin).  When we used to visit the breading on the tonkatsu was crisy and flaky (like with traditional japanese panko).  But, last visit it seemed like it was just dredged in egg and flour--super weird consistency.

Pros: open late.  Cons: quality as discussed above (especially for the price).
author: Courtney C.

description: Turns out Ryoko's isn't the only place open for late night sushi around here.  Came here around 11 on a Saturday, and it was nearly empty.  They delivered us salmon, hamachi, and albacore nigiri, plus an excellent 49ers roll that was delicious but a bit lemony.  Definitely would return.
author: Aaron M.

description:
Four Stars
Lion King is such a win! Rice on the sushi rolls. Okay yea that's kind of random, but a person who's usually pretty neutral about rice, this was a big deal.

Two Stars
Prices on the rolls seemed so good, until we realized how small they were.. three girls ate ~5-6 orders. That's pretty tiny. Le sigh.

Two Stars
Tempura combo was kind of a flop.. How does one go wrong with fried seafood?
author: Linda X.

description: t's a quiet little place with cute lowkey decorations and dim lighting. The hostess/waitress was pretty nice and super fast. The sushi was good and reasonably priced. Overall it was a good experience, especially considering other places in SF where either the food or the service is garbage.
author: Kat D.

description: Loved this place. No reservation needed, cozy and the cilantro lemon sushi and the vegetable noodle soup were delicious. You can ask to make your soup a bit spicy.
author: Liyan A.

description: Good, fresh Sushi for a reasonable price. Polite and nice staff. Spicy tuna is actually spicy which is great. Thanks.
author: Markus S.

description: Ordered a Rainbow Roll and the Dynamite Roll that was baked. They were delicious! One roll will definitely not fill you up though and don't come here if you're looking for cheap sushi because it is a bit more pricey and the rolls are kind of small. However, they have great customer service! I forgot my purse at the restaurant and didn't realize it until I got home and by that time they were already closed. I called in and said that I forgot my purse and the older lady that answered sounded extremely nice about it over the phone! She said she had already finished closing but she will wait for me to come back to get even after I told her it would take 20 minutes because I live far away. When I got there she gave me back my purse with a smile and a very nice attitude! I'm really impressed that she went out of her way for me and was so sweet!
author: Sandy N.

description:
Love this place! The first time I went was almost 11 pm and I was so tired...forgot the place name but remember delicious, high quality and reasonably priced sushi...

And this time in San Francisco, I am craving for sushi so I yelped this place. The moment I went in, I was like ---I have been here...this is the place!!!

The fish is fresh and delicious, rolls are super good and the chef don't judge me when I order California roll...the albacore sashimi, sweet egg, and inari are all delicious! And the service is amazing...they helped me charge my iPhone and it was such a life saver.

Thank you so much chef for the amazing sushi, will be back every time in SF!!!
author: Anna L.

description: What a great find!! I've been looking for a great sushi spot in the area; unfortunately most of the sushi places are too expensive or a little too touristy. Luckily, our friends recommended that we check out Sushi Toni. Chris, the sushi chef, is incredibly nice and friendly. Ask him what's fresh, and he'll tell you the truth. His rolls are creative and are super tasty; no need for soy sauce! Their tuna was extra fresh, and he created a special octopus salad for us. They have a good selection of rolls, and I especially like the 49er roll. It was unlike any other 49er roll that I've ever tried. I can't wait to come back here. I feel like this place will quickly become our go-to spot. It's a pretty casual vibe, nothing too fancy. But the food and banter definitely makes up for it.
author: Regina L.

description: A-ok. It satisfied the sushi craving. The rolls were interesting but per other yelpers' comments, there was too much rice...and the grains seemed over cooked/a little mushy. The fish was tender, but not enough of it in my opinion. The swamp/marsh roll had seaweed salad with spicy tuna, which was too Spicy and didn't compliment the seaweed on top. Perhaps we should have stuck to nigiri. We didn't order any drinks. Just edamame and miso soup. The server was just one lady, very nice and attentive. She gave us extra ginger so thumbs up! Overall a chill place, nothing exquisite but right down the middle good.
author: Zara S.

description:
Paired up.

Us: Under usual circumstances.

Nigiri: Salmon, unagi, magura, saba, eda and hamachi over rice. Liked them all, some fresher than others. Connoisseur companion was thought they were just OK.

Romeo and Juliet: Famous play and fantastic soybean paper roll with salmon, avocado, scallops, tobiko and eel sauce. Almost too much flavor. More than OK.

Sapporo Light: Perfect with everything.

Television: Overhead and perfect with nothing.

Attentive but scripted service. Unassuming space dominated by the TV. $75/pair was reasonable but besides the roll nothing really stood out.

Three star pairing.
author: Jason B.

description:
This is my favorite place to grab sushi near Union Square after a long day of shopping. If you come around lunch time it's a little emptier and quieter than dinner time, where the small dining area gets packed! There is also some seating around the sushi bar, which is nice if you like talking to the sushi chef while your food is being made.

The fish has always been really fresh and the size of the rolls is perfect for sharing. They also make the BEST tempura veggies and shrimp. The coating is perfectly crispy and melt-in-your-mouth delicious. My personal favorite is the tempura yams that come in the mixed veggie tempura.
author: Liz G.

description: The Sushi wasn't bad. Atmosphere needs some work for a small place. The service was great and he sushi wasn't bad at all.
author: Carlos P.

description:
Ambiance: Casual sushi place with (PG) anime character pictures hung around the wall. Friendly waitresses. 

Ordered:
**Free hot tea!
1. 49er-  lemon slices on top of sushi. The zest goes well with the salmon. 
2. Romeo and Juliet Roll- Def. worth a try. The thin slices of scallop on top was slightly sweet in flavor. Def. a nice surprise. 
3. Rainbow Roll- Tasty if you like shrimp tempura rolled inside of it. 

Prices are decent for the quality and quantity of sushi that you get.
author: Grace C.

description:
We've eaten here a few times and the sushi is solid but not fancy. 

+ Reasonable prices compared to the other places nearby
+ Nice service and staff although we never went when it was full
+ Romeo and Juliet Roll
+ BTS Roll & Dynamite Roll if you like bake/fried 
+ Rainbow Roll
+ Yellow Tail Roll

- Old/ weird decor and vibe
- Not the most cleanest place
- Rolls are on the smaller side
- Miso soup was too salty and not impressive
author: Manohak S.

description: Thoroughly mediocre fare. Didn't particularly enjoy it. The food was okay but imo you can find better places to eat. This place isn't terrible but I just don't think it's worth the time and money
author: Alex Y.

description: The Lion King Sushi was great. The beer was expensive for $8.00 a bottle, but overall the food was excellent!!!!
author: Reynard H.

description:
Solid neighborhood joint! 

I've only ever tried the sushi combo, but the fish has generally been fresh and tasty. Servers are friendly and sushi chefs are quick. 

It's korean-owned, but that doesn't take away from the authenticity or quality at all, in my opinion. 

Check this place out if you're in the area and are craving some raw fish.
author: Jonathan H.

description:
Yelped a sushi place in SF and up popped Sushi Toni. Not a big place and just along the road. You probably wouldn't walk in unless you knew about it. Toni is great, he made some great sushi for us. 

The prices are great and the service is just what we needed. It's a fun casual place. I'm sure we overate a bit, but Toni was pleasant. We sat at the bar, it's always the best place to sit at a sushi place. Next time I'm in SF, I know where to go.

They will make you anything you want, just ask!
author: Ronjini M.

description: This place is AHHHHHMAZING. Dang. Please go here, eat here, indulge here. It is all delicious. And honestly very reasonably priced for sushi in the city! Which was a nice surprise! It was all so fresh tasting, my pops said the salmon was the best salmon he has ever eaten in his life and he is 60+ years old. So I think that says something. We started with the chicken Gyoza and the miso soup...yum!! I had the rainbow roll and was not disappointed. My mom loved the volcano roll. Can't stop, won't stop coming here!
author: Isabel M.

description:
I don't think I'll ever go to the mediocre sushi restaurants they offer here in Oakland ever again. I came to Sushi Toni with a friend. Usually, I'd be okay with Alameda Sushi House, Kan Sai, or even Coach Sushi, but she convinced me we needed to make a trip out to the city.

Let me just say: delicious! We ordered the red dragon, volcano, and the Romeo & Juliet (my favorite of the 3)! The sushi is so fresh. It's not as large as other rolls I've had, but the taste makes up for it. These are a necessary three to order, or at least try the Romeo & Juliet. 

The service, maybe 3 stars. I think the only time we saw our waiter was when we ordered, got our food, and then the check. I didn't mind because the food was really good, and this place was packed, so I can understand how busy our waiter was... But still. 

Anyway, great place to try! I can't wait for another excuse to come back to the city.
author: MARTHINA C.

description: Great sushi!  I visited from North Dakota and am jealous of the quality of sushi!  Very good service as well.
author: Kurt K.

description: Looks questionable from the store front but the sushi was fresh and the service was good. I enjoyed the red dragon roll. The steamed chicken goyza was ok but I would not order again.
author: Patricia M.

description: We came here on a lark, looking for sushi. The place we were going to go to originally wasn't going to open late enough. We saw good reviews for here and decided to go. Totally stoked because this sushi was *incredible*! We ordered (almost) everything off the specialty rolls and were so impressed. Will definitely come back!! :-D
author: Kenneth G.

description: Great late night treat. Fresh flavor and very satisfying for a take home sushi meal. I didn't eat in so can't review their service but very friendly for pick up.
author: B. M.

description: At first, I was a little bit concerned that this place was empty when I got in. However, the sushi was delicious and decently priced. The place started to get more full of people as the night went on. I got salmon sashimi, a shrimp tempura roll, and a rainbow roll. My dad got a spicy tuna roll and tuna sashimi. He said the sushi tasted fresh and good too. I would recommend this place to a friend.
author: Amber K.

description:
I went to Sushi Toni once. The Dragon roll sushi were very tasty, creative and affordable! The combo C was also great.

Definitely a great place in SF.
author: Jean-Philippe T.

description: Small hole in the wall place around the corner from our hotel. Good service, decent pricing and fresh food. What else do you need to be satisfied.
author: Danny S.

description:
I came here at 10:30pm on a Monday night. The place was empty except for a large party which probably thought they would be the ones to close Sushi Toni out. They were mistaken; no one is later than I.

The dining area is divided between the large main section and the bar, which has a few tables situated nearby. My girlfriend and I sat at a table by the bar and promptly ordered:
- a large Kirin
- a small carafe of hot sake (I didn't check the name)
- miso soup
- nigiri: sake, maguro, hamachi
- special rolls: Hannukah, Volcano

The service was speedy and the waitress friendly. The hot sake was piping. Mm.

The nigiri was fresh, and the cut size larger than average, which is rare for a sushi joint; in my experience, the restaurants serving large pieces of fish are compensating for poor quality. Sushi Toni is the exception and their hamachi nigiri is especially good.

Then came the Hannukah roll, an salmon skin cut roll ("circumcision roll"?) topped with smoked salmon and salmon roe. If you like salmon, this is the one for you. Crunchy skin, smokey fish, and that creamy texture of rice and bursting roe.

Finally, the Volcano roll, served on a hot plate. Baked crab, avocado, tobiko, 2 kinds of sauce, and green onion. This one was tasty, and it was good to finish on a hot dish. The crab was plentiful -- definitely the centerpiece of the roll. It was a bit heavy with the sauce, which was sweet, spicy, and thick. Good, though.

I would return to Sushi Toni to test the limits of their fish and to explore some of their special rolls, of which they seem to have many.
author: Jackson G.

description: I went here for my birthday. The Lion King roll was really good and the dragon roll was amazing. I told them it was my birthday and they brought out dessert!!! Will come again!
author: Danielle W.

description: Good sushi, friendly service, decent prices. A bit of a hole in the wall, but busy the entire time we were here - lots of locals from the neighborhood, which is always a good sign.
author: T R.

description:
Overall: 3.8/5

Staff: 4/5 - The place is quite small so the waitress we had was attentive. She wasn't very talkative, but polite non the less.

Atmosphere: 4/5 - Again, the place was small, so it was rather cozy. You could sit at a table, or sit at a bar and watch them male the sushi

Menu: 3.75/5 There was a good variety of sushi and an appropriate amount of selections for the average diner. They even had pictures :)

Price: 3.75/5 - Coming from Minneapolis, where we have thousands of lakes but no oceans to catch wonderful fish from, I had imagined that the prices would be cheaper. However, I still give it a 3.5 considering it is San Francisco, and everything else around was quite a bit pricier. 

Quality of food: 3.5/5 - I enjoyed the sushi as much as any other sushi I have had. It wasn't exquisite, but it wasn't disastrous either. We ordered the 49ers roll and the Yum Yum roll with a Peach J Pop drink (the drink was pretty awesome).
author: Anna L.

description: Sushi was just average. Restaurant was very small very close seating. Expensive for portion and quality of sushi.
author: rich A.

description: Fantastic place with seating always available. Lovely selection and quick service since it's a small place. Our last visit there we sat at the bar with Toni, who had lots of fun stories! We try to go as often as we can, even after we moved to South Bay. Cilantro roll, 49ers roll, and the volcano roll are my favorites.
author: Steven X.

description: Great salmon sashimi and very good service. Easy place but with really good sushi. Ideal for dinner watching the football game on TV.
author: Gino T.

description:
(See pics)

More of 3.5 stars.

A smaller sushi joint with decent sushi. Fish was fresh and in pretty good portions.

We had the seaweed salad, agedashi tofu, rainbow, spider and caterpillar rolls and all were not bad. The soft shell crab was freshly fried.

The interesting Lion King roll with crab and salmon baked with mozzarella cheese was actually quite crunchy and delicious.

The service was a bit slow because there's really just 1 person taking orders and serving the food for whole place. And this place is busy! The chef was also quite friendly and talked with some of the patrons when he was not too busy.

Because of the tables and chairs are not fixed it can accommodate larger groups. The evening we ate here we saw a group of 15.
author: T L.

description: Found this place because it was within walking distance to our hotel. Sushi was good, service was expedient, and it suited our needs for a quick and easy dinner. No complaints!
author: Erica R.

description:
I felt like some sushi and didn't want to venture too far from the nest. After much research on yelp, we decided on Sushi Toni. We ordered spicy scallops, uni, red snapper and yellowtail nigiri's, seaweed salad, dynamite boom roll, ice cream tempura and salmon+avocado roll.

We sat at the bar and the chef/owner was very friendly and chatted us up as we were waiting for the food. The fish tasted fresh and the service was friendly. Definitely worth a try.
author: Alice W.

description:
I'm a HUUUUUUUUGE fan of special rolls and any types of raw fish (sashimi) especially, so Susho Toni will be my choice in that area :) 
Sashimi is always fresh and tender, yaaaammy!  Can't resist each time I'm here! 
Salmon sashimi is the best! It's not just 2-3 pieces on the plate which make you enjoy your dish longer :)

FOOD:

1. Miso Soup (2$)
Always thought that Miso Soup is more like a complementary stuff and should be given to a customer to prepare his tommy for the main part, but seems like it's only my idea. Miso Soup was good enough, delicious and hot - best thing to start with :)

2. Dragon Roll (12.50$)
Crab, avocado, shrimp tempura cucumber, tobiko and sesame - mmm.. 
I just LOVE all rolls with avocado :)

3. Volcano Roll (8.50$)
Baked crab with avocado, green onions and spicy sauce - just perfect for those, who are in love with spicy stuff :)

4. 49ers Roll (11$)
Just tradition :) 
Each time we are going out to sushi place, 49ers will be in the order :)
Salmon and pieces of lemon on the top - so easy and tasty combination!

5. Spider Roll (8.50$)
Deep fried soft crab with cucumber, avocado and tobiko. 
I {L O V E} CRAB!!!
Crab is perfectly cooked each time I'm here.

6. Rainbow Roll (12.50$)
Shrimp tempura with cucumber, tuna, salmon, avocado and himachi
This roll is also a tradition in my family :)
Will definitely recommend to try if you haven't before as well as 49ers Roll :)

7. Dessert - Mochi Ice Cream
Small, sweet strawberry ice cream that looks like French Macarons :)
Was good, but they can start doing bigger portions though.

Service was great.
Recommend.
author: Olga B.

description:
I'm not quite sure anyone can actually give this place anymore than 3 stars.

I came here and ordered the chirashi at $18. At this price, I generally get a decent selection of fish on top of my rice. When I looked at my bowl, I was very surprised to only count 8 pieces of fish and 2 pieces of tomago (egg). Moreover, the fish was of mediocre quality, at best.

At the price I paid, I expect more and better. 

If you want good raw fish, don't come here.
author: Howard C.

description: Ordered the yum yum roll, the volcano roll, and the lion king roll and they were all delicious!!! I would definitely recommend trying this place out.
author: Tiffany L.

description: Ate here with a small group of friends after having tropical drinks at Tonga. This place is just a simple hole in the wall sushi joint. I will say that there was plenty of seating, and the service is quite fast considering that sushi takes a while to make. The prices are affordable, but the portions are slightly smaller than the places I've been to in SJ. As you may know, parking is not great in the city, so this place is only suitable if you happen to be on foot and around the area.
author: Beatriz S.

description:
I love Sushi Toni. I've only started checking in, but I have gone there a few times before and the server is one of the best. I'm not all that japanese cuisine savvy (even though it is one of my favorites), so whenever I have any questions about any of the sushi, she's always really nice about answering any questions I had.
The Dragon Roll and an extra side of Shrimp Tempura are my favorites. The roll is really fat, as in they put so much of the best things, that it's hard to go back to any other of the different rolls. 
I guess what makes this place really great is the atmosphere, service, food and the fact that I've never ever had to wait in line to order food to go. The store is covered in framed pictures of anime/chibis (ex. Naurto) and it's just a nice small neighborhood sushi bar. Definitely one of my favorite places for sushi.
author: Michelley D.

description: This was a great late night place for sushi. The rainbow roll was excellent and the edamame was hot and delicious. I will definitely be going back to this place when I am in the area. The place doesn't ever seem crowded, but the service is quick and friendly.
author: Nicole G.

description: Great place for a quick sushi fix! Quaint small restaurant with Very friendly staff. Volcano rolls are delicious and serve on a hot plate. Would go back
author: H N.

description: Sushi was average. Service was a little slow....they only had one server and one sushi chef. We ordered 3 rolls and after we were almost done with the 3rd we realized that we hadn't ordered that roll. The server insisted that we ordered it and then brought us the right roll that we ordered and still charged us for the one we didn't order. I didn't feel like arguing at that point so we just paid for all of them. There are much better sushi restaurants in the city.
author: Mina M.

description:
What a place! Friendly and extremely welcoming staff, Sushi Toni is one of my favorite sushi place in town!

Living a few blocks away from the restaurant, Sushi Toni is nicely located near Powell Street and the busy Union Square. Convenient for the downtown dwellers around! I used to come here almost every week; it is that good! I even had a birthday there and Toni and the rest of the staff were really accommodating. They even got us free desserts!

+ Sushi
The sushi(s) are excellent. My personal favorites are the Dragon Roll and the Lion King Roll. They also have specials when they get some exotic fish or it's just the season for some new stuff! Prices are affordable and you do get quality food in a cozy atmosphere and the service is great. The sushi chefs are amicable and engaging; they will talk to you and make conversation if they are not too busy.  

Definitely a place to check out when you are around the area if you are craving some simple and fresh sushi and to relax.
author: Alex L.

description: Love the food, hate the hours. Only open for lunch and diner, but worth it.
author: Rickey A.

description: This was an excellent pick. It's like a dive sushi place.  Don't let the exterior fool you.  The food was excellent and plenty for the money.  I totally agree with the 4 star rating.  It would have been five if the place looked a little nicer.
author: Tim H.

description:
This was a great find ,Great Sushi 
Dinner was excellent the rolls are fresh
Food was very well prepared and the service  was on point attention to detail.
If you are I'm to sushi definitely give this a try.
Great Experince
author: Food C.

description: Delicious! we found this place on yelp while we stayed in SF for the night picking up a cruise the next day. We told Sushi Toni we were on our honeymoon and he took care of the rest. We didn't have to order anything, he surprised us with everything and it was delicious! (I even tried eel and uni for the first time! still not a fan but my husband loved it!) needless to say this will be a stop every time we go up to San Francisco!
author: Arleen B.

description: Excellent!!!!!!!!! I've ordered 3 different rolls with soybean paper only cause I don't like seaweed. Everything was delicious! 5 stars!
author: Aurélie S.

description:
Good sushi. 
I go here all the time and don't like it when it is too crowded, so you should stay away.
author: Adam S.

description:
A totally understated neighborhood joint with exceptionally good sushi and an awesome staff.  I've been for dinner three times and am already welcomed like a regular. The rolls are always fresh and delicious, the service is excellent and you'll never have to wait for a table.

Be sure to include the Family Affair Roll and the Demon Slayer Sake in your order!
author: A M.

description: Sushi was pretty good - especially my beloved 49er roll. Miso soup had a nice flavor.  The place was a bit dingy and outdated. Bathroom was gross. They need some updating. They didn't seem to mind that we lingered - place was quite empty actually.
author: Andrew K.

description:
I'm so sad. I used to love Sushi toni, but it looks like recently they've made a few changes. Menu includes the same items, except the price went up and the sushi rolls got bigger, which was their downfall.

I actually loved their smaller sushi rolls prior to the change! it allows you to taste the food rather than stuffing your mouth full of rice and fish. Now the rice, fish, and sauce ratio is totally off. Don't change something that's not broken.

Now I understand why this place went from a 4 star on yelp, to a 3 1/2. *Sigh..
author: Sandra L.

description: Great sushi and friendly people! Romeo and Juliet roll is a must try! Nigiri was perfect.
author: Brad H.

description:
The sushi rolls we ordered were good and fresh, but nothing out of the ordinary. The service we received was attentive and polite. 

Overall thoughts : I wouldn't consider this as one of my 'go to' places for sushi. Nothing too special with the rolls or the atmosphere. If I was ever around the neighborhood, I would would come here to have my sushi fix.
author: Stephanie K.

description:
This place has such good service that I left a $2 tip on a $7 takeout order. This was based on a 10-minute wait, during which they served me tea, was attentive to my needs, and let me sit at the bar.

Why such good service? Because the chefs and waiters are Korean! :)

The food alone would warrant a 1- or 2-star rating, unfortunately. The salmon roll was messily prepared (and had almost no salmon), and the miso soup had a few 3mm size bites of tofu that had all drowned to the bottom.
author: Jeena C.

description: We were staying at a hotel right near Sushi Toni so stopped in late night for some sushi.  We sat at the bar and staff was really friendly and personable.  We also realized that the entire Boyz II Men album was playing on repeat which in my opinion was fantastic! The sushi was wonderful and delicious.
author: Kendra B.

description: This is not a fancy restaurant with trendy sushi options, 5 star service, and house music playing with the lights so dim you can't see your plate. This IS an absolutely delicious and affordable sushi stop that is open late.  Toni makes up traditional sushi (with some fun variations), with the most fresh and tender cuts of fish at an extremely affordable price.  I wanted to stop by and grab a few bites every time I walked by and you should definitely try what Toni is serving.
author: Daniel J.

description:
sushi in the FiDi, why? 
it's super fresh, the owner is super nice, and the Mariah Carey record spinning on repeat is super romantic. 
sneezing chef & all, this place is super tight.
author: Louie L.

description:
After a long day of shopping around Union Square, decided to eat sushi for dinner. I came across Sushi Toni and decided to eat here with my friends.

Upon walking into the restaurant, it was practically empty with us being the only customer. We ordered volcano rolls, dragon rolls, sashimi dinner, and this one other roll that I cannot remembered. The rolls tasted decent but nothing really stood out. It was typical rolls that you could get at any sushi restaurant.

I liked their service and they always refill our drinks every five minutes, so that is a plus! Also, I suggest you come here in a small group because the place is very small.
author: Owie N.

description:
This place has 3 star sushi with super friendly service so I'm giving it an extra star for that. 

I had salmon sushi and a spicy tuna roll. All good and the fish tasted pretty fresh, however it was nothing to rave about.

The ambiance is nothing special either. 

Prices were extremely reasonable, which made me happy because it was a fairly cheap sushi dinner. That's another plus to this place.
author: Cindy B.

description:
Was staying nearby on a recent trip to SF.  Had a craving for sushi so walked downhill a couple of blocks to get there (the hike uphill was tough for a flatlander like me).  Well, it was worth the walk.  The staff was super friendly and seated me quickly in the window - which was great, because people watching in SF is the BEST!. 

Ordered a sashimi combo substituting the seaweed salad for their regular salad, and got rainbow roll too.  Everything was quite tasty and arrived quickly.  Managed to have a nice dinner and still stay within my budget - which is not always easy in SF. If I am back in the area I will definitely stop in for another meal.  It's a good solid place without a lot of pretense - which, when I'm traveling, is exactly the kind of place I look for!
author: Mike L.

description:
I'll say this place is 3.5+ stars.  I've bookmarked this place a long time ago, to the point where it's second from the bottom of my list.  I finally went there a week and a half ago on the Wednesday evening prior to a Chicago concert at the Masonic Auditorium two blocks uphill from here.  The chirashi was pretty good as far as the variety of sushi it contained.  I especially liked how they included two pieces of the Arctic surf clam (hokkigai), something I've very much enjoyed in the past but haven't ordered much of recently.  The sushi rice could use more vinegar taste that's associated with it though.

I also liked the hostess that was serving that evening.  She's so nice, sweet, and cute.  She may be reason alone for me to make the effort to return there. =)
author: H K.

description:
This place ricks.  What a pleasant surprise. Sushi is very fresh and everything we ordered tasted great.  Nabeyaki udon, Unagi was awesome, tempura and the cilantro roll 
I would highly recommend this place as a previous Japanese restaurant owner the quality is very good,
author: David C.

description: I'm a snob with my sushi. No mayo or may sauces. The fish, rice, and seaweed must be quality. This place met that and their family affair roll and swamp roll are so good! Thanks guys! Nice place off the beaten path to relax.
author: Denny B.

description: Great, authentic place. Excellent, fresh sushi and super tempura bananas. Try the red bean ice cream, really good.
author: Jesse J.

description: Overall a great place. Nice little family run sushi place. We had miso soup, which was ok. We had a spider roll that was awesome, the red dragon roll was great as well. For nigiri we had taco, hamachi and salmon. The taco and hamachi were amazing, the fish was so fresh and the octopus wasn't super chewy. The lady waiting on us was super friendly. I highly recommend Sushi Toni!
author: Patrick R.

description:
Sushi's pretty decent here!
Romeo & Juliet  Roll was so delicious. Felt like I was making out with Romeo & Juliet.
author: Yuki A.

description: I was almost afraid to go in as the interior is quite downscale.  But we went ahead based on Yelp reviews and had a good experience.  The sushi rolls are very good.  We were staying at the White Swan Inn (excellent) a block away and this was very convenient.  I would go again.  Dined in February 2016 post Superbowl.
author: Margaret M.

description: 3.5 stars. Got salmon and uni. Tastes good but but stellar. Would come again but not crave-worthy material.
author: Jenny B.

description:
It's a cute and small sushi bar located in a very busy area. I'm not sure why i even considered trying to find parking at peak hours in Union Square area! I'm not normally a fan of sushi, especially sashima, but i easily ate myself through many rolls which ultimately sorted out to $35 per person. That's A LOT of sushi, no?!

The memorable sushi:

Lion King Roll: it combines crab, avocado, and baked salmon topped with melted cheese. I'm on the fence about combining the cold ingredients with the warm baked salmon... but it all somehow worked.

Romeo & Juliet: My first taste of soybean paper! I can't actually tell any difference between soybean paper and traditional seaweed paper. Nonetheless, i loved the salmon, avocado, and scallop combo.
author: Samantha L.

description: Fresh sushi and quick, friendly service.  It was a pop in for us after a six hour flight from the east coast and we were not disappointed.
author: Joanne J.

description:
Can't wait to come back here.  I was here one year ago 8/12 and on a drunken escapade with a friend of mine.  We stumbled into this place not knowing what to expect.  Needless to say both my friend and were blown away by the service and most of all food.  It was late, possibly after 12am.  It was just myself, my friend, the chef, waitress, and a male stripper construction worker regular.  We had an awesome time with the chef and got drunk with him.  What we ordered:

4x Yellowtail Sushi
4x Edamame
2x Sake (forgot which)
4x Beer (forgot which)

Everything was awesome.  The Edamame was my favorite and best i ever had.  It came with a special green roe that I have never seen or tasted before.  This is a must if you're a Edamame fan (not that many of us).  

Coming back again for Outsidelands and definitely making an annual pilgrimage to this place!
author: David P.

description:
The Dish: Nothing great here. A hole in a wall with mediocre/sub-par sushi rolls. I wasn't blown away by anything they offered or by any of the sushi rolls my family ordered. Service was also sub-par - we stood there awkwardly waiting to be seated until they finally noticed us.

Ambience: Definitely not clean, but not the dirtiest I've seen.
author: Gina T.

description:
So, there are better sushi places within a few blocks of here. Sorry, Toni, I still love it here, but Sakana has better selection and more widely-palatable decor.

However! Toni himself is completely awesome. I've been here more than a few times (maybe because it's within a block of me...), and he knows who I am, what my usual order is, and sometimes even throws in free sorbet, which is cool. The waitstaff has changed a few times in the last couple of years, but they've all been pretty excellent, too.

I guess I should mention the decor in a bit more detail... Yes, there's a lot of anime on the wall. And, yes, some days this place will play Bob Marley all day long and everybody who walks in the door will have a confused look on their faces for a moment. Me, I like it. But I probably wouldn't take a first date here.

I'm not a roll person, so I can't tell you much about those. But Toni and his compatriot chefs do a pretty good job on nigiri and sashimi, even if the selection of fish is a bit limited. I've eaten here many times and always come away satisfied.

All in all, this is probably my #2 sushi place in the Tendernob area. So not bad! You should eat here!
author: James B.

description: Staffs are super kind and the sushi(nigiri) was super fresh! Their Nigiri size(fish) is bigger than most of the others that I have been to. Make sure to ask the chef what is fresh and just get the items that the chef recommands. Overall Im giving 5stars for the service and honesty(chef).
author: Chris L.

description: Definitely my new favorite sushi spot in sf! Try Romeo & Juliet and spider roll! 5 stars. Friendly and clean!
author: Michelle L.

description: Awful service. We waited an hour for our table, afterwards they gave away our table. They seemed not to even care that we had our entire party there and we had to cancel our dinner.
author: Duy N.

description: Very tasty! The flavor is excellent and the service is great. The only problem is the bathroom, it could be cleaner.
author: Paulina M.

description: Unfortunately we had no idea Christmas dinner would be a 2 to 3 hour wait everywhere else in Chinatown...so we got stuck coming here which was very ok in every sense of the word. Service, food, ambiance etc.
author: Sharon O.

description:
Very fresh fish!

1star off - too salty and too much rice on the roll

Besides that, cute little sushi place with nice service and fresh fish :)
author: Ella B.

description:
Ok - this place is across the street from me, and I'm a huge sushi fiend - so I essentially eat here every five minutes. 

The place only opens for dinner (You'll need to go to Maru's around the corner of you want lunchtime sushi) and is incredibly small. They do really well trying to accommodate large groups and can easily move tables around. 

They have a decent sushi bar area and the owner (named Toni - shocker) is there every night and is incredibly friendly. 

This is a perfect sushi place to make one of your 'regular spots' and its easy to get to know the staff. 

Sushi is fresh and tasty - I always recommend the wakame salad. Don't just wakaway and ignore it. Ha, get it? Ok, I had too... Sorry.
author: A X.

description: We were disappointed. Worst sushi restaurant I've been to in years. Chirachi was $20 with very little fish. Ca roll tasted like mayo. Even the salad was small. We left $60 poorer and wishing we'd eaten somewhere else.
author: Johnna A.

description: 4-stars for this place is spot on- come here for the sushi, not the ambiance! The place is pretty small and a little dirty looking, but the sushi we ordered was surprisingly good. We got the Rainbow Roll, Spicy Tuna, Eel & Avocado, and Salmon & Avocado. the Eel was my favorite, just fantastic, and the other rolls were all good too. It was about $50 for the two of us (4 rolls + 2 beers) which is pretty standard for an SF sushi restaurant, although I thought it was a little high for the look and feel of the place (and for listening to Mariah Carey's greatest hits album). But then again, as I said, the rolls were tasty, and that's what really matters.
author: Lindsey B.

description: Delicious sushi and beautiful presentation! Red dragon roll is my favorite. The steamed dumping with crab meat is very tasty. Friendly service and reasonable prices. We make sure we eat here every time we visit San Francisco.
author: Curt E.

description: Delicious sushi,  very fresh. The 49er roll was delicious.  Restaurant is small but we didn't have an issue getting a table early on a Tuesday night.   When we left at 7:30 the restaurant was filling up.  Service was attentive and quick.
author: Angela H.

description: Dragon roll was the best!  Spider roll was just OK.  Lion King roll was amazing.  Saba sushi was great. The venue was small but it was quaint. Anime art everywhere. I'd definitely come back.
author: Shane G.

description: Dining area is small so high probability for a wait. But the staff hustled to get us a seat quickly. Sushi is delicious and fresh. The servers were very friendly and accommodating. Lovely experience.
author: Kelly F.

description: Overrated. I was the only person in there and they took forever to get my sushi order out. I ordered the yellowtail collar and being that it takes a while to cook it, they waited until last second to start grilling it. I was sitting there without any food left to eat as my stomach began to settle. I walked out and told them to just keep it (after paying for it),
author: Oliver T.

description:
Context: came here on a date
+Small and intimate
+Sushi was yummy
-A bit expensive considering what we ordered
-Menu advertises 6 pieces but you actually get 5.
author: Julio M.

description:
Solid small, unassuming  neighborhood sushi bar that's worth a try.

This time we had the Dragon Roll, Crunch Roll, Spicy Tuna Roll and a Spider Roll.  That's right, I am not very adventurous.  Having said that, I like what I like, and I like Sushi Toni.

Good food, good sake selection and friendly service.  What's not to like?
author: brandie y.

description:
Sushi Toni is a downtown stop for casual sushi, with a no-nonsense ambiance, friendly service and some unique menu items. 

And I mean u-nique. I've had flash-fried rolls and torched rolls before, but never baked with mozzarella cheese. This was a first. Our foray into the baked rolls was the volcano, I think it was called. It came with baked crab. The whole combination of flavors was rich, but actually quite good.

Rachel F and I also ordered a reasonably priced small bottle of Onikoroshi sake to go along with our other two rolls---the rainbow and the dragon. The quality of the fish in each one seemed solid and everything hit the spot. Loved it.

My one regret is not sitting at the sushi bar, since the chef seemed to be a smiling bundle of energy and I imagine it would be a lot of fun. Next time!
author: Annie D.

description: I went here 3 out of the 4 nights I was staying in SF on business at The Fairmont. It was within walking distance (without having to hike too far down/up the hill.) It's sort of a hole in the wall, but the quality of the sushi and the service is great. I highly recommend Sushi Toni!
author: Jennifer C.

description:
Great service. They know Gluten free and will tell exactly what is fresh. Ask Toni for some great suggestions. I have been here three times in two weeks and have not been disappointed. Also try the chefs suggestions - you can't go wrong. 

They are also very baby friendly but space is limited in this place and they only have one high chair.
author: Pilar M.

description:
A trip to Sushi Toni makes you remember why sushi is so popular in California!  Great service, great food, and if you are very lucky a jolly Toni will be there to tell you stories or cheer you to more saki!

The BTS roll is my favorite.

Ask Toni for the Special Roll and he will create something fabulous... we had a shrimp and lobster roll last time. Amazing!
author: Jack C.

description: Doesn't look like much from the outside, but the sushi is terrific and the people who work there are great.
author: Charlie S.

description:
There's not much in the way of ambiance but it's a great option in the Union Square area if you want affordable sushi without sacrificing on quality. The fish here was very fresh. I came here for dinner without reservations and my party got seated at the bar. The chef talked to us and entertained us with random stories. You can tell he really has a passion for creating the rolls. The rolls here were very good. Perfect balance of sauce and fresh fish. I don't like when sushi rolls are drenched in sauce and you can't taste the ingredients. That's not an issue here. 

The Romeo & Juliet roll was very good. I also liked the Lion King roll. The chef was particularly proud of the Lion King Roll and he told us that it's unique in that it has a combination of 5 different cheeses, which are: Brie, mozzarella, Gorgonzola, Parmesan (?), and another one I don't remember. He said that they only use good mozzarella, not the crap that most people are accustomed to. The cheese gave the roll a unique flavor. The volcano roll was very good as well. I highly recommend it for those that like a mild spicy kick. The spicy flavor doesn't come out until you're done and it's balanced with the sweet/savory ingredients. Yum!
