The service here is very warm and friendly. The waitress made sure that our cups were always filled with warm green tea. It's a little bit of an uphill trek from Union Square but absolutely worth it. I've tried a lot of sushi places in the surrounding area and this is the best I've tried and the prices are reasonable for the quality, as well as comparable to surrounding sushi restaurants. It's next to a porn theater but the area is perfectly safe. No shady characters and it doesn't smell like pee, which I can't say the same for most of the neighboring streets!
author: Nancy C.

description:
Have you ever reveled in the sweet, sweet sounds of Air Supply's "I'm All Out Of Love" while stuffing your face with sushi? 

I'm pretty dang proud to say that I have. And I'm not sure that I can convey to you how awesome it really was. Also: enjoying the company of one Annie D while doing so = totally excellent.

Sushi Toni is an informal, sort of hole-in-the-wall spot on Bush, and it's cheap-ish and the rolls are inventive and the fish? It's pretty fresh, to boot.

Here's what's weird: Mozzarella cheese in a roll? Neither AD or I truly understood... 

What we ordered: The dragon roll, the rainbow roll, and a roll I can't recall the name of, but I do recall this -- it was hot. We were quite weirded out at first, but to our mutual surprise, it was quite tasty and totally delicious despite its less than traditional temperature. And it was spicy!

Our chef? So so sweet. I felt a little worried/shameful when he noticed the liberal, liberal amounts of wasabi I was applying to the maki, but he laughed it off and said that he too, was a big fan of wasabi. (What can I say... a gal's gotta get her Japanese horseradish on!) Team-ish service was sweet and attentive for the most part, and overall? A pretty solid deal. Four big stars for Sushi Toni!
author: Rachel F.

description:
Came here with my in-laws who were visiting from LA (where there are plenty of  outstanding sushi restaurants) based on the good reviews on Yelp, but was really disappointed.

Service: 2 stars / nice but slow
- Despite the restaurant only having a couple tables occupied, the waitstaff took pretty long to get our drinks, food, and bussing extra plates off the table.

Food: 1 stars / small portions and way overpriced
- My in-laws ordered the tempura udon and the $45 sashimi plate.  The tempura udon came with only 1 tiny shrimp tempura, a 3 small veggies.  Most decent Japanese restaurants will at least have 2 shrimp (or a decent sized one).  And if you pay $45 for any one plate, you'd expect to be wowed by the presentation or taste, right?  Neither applied.
- My husband and I ordered the Sushi/Sashimi Combo Plate and a selection of nigiri, and the Agedashi Tofu.  The combo plate was decent but the sashimi was all tuna and salmon -- and then more tuna and salmon nigiri.  And I'm not a big fan of salmon in the first place. 

I really can't imagine how this restaurant has gotten so many good reviews, unless their rolls are out of this world (and we don't typically order rolls).  If you're a true sushi/sashimi fan, you will not like this place.
author: Caroline C.

description: The interior is nothing fancy,  but we had some very tasty sushi here. The baked Lion King roll with melted mozzarella was so good! My frield loved it and I had to have one too. My spice dragon roll was very good too.
author: Adrian V.

description:
Finding a place to eat in Union Square is not hard. Narrow your search down to: open at 3, cheap, and healthy; a little harder to find. Not to mention a place that isn't packed with tourists.

One of the few places downtown that offers all this is Toni. Don't be fooled by the small space and even smaller sign.
Good quality fish, good service, and they deliver! Trust me when I say this is my new shopping re-fueling spot.
author: Alyssa G.

description: YUM! Rolls are sizable but prices aren't that great. They have an awkward time between 3:00 - 5:00 so you can't indulge afternoon cravings here. However, really close to union square and really close to Nob Hill. Probably best sushi place in that vicinity
author: Jennifer J.

description: Excellent raw stuff. Toni served us at the sushi bar and he was hilarious. We also allowed him to serve us based on what he thought should have next, he was en pointe.  We had a huge variety and it was completely affordable. Highly recommend!
author: Wesley B.

description: I ordered take out, bad decision. I had fish that went bad, I smelled it as soon as I opened the box. I live in the neighborhood and thought I'd give it a shot from all the good reviews.
author: Jenny K.

description: I went with my girlfriend and her parents on a Friday evening. We ordered some of their standard sushi rolls (Dragon, Caterpillar, Spider roll, and Spicy Tuna) and they were just not up to par with other sushi places we've been to. The presentation was good, but the fish ingredients seemed far from fresh. These are fairly standard rolls for SF, so I expected better. This rating would have been lower, but upon remarking that the sushi wasn't that good they gave a free dessert of tempura banana and ice cream. I appreciated that.
author: Robert M.

description:
Disappointed. I still have not found a good sushi place in SF. 

Uni $10.50 but not bigger than other cheaper places. 
Salmon nigiri: very thin and poorly cut 
Spider roll: overly battered with a weird sweet sauce not eel sauce
Udon was bloated and not good.

We also ordered other rolls, but nothing was particularly good. =(
author: S N.

description: Very good and reasonably priced sushi.  I had the Romeo and Juliet roll based on a recommendation.  It was very good.  So was the Eel and avocado roll.  I also had the white tuna sushi.  Everyone was very friendly.  I would definitely go back.
author: Mark B.

description:
*********************** 672 **************************

        I love their location, next to the adult theater, how cool is that! Their nigiri is the cheapest in town, and decent!  

- Sashimi for lunch is only $12.50 choices 2 each, salmon, tuna, & hamachi! Steal!!!

- Sunomono salad with salmon is good here. 

- Spinach Oshitashi - steamed spinach with special house sesame sauce, I like it!

- Dynamite Boom & Lion King rolls, worth to check it out.

          I love the fact Sushi Toni is so casual with TVs for me to watch sport. Service is super nice. Even 1 time, my bestfriend & I came in just to drink Sake and watch the game, they were totally cool with us. + 1 star for service!!!

         They located on the stiff street, don't wear 5 inches heels like me! Eeek!
author: Manda Bear B.

description:
They're very sweet here - exceptionally so, and this proved a perfect landing spot for the dessert lover, peanut and I on a day when the skies were proving overcast, our palates parched, the inclines steep, our hope for expedient sustenance fleeting. 

It's a fairly simple, spartan arrangement, framed by the sushi bar itself in the back and the smattering of tables sprinkled throughout the rest of the restaurant. Staff was regularly near but seldom hovering, and I found our sashimi and sushi choices just fine. Admittedly, I'm less devout when it comes to sushi selections than some, but I've devoured sushi in some pretty heady company and I thought they did a fine job here. 

You're definitely not paying for ambiance with your sashimi, rolls or otherwise, but they sport smiles in abundance and regularity and we left happy and full. Which is an excellent start to whatever you have planned after.
author: Kevin N.

description: More like 3.5 stars. The inside of the restaurant is pretty small so we decided to order food to go and eat it back at the hotel. Tried the beef teriyaki combo-$18. Steak was on the thin side and a little tough, prob due to being overcooked. The tempura it came with was nice and crunchy. The 5 piece Calif. roll that was included was really good, tasted creamy. Imitation crab was used. Also ordered two rolls- the Naruto roll $14 and Romeo & Juliet roll $12.50. The R&J roll was salmon, rice and avocado wrapped in soybean paper topped with a large scallop in a light eel sauce. It was really really good! I loved it!  The Naruto roll is a no rice roll wrapped in cucumber. It was very bland. Tasted like the fish had been frozen and defrosted, there was no flavor whatsoever. This roll was 5 pieces and definitely not worth the $14.
author: Sandy G.

description:
We went to Sushi Toni for dinner last night out of curiosity as I pass by this place often walking around my neighborhood.  The food was really good, but I have to say that it is not very Japanese-y as I tasted lots of flavors in our tempura udon (w/ salad) and chicken donburi (w/ salad & miso soup) that tasted more Korean than Japanese (the giveaway was the prevalent sesame seasoning).  Don't get me wrong, I still liked our dishes a lot (and I love Korean food!), but really, this place is a fusion of Japanese and Korean food and flavors.  

Good tempura batter (not too thick) and the miso soup was right on.  

The decor is definitely Korean-influenced, tea cups would normally be much thicker so you don't burn your hands on the hot green tea contents, and soup spoons are not normally given with miso soup.  

Service was really nice and friendly, and it's an upbeat place with lively music (I hear there is live music now and then - very cool!).  I might come back to try the sushi.

Tempura udon+chicken donburi+2 hot teas = $25

Lastly, my sincere condolences to the family of the owner of the previous restaurant located here called Sushi Man.
author: Maile N.

description:
If Sushi Toni can host a group of 18 on a whim... then 5 stars all around.
We came in and took over the entire place on a Friday night and Toni did nothing but serve us food, food, sake, beer, more food and food. 
I never even looked at a menu- we sat down and immediately had sake shooters in hand and food coming out of the kitchen. 
I think we tried almost everything on the menu from prawn tempura to crab cakes and rolls. 
Toni and his staff were great sports about the whole ordeal as I know we turned other customers away because we were so loud and obnoxious. 
The servers had smiles on from the moment we walked in the door and I felt like family sitting at a big family style sushi dinner.
Thanks Toni - from "The Blonde"...
author: Janell D.

description:
Bob Marley + Friendly Staff + Good Food = First Review in 4 months. (Wow really!?!)

Came here the other night with a friend visiting from out of town (LA)... not yet knowing where the best japanese places are in the City, I ended up here through the friendly reviewers on Yelp.

Staff was super friendly... Marley played on the speakers definitely created a nice vibe (for me at least).

Food was pretty good I must say. Between the two us, we order two rolls, two orders of sashimi, and orders of toro and uni nigiri.

Soup + salad = 1 star
Good uni and toro = 1 star
Pretty fresh sashimi = 1 star

The rolls were okay... but I was fine with okay.

One of the sushi chefs came over to our table and was surprised that we ate all our food... eh, I'm a big boy.

Anyway, I was satisfied with my meal, and would come back if I was in the neighborhood and in the mood for some Marley.
author: Victor C.

description: The outside of the store is not the best of its kind; but the sushi is definitely very fresh! Must come back again!
author: Simon C.

description:
With SN in giant stilettos and me a little tired from a busy day fighting a parking ticket we couldn't muster the energy to go too far from the hotel for some sushi. Luckily Sushi Toni was right down the way (and reasonably close to a male strip club!) 

The staff was nice but a little absent minded. They always seemed to be standing right outside of us thinking, "Should I refill that water? When would be a good time to clear that plate? Are they ready to order?" It was like they wanted to help but weren't quite sure how. 

After taking a fair amount of time to study the menu I made some decisions. Their specialty rolls are very unique and exciting. They offer some combinations I have not yet heard of. I would return just for that. 
I ended up with some salmon sushi and a volcano roll (crab, avocado, spicy sauce, eel sauce, tobiko) and a rainbow roll. 

Sushi wise the salmon was pretty good. The rice wasn't warm (like I've experienced and not liked lately) and the fish was good quality. The rainbow roll was yummy too (though those are hard to mess up). The volcano roll (and I can't believe I'm going to say this) had just too much sauce. I love sauce. I love it all over things (and my face). But on this roll it overwhelmed anything that might have been happening. It still tasted good (as sauces often do) but it was pretty one noted. Next time I would like to try the Romeo and Juliet Roll.

To top off the meal we tried to order the black sesame ice cream but they were out. Sad story.

I have a good vibe from here and it's clear they are really trying. With their exciting roll combinations it could have been largely my fault I had a so-so experience. I would be interested in testing out some of their other neat rolls.
author: Tai F.

description: Excellent omakase - had giant clam, very fresh.  All the fish was fresh and tasty. Chef Chris is very personable and accommodating. A small place, yet a treasure. Will definitely be back.
author: Mitch A.

description:
The boyfriend and I were hoping to go to another Japanese curry place but we didn't realize that it would be closed on a Saturday, so we went on Yelp to see what other kind of Japanese restaurants there were.

I was craving sushi, and the place that had the highest rating in the area that was $$ was Sushi Toni.

It's a small place with anime pictures on the wall, and the waitresses are really nice.

I was pretty excited because I felt the specialty rolls were unique, and I ordered the Volcano Roll. The boyfriend ordered the Nigiri combo.

It took around 30 minutes for the food to arrive; the Nigiri combo alone took a good 15 minutes to make (we were watching the chef). 12 pieces of Nigiri. That's more than a minute per piece! The Volcano Roll was 6 tiny pieces, topped with cheese and spicy sauce. It was a little too much topping for me and too little of the roll.

Bill came out to be around $34 plus tip. Not worth it.
author: Olivia L.

description:
Def the best sushi place, i've had in SF so far. their baked salmon roll was good & the shrimp tempura roll were pretty good!

it was definitely NOT BAD, it was goooooood
author: Karina B.

description: I've now been here two times, and I've had two disappointing meals. So two stars. There is better in the area for comparable price. If there's no ramen I expect the sushi to make up for it. Doesn't happen here. I had to stop at a corner store on the walk home for some pretzels. I was still hungry.
author: Anthony T.

description:
Nothing glamorous here.  But, man, is the sushi fresh, creative and good.  Ordered the Romeo & Juliet (Scallop), Crunch Roll, a couple pieces of sushi, and asked the chef to make me "something special" (and it WAS).  Delicious meal, maybe a little bit expensive but not the run of the mill sushi place.

Would recommend....
author: Matt G.

description:
I was excited to see a new sushi spot in the 'hood, replacing Sushi Man (which wasn't bad, but was overpriced with slow service).  I first came here a few weeks ago with my boy Cris B. and was very pleased.

The prices are competitive, the fish is fresh and the service is pretty good.  They remember people who come back and are always very friendly.  Toni, the main sushi chef, is very friendly and it's obvious that he really cares about people leaving his restaurant happy.

Also, they highly value their status here on Yelp.  There is now a sign hanging directly below the main sign of the business showing the love they've been getting on Yelp.  This sign is just as big as the main business sign, I'll upload a picture when I get a chance.

Great sushi spot, I'm fortunate to live right around the corner.
author: Joseph N.

description: If you're looking for traditional sushi then you can safely pass. The chef admitted it's not their thing. The uni I had was sour and milky. When I asked where it was from they said Mendecino - where you go to buy for a bargain and not quality. All there fish was so-so, best suited for roles. I ordered salmon belly, but it wasn't belly. The rice under the nigiri wasn't warm and it was squeezed so hard you really had to work to get it apart.  What a disappointment.
author: Grayson K.

description:
Traditional. 
High quality ingredients. 
The rice in the sushi stood out. It was cooked perfectly and quite possibly the best I've ever had.
author: Jordan S.

description: Dinner last night was great! The decor does not do the food justice. Don't be fooled into dismissing this place.
author: Koji S.

description: Saw some good reviews and was close to my hotel so stopped by.. sushi was really good, prices weren't crazy, and wasn't overly fancy (which I like) Going to come back for sure!!
author: Yuri W.

description: Three words... Yum Yum Roll. So good and tasty. I don't care if it's not really the way the Japanese people imagined their dish served! The 49er roll and cilantro roll are delicious too. I always come to this place after a trip to Union Square!
author: Dean T.

description: A good neighborhood sushi spot!  Friendly but slow staff.  Not a huge variety of rolls but food is very fresh!
author: C W.

description:
We really enjoyed our dinner from here. The place is comfortable, and the service was very friendly. The prices are reasonable for the size of the rolls. 

We enjoyed all of the rolls we ordered, but I have to say, this is the first time that I have had a roll with cheese! Try it - the Lion King roll; different and worth trying.
author: Anthony P.

description: Dragon roll is a must eat! Fried tofu is just average. Spinach salad had a bit too much vinegar.
author: QL M.

description:
In town for a little short trip in San Francisco!

Decor: Small, cozy almost mom and pop like. not pretentious at all.

Service: Well attended to. Got to hear nice hum of korean in the background, haha.

Food: 
- Romeo & Juliet: THE BEST one we got! It's light, refreshing and pretty great
- Spicy yellowtail: It was okay to me; more to my friend's liking
- Baked Volcano: I think this was what it was called anyway; it was basically stuffed with crab meat and cheese was baked on top (so the entire plate was hot). My friend and I found this dish a bit too heavy for our tastes, but it was still good.

Overall: I think it was a decently priced restaurant and I got my sushi fix here, so I'm satisfied!
author: Jessica L.

description:
I have wonderfully fond memories of this place - my boyfriend and I go here whenever we escape to SF for the weekend.

The waitresses are very attentive and accomodating, and they are genuinely trying to make sure their customers are happy.

The boyfriend and I always do sake bombs here, which is a request that I don't think they're used to having - instead of a beer glass, they give you a plastic cup... although now that I think of it, that's probably a smart move. I wonder if they give plastic cups because of a poor experience of someone dropping a sake shot straight through glass....

Anyway, their fish is consistently fresh, and their rolls are always constructed well. There's only one bathroom, but the building is small, so it's not usually hard to go when you need to.

I'll admit, it's in a kind of shady area (I remember the building next to it was advertising male strippers, haha) but it's always a good experience.
author: Tiffany W.

description:
I visited Sushi Toni for a late dinner when visiting San Francisco not long ago.  I was looking to satisfy that sushi craving everyone gets as soon as they land at SFO... and Sushi Toni delivered.  It looks a bit like a hole in the wall from the outside (but then again, that's hardly unusual for SF...).  Go anyway, it's a nice little casual spot on the inside worthy of a visit (FYI: you'll probably feel out of place if you're dressed to impress here).

After scanning the menu, I found what I would soon learn is my favorite sushi roll of all time:  The Lion King!  (Crab, Avocado, Salmon, with baked Mozzarella Cheese!!!)  It might sound a little weird, but don't be a fool, get it anyway!!!  This is one dish I don't recommend sharing with your table to anyone who didn't get it - if you do, you should expect intense envy or outright/brazen food stealing.  You've been warned.

The staff was nice and didn't rush the service.  Overall I was pleased and you will be too!
author: A J.

description: Checked yelp for some sushi downtown before catching a flick and tried this place out on based on the review count and rating. Yelp works!  The place is called Sushi Toni.  It was Toni that was our chef!  We noticed people kept coming in from the street to say hi and put two and two together. He's really nice and made sure we were enjoying ourselves. Definitely recommend sitting at the bar. Thanks again Toni!
author: Steve Y.

description:
I needed a sushi restaurant near union square that was affordable but also delicious.

I found sushi toni on yelp and I'm glad I did.

it's a typical korean owned sushi joint with its share of eclectic and random decor.
the vibe is very casual.

me and the lady shared a sushi boat. the fish was very fresh and delicious. i was expecting a bit more for ordering a boat but the fish was good so really can't complain too much. also, the sushi wasn't served on a boat which was kind of disappointing. =)

but in conclusion, i had a pleasant experience with good food.
author: Samuel P.

description: Horrible service and rolls come out literally an hour later. There's only one chef and 7 tables..hire more staff. Rolls were overpriced and tasted whatever, nothing special.
author: Mary F.

description: Sushi was good and prices are pretty good too.  We had a volcano roll, shrimp roll, philadelphia roll, and rainbow roll, all of which were good...especially the rainbow roll!  The mizo soup was also good and only $2!  Service was great.  Definitely worth a stop.
author: Jesse M.

description:
I've been here a handful of times.  I think I've tried pretty much all their specialty rolls.  All I can say is, everything tastes great!  The fish is really fresh and the rolls are all well balanced.  

Service is great, the waitresses are super sweet and the sushi chef is really friendly as well.

They do have 3 baked rolls on their menu, but they all taste similar (they all are topped with their special sauce) - so you only need to order one baked roll each time you go.  (but their baked rolls are yummy!) 

Their specialty rolls average out to be about $8.50 - $9 each.

4-stars!
author: Veronica N.

description:
I saw this as one of the higher rated sushi places near my place in SF. I also saw they had a check-in deal on 4square for spend $10 get $10 credited to your Amex account.

I went here expecting so pretty good sushi. What I got was, very slow service and so-so sushi. 

I ordered the sushi sashimi combo plate and the Family Affair roll. The sashimi was fresh and the tuna roll it came with was filled with so much rice, you would have never known there was tuna in there except for this red looking spec

The family affair roll is loaded with stacks and stacks of onions. it tasted pretty good, but the roll sizes are small and the prices really don't justify them either.

It took a pretty darn long time for us to get our food and they came out at such staggered times that by the time our whole table received our food others were playing games on their iphone because they had finished already.

I also asked for the black sesame ice cream that people raved about and the waitress told me they dont serve that hear. i seriously thought I was in the wrong restaurant because of the ratings they received and the service I had just gotten.

The PRO
The place is decorated with anime, so you can look at pictures of Pokemon and Naruto to sooth yourself while you wait for the food.

I'm surprised this place got such good reviews, but without the Amex deal I would not return to this place for sushi
author: Steven C.

description:
I went here based upon glancing at the overall rating. When I entered the restaurant, I got really curious and started to read further into the reviews and oh boy it wasn't what I have expected. So I decided to order a large sake and just one roll, romeo and Juliet (read it on yelp). Can't go wrong with sake but the roll was just okay for me, it was actually fishy. Believe it was scallop and salmon.

There's nothing special about the menu.
author: Nhung T.

description:
What a great find!!! Thank you Yelp, and thank you Sushi Toni for taking reservations. Made our pre-"Hair" dining experience so much easier!
The sushi was fresh and delicious, and very reasonably priced. I'm actually surprised it was two dollar signs. We ordered two hot teas, two rolls, shared a nigiri/sashimi plate, side of rice, and two miso soups. It was less than $40. Hells yah!!
The decor is not that lovely, and service was so-so. But all in all, I was quite pleased.
author: Sydney W.

description:
I was up visiting from Calgary and watching people on Twitter back home complaining about the blizzard that had just struck. One girl mentioned how much she was craving sushi but didn't want to brave the cold to go get some. I needed dinner, there was no blizzard in SF, and sushi sounded good to me!

I hopped on Yelp and found Sushi Toni's was nearby, so off I went. As I walked through the door of this bright little joint, I was greeted immediately and invited to take my pick of places to sit. Would I like a table? Or a spot at the sushi bar? I chose the bar where two smiling, cheery sushi chefs were preparing everyone's food.

I always appreciate the sushi combos when I'm doing sushi solo. The combo I ordered came with an assortment of tekka maki and nigiri. The combo also came with a bowl of miso soup and a side salad. The rolls couldn't have been fresher. They were made right in front of my eyes. This might just have to go on my list of places I stop in at when I'm in SF.

Thanks Toni & team for sensational service and sushi!

On a sidenote - the smaller sushi places seem to always be the best ones!
author: Wendy P.

description: Excellent place for late night dinning . Friendly staff!
author: Lauren R.

description:
Yo dis here place iz really tight. ah can come here order dere tempura, sushi at odd hours in da day. they service iz quick an' easy. ah bring all 
muh motha effin dates here what the eff sup now?

Yo ah can use muh motha effin' credit card an' git United flyer miles. It's GREAT don't make me shank ya!
author: Yue T.

description:
I had looked forward to eating here for a while because, for reasons beyond my comprehension, it has many good yelp reviews.  Sadly, my bf and I were so disappointed by our experience at Sushi Toni.  First off, the service was unbelievably slow.  They had 2 waitresses with only 4 tables occupied, and yet we waited over 20 minutes to order.  Both waitresses would brush by and avoid eye contact, ignoring your signals to get their attention.   

At first the prices seem kind of moderate for sushi, until you see how little food they actually serve you.  I think if you tally it up by the ounce, this may be the most expensive sushi around.  Not nearly the best quality, though. 

Probably the worst thing is that the dining area is SWARMING WITH FRUIT FLIES!  Really bad.  We were constantly batting them away from our food, and they swamped the sakki so bad they were all over the bottle and IN the sakki!  When I pointed it out to the waitress, she apologized and brought another bottle, and said the sakki was free.  I thought this a nice gesture...that is until she turned around and charged us for it.  When we pointed this out on our bill, the very same waitress told us it's a charge and we had drank some of the sakki.  I mentioned again it was swarming with fruit flies the whole time.  She offered to 'take care of it' and I thought maybe this time she would.  Instead, she took $2 off the price.  So, that's how much we tipped the bish.  

Seriously, these people need a new attitude.  And an exterminator!
author: Leslie F.

description: Lots of baked rolls but non of them r good. No hot appitaizaers.  Salmon sashimi was good. Server didnt know what he was doing. I would not come back again.
author: Lana L.

description:
Surprisingly yum!!!
Total whole in the wall, but we both thought the fish was fresh and delicious. Will certainly be going back. 
Staff very friendly.
author: G W.

description: Not fresh or well done. Most of the lettuce in the green salad was rotten. The tuna avocado roll was okay. The avocado eel roll was really off-putting. Would not recommend.
author: Margot W.

description: Amazing sushi!  Only wished that the sashimi portions have a larger sized option.  The rolls are very yummy!
author: Salina L.

description:
It was a bit of a hike from Union Square-up hill all the way... but the place is clean and the people are very nice and attentive! We sat at a table, but may try sitting at the bar, so we can watch them making the dishes! 
The sushi was fresh and yummy! Try the Swamp Roll and be sure to ask if there are any special rolls!
The owner was there and very personable. He is going to have music some Fridays that he is excited about.
author: Dawn R.

description:
Sushi Toni was an unexpected Diamond in the Rough on a search for good local sushi.  We were at a conference in San Francisco and "yelped" our way to this great place via the four star rating.

Fish is very fresh, generous cuts, buttery shiro maguro toro was available and all at an incredibly reasonable price.  The crunch roll was an especially tasty treat and one I haven't seen on the scene before.

Toni in and of himself is an adventurous soul and truly someone to chat with if you have a chance to belly up to the bar.  We were pleasantly surprised all the way around.  Saw a couple eyeballing a sushi boat type place around the corner when we left and steered them to Toni.

The only thing I might consider changing at Sushi Toni is the music selection.  Very old school eclectic mix is wide of sushi type ambience but does not detract entirely from the sushi experience.

Kanpai!  (Great sake offerings as well!)
author: Carmen C.

description:
Probably a 3.5 star.
Food was good, fish was fresh but rolls had too much rice (some was actually falling in the serving plate itself). 

We had a the two most popular items by fellow yelpers: volcano rolls,  Romeo &Juliet, and salmon and yellowtail. The volcano rolls is interesting, served warm - but in fact it was actually hot - too hot to eat even after cooling for a few minutes. The rainbow roll was good - very tasty and a good combination of stuff. 
The salmon and yellowtail was ok, fairly typical. Both the volcano and salmon&yellowtail actually had rice falling...before we even touched it. 
Service was fine - we had to pay extra to substitute salmon for crab meat. Prices were generally, as guided. 

Overall, its ok, nothing to write home about. In summary, I would not be opposed to going back but I am not planning another trip.  

The star reviews (4) overall guided us a bit to come try out Sushi Toni, although if you actually read the reviews you realize that there is a fair degree of polarizing opinions, and well - reality is probably somewhere in the middle.
author: Bhavin M.

description: Great sushi & service, wanted a quick bite which did the job. Decor is basic & not first date material, Toni is super friendly, love it!
author: Gar Wing L.

description: I came here for some quick takeout. I ordered the rainbow roll, which was delicious! The staff was polite and quick to fill the order. I'd definitely go back and try more.
author: V N.

description:
In SF for a long weekend and stopped at Sushi Toni's based on Yelp reviews.  We walked in at 12:30 on a Thursday and were the only customers there.  We were also hit with a pungent musty smell.  We almost turned around, but based on the reviews, we stayed.

The salmon nigiri was fresh and the Volcano roll was good, but it didn't blow me away.  We also shared a large Sapporo.  The bill was $21.50 for those three items -- overpriced!

The sushi chef was nice, but complained about the construction a lot.  I understand how frustrating that can be, but don't keep complaining about it.  I'm okay with complaints in conversation, but not them being the focus of the conversation...even when we tried to change the subject.

There are too many good sushi places in SF to come back here.

We were there about 30 minutes and not a single customer walked in HTH does that happen in downtown SF???
author: Jody R.

description:
This is a great neighborhood sushi restaurant!  The sushi is fresh and tasty!  And the service is awesome and the atmosphere is fun!!  Toni is great and he'll make whatever roll you like.  We had unagi sashimi style...me likey that A LOT!!!

Just go to Sushi Toni already, you won't regret it!!
author: Mao K.

description:
Food - 4 stars, Service - 2 stars

I ordered the Nigiri combo (12 pieces, $25).  Not a great deal, but the sashimi didn't have combos, only 9 straight pieces of the same fish.  This was a mistake, as a lot of the nigiri pieces were terrible (fishy).  Friend ordered the Dragon Roll and loved it.

Bad stuff:  I have a gluten allergy and asked the waitress if any type of sauce came with the nigiri.  She said no, but the nigiri came with wasabi added to the bottom on top of the rice.  Now, apparently this is how nigiri is always served, so my mistake.  They were nice enough to show me the package of wasabi to confirm there was no gluten and to bring me gluten-free soy sauce.  However, I'd originally spit out the piece of tuna nigiri because I was worried.  They REFUSED to replace the piece of tuna!  One lousy piece, but my favorite on the platter.  They said it was my fault for not knowing how nigiri is always served.
author: Sona P.

description:
Great neighborhood spot! I've been here twice since moving to the area and will certainly return. Toni and his wife Lucy are fantastic and very friendly. I recommend just about any of the rolls...what I haven't had yet I've seen being made, and everything looks great. For a super casual place, the food is always presented artfully. I appreciate that. Also a plus...if you like The Beatles, it's likely you'll hear an album or two here. And, they just bought a large flat screen TV if you prefer to watch your sports over Japanese food and sake. ;-)

Looking for something a bit fancier with a more extensive menu? Try Sanraku at Sutter & Taylor nearby.
author: Jessica M.

description:
Tried this place based on the Yelp reviews and wound up really liking it. Good quality fish, attentive servers and damn good rolls, if you're into that sort of thing.  It's become my go-to place for sushi while in that part of SF. 

The decor is fairly plain other than the anime art on the walls. On a typical night, the small restaurant feels just right. On a night where someone's 20 person strong birthday party was going on, it was not a charming dining experience. In that case if my friend and I hadn't already been there and knew of the quality of the wait staff we probably would have tried to find another place.
author: Rachel B.

description: Loved the beetles music and anime decor. Waiter was attentive and friendly. Sushi. Was. Bomb. Like butter. Some of the best since I lives in Japan.
author: Laura W.

description: Fish was really fresh. The Dragon Roll was really good. The Romeo & Juliet Roll was so very tasty.
author: John M.

description:
I've enjoyed Tony's sushi for years.  From the days at Maru sushi, to Sushi Boom and am very happy (read VERY EXCEITED!!!) that he's opened his new place.  I've enjoyed great times with family and friends and it is always the best.  The food is fresh, creative, and the food and environment are even better here on Bush St.  My best meals are when I got in and let Toni decide what's the best for that evening.  

A sample of what we enjoyed last night included:

maguro - sushi, sashimi
hamachi - sushi, sashimi
sake - sushi, sashimi, kama
makeral - sashimi
scapllops - sushi
spicy tuna - roll (swamp roll, yummy!), sashimi
oysters - deep fried (yummy!!!)

I've been several times since the grand opening a few weeks ago and am already planning to get back there this Fiday evening for the live music.  Stop by if you're in the area, heck, stop by even if you're not.  The friendly atmosphere and food are definitely worth your time.
author: Jonathon J.

description:
Ordered hot tea. Received tepid tea. Sent it back. 
Servers not very attentive. 
Rolls were ok, not great.
author: Kristin H.

description: The first time I went here they were very helpful about gluten free options. Found the squid rolls to be a bit tough. LOVED the volcano rolls but the romeo and juliet was not for me. Got take away a second time. The girl remembered my gluten intolerance and that I had liked the volcano rolls. Tried the lion rolls this time and the shrimp rolls both were lovely! Fresh fish, lovely flavours and friendly service
author: Heather R.

description: Great find. I travel to SF quite a bit and love to find local, low key places where the local folks likely go. Saw lots of takeout from locals which is always a good sign. Great sushi specials, generous sashimi portions, very reasonable prices and solid service.
author: Rob Z.

description: Sushi tastes good, service was good too, but a total rip off. Portions were extremely small. You'll spend $60 a person to get full (without alcohol)
author: ashim n.

description: Hole-in-the-wall sushi joint. Nothing fancy or special about it. It's quick and easy for a bite on the run.
author: Derwood A.

description: We have brought most of our friends here to try the ____ roll - it is a favorite time and time again. I like the casual vibe here and the service is friendly and fast. There is anime in frames around on the wall, the decor just makes me grin. The sushi is fresh and we've tried almost every roll.
author: Halley S.

description: My wife and I go here regularly and out of all the local sushi places, Toni's is our favorite. They have great quality sushi and a large selection of special roles. Their cooked dishes are delicious too. What adds to the experience is a good selection of music and the small business feeling where the owner is actually part of the team. Toni and his wife both work there and clearly care about their customers and business and it shows. Thanks Toni!
author: Adrian A.

description: This is by far the best sushi restaurant in the neighborhood!  I recommend the 49er's roll!  Delicious!!
author: Pat D.

description:
This place should be called Sushi Tony! Toni! Toné!...or Sushi Bel Biv DeVoe...or Sushi Keith Sweat. Why, you ask? Lemme tell you why. Not only did the boy and I enjoy some bomb@ss grub, but we did so to the tunes of the aforementioned, as well as Jon B, Shai, H-Town, New Edition and more of the smooth R&B jams I used to bump when I was in my teenage-angst phase.

So imagine my delight when I walked into this tiny, cozy restaurant right by Union Square and the first thing I hear is, "Ahhhh, yeah....Give me some good love (some body rockin, knockin da boots)...Some body rockin baby, Give me some good love (some body rockin, knockin da boots)" Uh-huh. Word. This place is the truth. But five star review for the music aside, this place was a real surprise. I don't expect much in terms of quality or value at any restaurant in the vicinity of Union Square. But Sushi Tony! Toni! Toné! (yes, I will refer to this place as such from now on) is both yummy and affordable.

Our meal breakdown:

* Romeo & Juliet Roll- absolutely delicious! This roll is described as salmon & avocado inside with scallops on top. Now I am not a fan of raw scallops, or scallops in general, but this roll was SO good! And for $9.95, there were at least 7 or 8 pieces! The salmon slices were fresh and perfectly complemented the avocado squares. Again, the scallops were delicious. Almost melted in our mouths!

* Chirashi- This is the boy's go-to Japanese order. Always. Anywhere. Anytime. This is his barometer. Chirashi (chef's choice of sashimi-styled sushi atop vinegared rice) at Sushi Tony! Toni! Toné! was amazing! Unlike other Japanese restaurants, they served their Chirashi in a longer, but more shallow bowl. Most places serve it in a bowl (kinda like what you would eat udon or cereal out of). Sushi Tony! Toni! Toné! gave generous portions, thick (but well-cute sashimi slices) and they put furikake (AKA the salt & pepper of Japan- it's got sesame seeds, spices, and seaweed) atop the vinegared rice. This extra flavoring took this Chirashi plowl (plate + bowl = zinger!) to another level. Definite re-order. MUST TRY THIS, PEOPLE! $18.

*  Nabe Udon- Sadly, $12.50 cannot buy you much these days. Especially for Japanese. That's what- 2 1/3 pieces of sashimi at some uppity joint? Or maybe 7/8 of a specialty roll? Well at Sushi Tony! Toni! Toné! , $12.50 bought me all that is good and right in the world.  This dish takes a while to make, so if you are super starved, you may need a starter to tide you over til the real deal. The nabe udon comes out in a hot iron mini-pot. It is hot (I know this because I am lame and touched it even though the waitress said not to). Every bit is filled with something: chicken, calamari, shrimp, mussel...you name it, it's there! Most Japanese places are hella shady about their nabe ingredients. You may get ONE shrimp or ONE clam, but definitely not the infinite portions i received at Sushi Tony! Toni! Toné!!! And the broth was simply divine. Not too salty, but perfectly flavored.

*** each entree comes with salad  and soup (tho noodles will not get miso soup since you're eating soup as an entree ***

Miscellaneous Mentionings-
There were lots of 20 and 30-somethings in the restaurant when the boy and I went. Many of whom had a little too much Sake. One table went buckwild when "Rumpshaker" came on. One dude walked up to a girl at another table and threw his number at her (she didn't take it). All through this, the waitresses and sushi chefs stayed professional and friendly.

So aside from reliving my junior year of high school by listening to the grooves of the 90s, I got fed and fed WELL. This place is a definite revisit. "FICKLE ONE"- APPROVED. Betta recognize! =)
author: A A.

description:
The rice on the sushi was terrible. The vegetable udon was blah. You can do much better at the same price.

The salmon nigiri was fresh and good, though.
author: George S.

description: Fantastic sushi place, very fresh and extremely generous. Toni will surprise you with his multi languages !
author: Veronica C.

description: Sushi Toni is a better option than Sushi Maru around the corner, thought it's a little more busy and crowded. When you do get a chance to sit, though, the rolls are fresh and yummy. We also had one of the udon, which was good, too.
author: Jamie C.

description:
What a good sushi restaurant. 

So here's the deal: 

I haven't eaten here, so I can't speak to the service per se, but I have had a great experience with them. I ordered take out (4 rolls, 2 miso soups and a salad) for my boyfriend and I. The woman on the phone was super nice and said that it'd be a 25 minute wait AND she asked if that was okay. Giving them 2 stars just for that courtesy. 

I, of course, said that was alright. The food was ready when I arrived and the woman was super nice and quick. The ambience isn't spectacular - pretty standard, small sushi place - but the food definitely makes it worth going here (or at least ordering from here). 

Arriving home, we opened up the bag to some of the most delicious-looking sushi we've ever seen. We ordered a Red Dragon roll, a Spicy Tuna roll, a B.T.S. roll and a 49er's roll. The Red Dragon was unbelievably good - a must order.

UPDATE: 

I totally forgot to mention how delicious-TASTING the rolls were too. If you're familiar with my Zushi Puzzle review, you'll understand just how good this place is- it's definitely on par with Zushi.
author: Cristina P.

description:
We came here for lunch.  The service was ok and overall the food was average..nothing really spectacular.

We had the following:
Spicy tuna handroll-average-not spicy at all and on the pricey side ( 6.50 )
Spicy scallop handroll-ok ( 6.50 )
Spider roll- good
Lion King roll-ok
Crunch roll-very good

Our drinks were served in a timely manner even though our food took awhile.  We were the only ones in the restaurant and surprised it took so long. The hot sake was ok and the hubby had a large Asahi.   For a meal costing $67 we've definitely had better elsewhere.
author: Lizete S.

description: Came here on a Saturday night. The great thing about this place is that it's open late on the weekends. We had a a spicy tuna roll, uni nigiri, veggie tempura and a chirashi bowl. Honestly the food was ok... nothing really stood out. Nothing memorable for me to come back to.
author: Cynthia C.

description:
You know how a restaurant is so good or so bad that it compels you to create an account just to share?  Well 2 stars is not terrible but I felt like I really needed to write this review because the current 4 star rating is so completely misleading that I can not in good conscience let people think that is place is at all 4 star material. 

If you are like me, then you know that 4 stars on yelp means this is great stuff, and generally yelp does not fail me.  I was so disappointed by this restaurant not because in my opinion it is 2 stars but because so many people gave it 4 stars or higher.

I ordered the eel over rice, a dragon roll and two sushi rolls.  You know the distinct feel of when a roll has too much densely packed rice as if the owners are deliberating making the rolls more filling?  Yep this place does that.  OK so fine, a lot of places do that, at worse that would be the sign of an average 3 star place you say?  

Here is where I knock off a star to bring it down to 2 stars.  They had to audacity to give me a salmon roll with literally no sushi in it.  I was literally was about to take my roll to the owner and ask him, to look at it and tell me if it was even possible to have any less fish than that roll did.  I am 28 and have lived in major cities all my life eating at sushi restaurants and have never had a roll presented to me with as little fish as that roll I had there and even that, I wouldn't have cared so much if I didn't see that Sush Toni has an average 4 star rating...either these reviews are full of shills or these people have no idea what good sushi is.  Seriously people, I am by far not a snob, but this 4 star non sense is just so plain ridiculous.

Service was friendly.
author: dan k.

description:
Interesting sushi place.

I tried to order the "Hanukkah roll," which was the most Jewish thing I did this Hanukkah, but they were out of smoked salmon.  The waitress instead suggested the "49ers" roll because it also had salmon (not smoked). I accepted her suggestion without reading the description carefully. It included raw, thin slices of lemon including the rind on top, which I didn't particularly care for. There's a reason we don't normally eat lemon rind.

I also ordered the "Lion King" roll, which was baked (!) with crab, avocado, salmon, and mozzarella cheese (!!). I'd never had hot sushi before, and it was, well, interesting. When the fish is cooked, the dish is hot, and it is topped with oh-so-Japanese mozzarella cheese, I think sushi stops being sushi and becomes an artfully plated fish entree with rice. Nevertheless, it tasted quite good.
author: Adam B.

description: We were looking for a proper place to eat sushi around Union Square SF. We found Sushi Toni. It is a plain sushi restaurant with kind service. The sushi was very good and after the bill we got a small free dessert. Nice experience!
author: Luigi A.

description:
Pros: service is great -- Toni himself is very friendly --, price per portion is competitive, and the sushi is fantastic!  Favorites include: salmon roll for a light, simple dish; BTS roll (deep friend california roll drizzled in delicious sauce), great for an American palette; anything with eel.

Cons: the space is a little cramped.

I strongly recommend going with a group so you can try several different dishes, most people have their particular favorites.

This is by far my favorite sushi restaurant in the city.
author: Nicolas B.

description: Decent sushi. Nice quaint place. Toni is very friendly guy. Very funny and entertaining. Good amount of sake to choose from.
author: RAy J.

description:
Never knew great sushi existed at this location until I stepped in with some friends after a long day of shopping at Union Square.

The sushi choices were great and the food was very fresh. Service was prompt and cordial. 

I can't wait to come back!
author: Jessie M.

description: Great sushi. Close to Union square. Decor needs some updating but not a big deal. Recommend if traveling in the area. We thought food was yummy and not a rip off
author: Beach G.

description:
1 star for location 
1 star for the friendly service

In U.S. many of Japanese restaurants are owned and operated by non-Japanese, and on the the surface this may not mean much to most people, but for those who experienced Japanese food by Japanese chef, it is as different as night and day.  So I totally understood all the bad reviews came from.  

Bottom line for who is looking for the real deal:-  Keep research and you can delete Sushi Toni from your list.
author: Manda W.

description: Negative stars if possible. Worst sushi ever. Donburi tasted funky. Udon was tasteless. The chef just talked to the customer at the bar the whole time. Don't go ever
author: Prasetyo S.

description:
Looked for a light lunch around Union Square, not too expensive, and ended up here.  We arrived at an empty restaurant and it was all good.  The waitress & sushi maker were extremely nice and the food was good good good.

Food: 
Volcano Roll: Good warm roll.  There's definitely a lot of stuff going on in this one.  I loved the baked crab, just melted in my mouth.  The spiciness was just enough.

Swamp Roll: Really refreshing.  I loved the seaweed salad on top and the spicy tuna was on point.  

Tempura Udon: mmmmm..... it was a chilly afternoon in the city and this soup hit the spot.  The broth was delicious and there was an ample amount of veggies stewing in there.

Overall: We enjoyed it, definitely worth the walk (up a crazy steep hill), and the Sapporo was ice cold... yummm.
author: Isabella O.

description: Dragon Roll $14~$15 a roll.  Menu mention Crab, I expected real crab meat, especially in San Francisco, too bad it happen to be imitation crab meat.
author: Tony C.

description:
Apparently the only thing in life that moves me to write a review is sushi, be it bad sushi or good sushi, so here i go again... 

I had lunch here today and I thought the place was just great. The waitress was super friendly, and as my friend and I were looking over the menu the chef over the counter sent out some shout outs for us to try. Super cool sushi chef, great recommendations, and just totally friendly. 

The food was great, I stuck with what I love the sashimi which was just lovely, cut well, tasted fresh... However my friend had the bowl of udon noodle soup, OMG I tried his and for once in my life wondered "and why didn't i get the noodles" Ahhh oh well live and learn. Can't wait to go back to this place and try what else they have on their menu :)
author: patti k.

description:
LOVE. this place.

Besides how ridiculously hilarious Toni is-the sushi (and many other foods/dishes) even the mochi, which I find to be horribly addicting) is wonderful

Great atmosphere. Food is made fresh and fast. They always have the finest sake....price is about right for the service and freshness. 

Great meet up place if you're taking off to Polk it up for the night...or even a great place if you are on a shopping spree downtown in the square.
author: Stephanie G.

description:
What a suprise...another sushi place on my list. My hub and I were determined to find a spot that was less crowded (for goodness sakes...the holiday craze just tends to take over the entire area of Union Square). 

So we continued UPHILL. Found on my phone this lil' place called Sushi Toni. Small and quaint, we gave it a try.  If I would've known the Red Dragon was WAAAYY better than the regular Dragon roll, I would've ordered two of those! 

After taking my first sip of a cold beverage, I noticed how much I was loving the mixed-cd of slow/R&B jams. I jokingly asked the chefs for a copy and they laughed at me. BUT lil' did they know, I was serious. So if anyone knows how I can get a copy of that CD, I'd be 4-ever grateful.

Other than that, location is steep, prices are not. I'd return.
author: Christina L.

description: From the friendliest  customer service to the freshest sashimi and sushi, I would definitely come back. One of the best sushi rolls I had was the "cilantro roll"!! The chef knows what he's doing and could customize any awesome rolls that you ask for, right at the spot.
author: Jennifer Y.

description:
My bf and I were craving sushi during our trip and this restaurant happened to be a block down from our hotel so we decided to try it out. I was kind of worried when we came and saw that there was only one customer in the place and we must've passed several sushi joints on the way to this place that were all packed and busy.  Nonetheless, I didn't walk all the way up that steep hill for nothing! One way or another we were gonna get our sushi fix. 

We were greeted by the sushi chef who happens to be extremely jovial and talkative. The service is fast and it's a very quaint sushi place with the: 90's r&b slow jams playing in the background suitable for getting you in the mood while eating sushi, the sushi chef's animated chatty discussions with customers, and extremely FRESH sushi. Most of the rolls here are pretty standard, but ask the chef for his recommendation or chef's choice and see what he comes up with.
author: Chi N.

description: Randomly happened upon this place while shopping in Union Square.  The waitresses were friendly, but our food took a reallllly long time to come out.  The rolls tasted fine but were nothing special.  A-OK is probably just how I'd describe the experience here.
author: Pam S.

description:
I was visiting San Fran this past weekend and went into Sushi Toni because i like visiting small, uncrowded, hidden gems like this place.

both waitresses were really nice despite small language barrier.  The chef ( Toni ) was very funny.  kept telling us he had the freshest hamachi and if we didnt like it we didnt have to pay...lol

anyway, we had some sashimi, and a few rolls.  everything was quality, very imaginitive, and well made.

the bill came to around $60 and we left very happy that we took a chance on it.

i would go back if Im in San Fran again soon.
author: Dan L.

description: It's really a 3.5. I came here for lunch on a saturday. The fish was fresh enough, my roll and 2 nigri were filling, the seaweed salad was good. It's a GREAT alternative to prepackaged whole foods sushi. And the same price so I am happy with that. Probably not going to come here for dinner, but the prices were nice for lunch.
author: Emily D.

description: very fresh and the staff are friendly. we got dynamite roll and unagi donburi. and...something else i forgot. but i remember everything was delicious =D oh, well i just i wish their ice cream portion can be a little bigger ;p
author: Ru C.

description: Really good crunch roll and average spicy tuna (but you really can't make stand out spicy tuna). I wish I would have read the other reviews before I visited so I would have known to talk to the chef. I overheard two people sitting at the bar getting recommendations after I had already ordered!
author: Kate B.

description:
A solid place, definitely not spectacular, but I appreciated the quick service and good food.  

I'm a specialty roll kind of person, and they did show some real creativity in their food - and the presentation was outstanding as well.  

If you're staying close, and want some quick, casual, yet filling - this is your place.
author: Chuck W.

description: Dont get me wrong, food was good. We ordered our usual nigiri and tried the oysters. Everything was fresh and tasted good, with the small exception of the tobiko. Anyhow, only reason this place received 3 stars instead of 4 was because even though we sat at the sushi bar, the chef made us order through the waitress. One of the reasons we sit at the bar is so that I don't have to order in bulk with the waitress, I like ordering one or two orders at a time. The chef is awkward, but nice I guess. The place is quaint, nothing special about it but then again it's all about the food and that was up to par. For that girl who's review that saying she knew about Japanese food and all that jazz, yeah sorry I don't think you do.
author: Yang C.

description: Ate there with a friend on a rainy Friday evening around 7.  Small place but there weren't many customers, probably due to the rain.  We ordered a bunch of sushi rolls thinking that two special roll (6 to 8 pieces) won't be enough for two.  The most memorable was the lion king roll, which was huge and had a lot of cheese.  Otherwise, the sushi rolls had way too much rice in it.
author: Rose C.

description:
Sushi Toni was a good, solid sushi bar.  My partner and I ordered miso, seaweed salad, shrimp nigiri, spicy tuna rolls and the infamous lion king roll.

Everything was very fresh and expertly prepared.  The lion king roll should be renamed the schizophrenic roll.  There were so many flavors that it was almost overpowering.  It was however, delicious, but should definitely be eaten in moderation.

I would recommend this place for anyone in the union square area, but make sure you have at least an hour for lunch-- there were only three tables full when we were there and still the service was super slow.
author: Rachel S.

description: This place was awesome! We will definitely be coming here again. We went on a Saturday night and it was not too crowded, so we were seated immediately. I am almost hesitant to write a review because I don't want this place to become more popular! The service is quick (but we didn't feel rushed), the prices are very reasonable, and the specialty rolls are unique and fresh. My only problem was that sometimes people smoke outside and this can seep into the restaurant which is not pleasant when you are eating. Can't wait to go again :)
author: Carolyn H.

description:
With the myriads of sushi restaurants in the City, choosing one is a hard decision. So with the help of Yelpers, and the close proximity to our hotel Sushi Toni was the perfect spot. 

The entire staff greets you when you walk in the door including the sushi chefs, the wait staff continues to be attentive while you are there and the food is fresh and tasty. 

We ordered a the steamed shumai which was had perfect texture and flavor. The two rolls we chose were the red dragon roll which is named from the fresh tuna on the outside of the roll and let me tell you, it was red. It was remarkable We also got the Lion King roll which we had ordered in our home town so we wanted to make a comparison. This roll isn't like most, it is salmon baked with mozzarella cheese and a mustard type sauce on top. Odd sounding I am sure, but tasty nonetheless. 

Overall, if we are ever in the neighborhood again, this will be high on our list to revisit.
author: Robin O.

description: Love this place! It is super affordable, the sushi (especially the tempura options) is awesome. The owner Toni is such a sweetie and they always are willing to accomodate our last minute huge groups that come in after running :)
author: Kelly T.

description:
Ridiculously fresh fish & amazing prices.

I have to admit I was reticent at first to even try this sushi place- but now this is my new neighborhood sushi joint.

I also must add that Toni & the rest of the staff are fantastically fun!
Sit at the bar & enjoy the fun.
author: kristin n.

description:
Passed by this place a million times and finally decided to go in. 

3 STARS for the restaurant: not very big. 

4 STARS for the food: really yummy seaweed salad and spicy tuna roll. They were pretty quick!!
author: Cnn F.

description: Sushi was average...Service was slow and rude. The chef was nice, but the wait staff was not. I do not reccomend and I wont get in to to many details of how it went sour. Just know its SF, there is wayyyy better places.
author: Kourtney O.

description:
I was in SF for business and roaming the streets i found a few different sushi spots.  of course using yelp as my reference i found myself curious to check this place out.  

i was very satisfied and for the affordable sushi price i was able to enjoy a nice dinner at the sushi bar while talking baseball with the sushi chef.  great environment and great food.  very happy!
author: omid a.

description: One of the best sushi joints in SF!! Fish is so soft and fresh.
author: Robert A.

description:
The fish quality here is good I will give them that.  The staff was friendly.  The decor was cool.  It had anime pictures all over, pretty cute.  

My boyfriend and I strolled in here really late one evening (11pm on Wed.) because we saw a huge sign at the door that said "people on yelp love us".  LoL I'm such a sucker.  Anyway so we found out he's been only opened for 2 months and the place is korean owned.

However I'm rating 3 stars because the rolls were mediocre, they were rather stingy with the fish, and I thought it was over priced.  We ordered a 7 piece sashimi, which was $15 and the pieces were maybe 1in X 1in X 1/4in.  and it was "top grade" tuna (NOT TORO, just regular tuna).

Owner plays bob marley all day long.  Got annoying after hearing the same song for the 10th time in one sitting. I like the idea that  he like reggae tho, cool dude.

I liked the romeo and juliet roll, and the california roll, but I think everything is really "standard" or mediocre, nothing that was spectacular.  I wouldn't eat here again if I had other options.  I think I can definitely find better sushi somewhere in this town.
author: Zu W.

description: The food is pretty good. Fast service and friendly staffs
author: Suabot J.

description:
I had my raw oyster cherry popped here -- and it was unforgettable!

Chef Toni makes everything super fresh, goes out of his way to keep you entertained, and will provide the 411 on the detailed prep process behind the makings of his amazing fresh raw oysters or other yummy eats. 

Can't go wrong with the romeo and juliet roll made with soybean paper, lion king roll, hamachi kama or fresh scallops when they're available. Black sesame ice cream is a solid finisher too. 

Cute and clean ambiance, good value, super sweet waitresses and just half a hop away from Union Square shopping or a night out on the town. I'm in withdrawal if I don't get my Sushi Toni fix at least once a week!
author: Miriam K.

description:
Before I begin, I must concede that the only sushi I had was the spicy tuna.  It was good, but not great.  The other thing I ordered was a teriyaki  salmon.  The sauce was thick, cornsyrupy, nothing special.  Likewise, the salmon wasn't all that fresh or special. 

Nothing tasted all that fresh or amazing on this particular night.  But the service was fast (albeit the restaurant was mostly empty), and the waitress was sweet.
author: Brianna H.

description:
This used to be where the venerable Sushi-Man restaurant, the very first sushi restaurant in all of San Francisco, used to be. I recalled hearing about the surreal death of the owner of Sushi-Man and then noticed they were building a new restaurant in the space a few months back. I decided to give the space another chance under new management - the old place was AWFUL and I already reviewed it with one star a long time ago.

Sushi Toni is LIGHT YEARS away from the old place. Wonderful atmosphere, fresh food, and Toni the owner is funny and engaging. They are still working the bugs out but my experience at Sushi Toni was so awesome that it is replacing Sushi Rika as my neighborhood sushi bar - sorry guys!
author: Darren M.

description:
Even though it's a bit less traditional than I prefer, the rolls are tasty and the presentation is good.  

The servers are courteous and quick which I really appreciate.  

I would just go easy with the sauces on the rolls!

I'll be back for sure.
author: Robert M.

description: Great sake, great rainbow roll and great service. Reasonably priced and great for a light dinner. Quaint place so a great spot for a quiet date.
author: David J.

description: Came here with a friend for his birthday dinner and have to say, I'm shocked at the quality of the food here. I wouldn't say it was the cheapest sushi restaurant I've ever been to, but it wasn't bad considering all the food we kept ordering. Also the first time I've enjoyed uni anywhere, but don't take my word on this one ( I've never been a fan of it anywhere else for whatever reason).
author: Angela S.

description: Just visited this afternoon for an early dinner with my fiance and the food was amazing. So fresh, quick and really cheap. Will definitely be a repeat diner at Sushi Toni's. Also the staff were really lovely.
author: Madeline V.

description:
I was so disappointed with this place.  Based off of the reviews, I expected the food to be at least OK.  It was not.  The only reason I am giving the place 2 stars instead of 1 is because the people working there were very friendly and the service was quite good.  That said, the sushi itself sucked.  The fish was not very fresh and many of the pieces tasted too fishy.  Some of the pieces tasted as if they had been frozen.  We ordered a sashimi combo dinner which included 12 pieces of assorted fish (chefs choice).  There were no special fishes, just the usual tuna, salmon, yellowtail, etc.  Again some of it fishy, some of it has a weird color and texture (as if it was frozen).  We also ordered a couple of specialty rolls.  Word to sushi places, ease up or don't use mayo.  I don't know why this has become a convention in sushi places, but I have found that the good ones don't use much if any mayo at all.  Honestly the texture and the throat feel of mayo makes the sushi taste even more fishy and less fresh.  Good  fish should stand on its own and in my opinion leave you with a fresh and crisp feel after  the meal.  This place used too much mayo in their sauces for the rolls.  It was so bad, I had to find a dessert place just to cleanse the palate.  

I wish I liked the food more, because the people that worked there were so nice.
author: Scott C.

description:
Excellent sushi restaurant, great friendly service and delicious fresh fish. 

I only had a combo plate as I wanted a quick bite to eat after arriving in town but the fish and the presentation was excellent, as was the Yebisu.

Bob Marley was the music of the night.
author: Adrian B.

description:
had dinner here a few weeks back. not sure what the complaints about bad service were for because we had great service. the sashimi and rolls were affordable and tasty.

my favorite was the romeo and juliet roll.
author: Jae C.

description:
For me, this place doesnt deserve all the good comments in yelp. Its in good location and the fish is fresh but thats it!!!Its also quite expensive if you order a combo sushi and beer...
I wont come back for sure...Just a regular place as millions in San Francisco.
author: Isabel R.

description: 3* for fish, 2* for price. Just okay bordering on mediocre. The size of the nigiri was small, but the price was high. The fish was not fresh, though it wasn't aged either. There are better sushi restaurants nearby!
author: Velshin C.

description: Kick ass and affordable!   I won't overdo the review.  But they also gave us a few free appetizers that seemed customary, awesome!
author: Zenobia R.

description: The sushi was delicious and the prices weren't too bad. The dining area isn't super nice but it seemed pretty clean and neat.
author: Lemuel R.

description: This place is so awesome!!! It is my boyfriend and I's favorite sushi place in all of SF. Every time we come here we are not disappointed. Love the divey/old timey decor, super cute!
author: Mary C.

description:
Sushi Toni is located at what was formerly Sushi Man. The current owner also previously owned Tempura House around the corner, which is now replaced by Mari Sushi. Sit by the sushi bar, and he will make sure you feel right at home. I don't know if that's his personal style, but that's the thing with newly opened businesses: the service is usually extraordinary. He's an avid green tea drinker, so you can strike a conversation with him on that!

I order the saba nigiri, albacore nigiri, Hanakah roll (salmon skin, smoked salmon, Ikura), and Swamp roll (wakame salad and spicy tuna). Everything was excellent. The chef/owner also wanted us to try his special miso soup. They just got their liquor license a few days ago, and sake and soju are on their way. I can't wait to try their cocktail concoctions!
author: Lily T.

description:
My bf and I came to Sushi Toni in search of good sushi within walking distance of our SoMa apartment. 

The fish tasted good, but I found the menu to be a little bit fried. I tend to like sushi that is fresh and light instead of heavy. There were enough rolls to satisfy my fresh fetish, but not if I wanted to order different rolls each time I went. 

The sushi was reasonably priced, but not mind blowing. 

I did enjoy the music (all Beatles) but the service was only mediocre; we sat at the sushi bar, but made no connection with any of the sushi chefs. 

Its a good value if you're looking for cheapish (for sushi) food, but there are better quality fish joints in the area.
author: Kealie G.

description:
Attentive service, good food.

Good sushi - a nice place for a quick meal.  Rice was properly cooked.  Wife ordered rolls and sushi, friend ordered sushi plate, and I had lunch combo.
author: Justin H.

description: Wonderful food and service! The dragon, Romeo and Juliet, and lion king rolls are all fantastic!
author: Brant C.

description: Mediocre...While the quality of the fish is fine, the portion size and size of the rolls themselves are small.  Sashimi is also particularly expensive.  The only notable roll was the swamp roll.  But I wouldn't necessarily every go out of my way just to order one again.  Service was average.  Prompt but not personable.  So-so restaurant overall, not terrible but not amazing either.
author: Jeff G.

description:
I'd probably give this place another star if it wasn't for the misleading sign outside of the resaturant. "Yelp Users Love Us. *****" That's 5 stars. Actually they have several lines of 5 stars. Currently on Yelp they have 4 stars and the earliest reviews weren't that high so I can't believe that they were ever rated 5 stars.

That being said, the place really isn't that bad or that expensive. The food was average-plus. Like a B-. I got what I needed:  a post-happy hour sushi fix. The service was fast and friendly. In addition to the sushi, I ordered a plum wine. Standard price but not a standard size. It was miniature, so boo on that. My husband also said that his Sapporo was overpriced. Another negative.

One positive though - They were playing Bob Marley's greatest hits. Bob is good anytime, especially when you're in a mediocre sushi place and buzzed from the $2 margaritas from the bar down the street (more on that in another Yelp review).

So will I go back again? Probably but I won't expect very much.
author: Kiristen R.

description: Creative, delicious, friendly, not trying to be anything other than a great sushi bar.  49er and Family Affair rolls were very fresh and unique; nigiri was average size and very fresh.
author: Andy H.

description: Eh. Uninspired tuna appetizer, decent sashimi, huge but salty veggie udon soup. Nothing memorable, nothing offensive.
author: Danielle S.

description: Note--I'm not a sushi connoisseur. But I do love wasabi, tuna, and avacado. Sushi Toni is good for a light dinner in a non-fussy environment. I went with a couple of friends after yoga, and the three of us split 4 rolls.  The specialty roll was a lot bigger than the ordinary rolls.  It looked like they have a good sake options. I'll give it another go, but neither the specialty roll or eel did much to knock me off of my tuna, avocado, and wasabi train.
author: Lynn M.

description:
Great portions, quality fish, FAST service (not one of those bars where the chef is overworked and you can only order one piece every 10 minutes), and a very warm inviting atmosphere.  May not be the best sushi I've had... but still very good and I will definitely be visiting Toni again.  He's friendly, funny, and knows how to show his customers a good time.  A great first visit. 

Me: "Spicy scallop please!"
Toni: "Eh no no. I have fresh scallop today. Even better."

As we finished our miso soup a lovely open shell arrived.. half filled with scallop nigiri..  half filled with dipping sauce.. Then they took the left over scallop trimmings, sliced it with some veggies and turned it into tempura.  

Toni: "Good?"
Me: Good. 

The scallops were fresh, although sliced a little too thin for my taste, and I personally do not like lemon slices with my fish but can't deny good craftmanship and quality. 

A few more minutes.. down came a platter of salmon sashimi.  I prefer the fatty buttery melt-in-your mouth pieces.  Toni gives you the cleaner slices that have a nice bite to them.  Personal preference. 

White tuna appetizer platter next. Very nice presentation of colors. My favorite plate of the evening, when I generally don't even care for tuna. Great texture with the fish ever so lighty brushed with a blow torch. Flavor was fab. 

Toni: "Good?"
Me: "MMHMMM!"

Lion king and dragon roll followed.  The sashimi portions were so large that my date and I were struggling already.  Dragon roll was standard but lion king had a nice twist using mozeralla cheese instead of just the mayo-based sauce.  

Catching on to my loyalty to rich fatty goodness.. Toni treated us to some black sesame ice cream which was one of the best I've had.  

Toni :"OOH. I don't need to ask.  She likes this one"
Date: "Yea.. it's gone and I've only had one bite."
Me: "nom nom nom."

A shot of saki and $75 bucks later (pre-tip).. we were in a good place.. stuffed and waiting for our tummies to settle so we could devour our leftovers.
author: Beatrice T.

description:
I really wanted to like Sushi Toni, but I was left unsatisfied after my dinner there.  I order the unagi donburi and spicy yellowtail roll; both were disappointing.  

The rice was soggy and my roll was so loose it fell apart when I picked it up.  It seems pretty elementary to me that if you're a sushi chef you should be able to make a nice roll, but I must've gotten the chef in training.  

The best thing about Sushi Toni was the friendly waitress.  She was attentive and quick.  Too bad the food isn't better.
author: Bo T.

description: Good sushi joint.  The owner/chef is upfront with what's the best and seems to be genuinely interested in making sure you get the best fish he's got.  I ordered a fair amount to start and wound up stuffed, so I feel that I got a good value for the money and would certainly eat there again if I had the opportunity and was in that part of town.  Go and give it a try.
author: Ben G.

description:
I was in town performing at a corporate function.  I found this place on the Internet, not expecting much... I was extremely and pleasantly surprised!  Toni, the owner and chef behind the bar, is so extremely nice -- he has lived all over the world and has some fantastic stories!  Because he is so outgoing, when I was there, I got to meet three members of a German symphony orchestra who had just performed in town.

Whenever I'm in San Francisco, I will always, always go to this place!

Thank you Toni!!!

Dan
author: Dan N.

description: Toni rocks, he will even accommodate special sushi ingredients if he has them. Small but def. a must go to. Shumi steamed are truly delish
author: Roxy H.

description:
After being at game 5 of the NLCS and the its bitter defeat of our Giants with Timmy Lincecum on the mound - damn you phillies! - I found myself extremely hungry.  I felt as hungry as Paul Bunyon after a long day's work... yes, it is true.  So, I ventured onto my ailing iPhone - which is another story in itself - and found Sushi Toni's as the snickers to my hunger. 

Overall, I can't say I was too impressed.  The service was fast and I could overhear the sushi chef conversing with the patrons at the sushi bar, but I found myself next to a TV watching the highlights of the game I had just came from.  Boo.  Well, as this is my first review, I don't want it to be about the sour taste I had in my mouth from the game so hear it goes:

Family Affair Roll:  Though it is one of the pricier specialty sushi rolls on the menu, ($12.50 if i remember correctly), it was a delight to eat.  Tuna, white tuna, onions, cucumber, green onions, and tobiko.  All the ingredients seemed very fresh except the tobiko came off as a little stale and hard.  It just felt like i had a bunch of mini-BBs in my mouth.

49'ers Roll:  Salmon, simo, avocado, tobiko, and lemon.  The lemon is sliced meticulously thin and placed on top of each individual piece of sushi.  Great taste as the mixture of the juicy lemon slice combines with the Salmon.

Well there it is, I was in-and-out in a jiffy and wasn't displeased with the price but again, I was still bitter from an upsetting defeat on our home turf and would have given Sushi Toni more stars if it cured my depression of the night.

B - OK
author: William F.

description: Have eaten here many times and never had a bad experience. If you are an adventurous sushi eater, try the Dynamite Boom.
author: Joshua L.

description: Casual, fresh, unpretentious. I met my husband here after work and we had a great meal for a good price. I enjoyed a Rainbow Roll and cold spinach salad with Asahani Black Japanese beer. Hubby ordered a variety of straight up sushi and California sake. Service was friendly and genuine. We will definitely eat here again.
author: rosemary p.

description:
I've now been to Sushi Toni about a half dozen times and have hopscotched all over the menu (excepting eel, can't do eel...)    Everything I've had has been fresh, delicious, creative, and reasonably priced.  I took a sushi aficionado to Toni's the other night and she loudly declared it, upon exiting, her new favorite restaurant.    

I noticed they've taken down the YELP sign they had once happily displayed.  I hope it wasn't because ONE poster quibbled here about whether their average was four star or five star at that juncture in time.   C'mon.   It's a tough restaurant town, let's cut hardworking people a little slack.
author: Michelle C.

description:
It's Friday night, and there's 6 of us.  We arrive at 7pm and find an empty restaurant.  We're seated, and quickly order the following:

2 orders of Tadashi tofu -  good
hamachi sashimi - so meaty
