49er roll - the lemon top is refreshing
romeo and juliet - wintery presentation with the onion top
lion king - flavorful w/ the cream cheese top
swamp something - good
smash boom - interesting medley of seafood

We're a fatty group, so we ordered another round of hamachi sashimi and 49er roll!  After receiving the bill, the bill came to about $25 each.  Not bad after downing all that food!
author: christina y.

description: It's a quiet place to have some sushi after a long day. The service we received is really attentive.
author: Fin W.

description: The good news? Exceptionally courteous service. The bad news? Exceptionally mediocre sushi. We came here b/c all the other spots we wanted to check out were booked. This sort of seems like the sushi place not of last resort, but next to last resort. Nothing was bad. It just that the food was utterly indistinguished. Bummer.
author: B Q.

description: What the Hell happened to this place!!!  It was once pretty decent but went there yesterday and it has apparently  changed for the worst.  The sashimi smelled of ammonia as in being old and slimmy...they even tried to mask it by putting lemon over it to cover the flavor.  Who in the Hell squeezes lemon on your sashimi before it is served!!!.  My party was not only scared the fish was old and spoiled, but it  readily became apparent we could die from eating this...IT WAS THAT BAD!!!  If you don't believe me,keep on going..but don't tell me you haven't been warned.  Tomorrow, I will call the health department and tell them how bad they really are
author: Tokyokid G.

description: This place is owned by a Korean owner who is very friendly. To be honest, the food was okay.
author: Maitai N.

description: One of my favorite sushi places in the city. I like to keep it simple, and this place has a simple, casual atmosphere. A cozy, unassuming spot with a friendly staff, especially the sushi chef who's always happy to give you some recommendations or chat casually with you. I would recommend sitting at the bar for this reason.  I usually find the portions at most sushi places to be quite small, but at Sushi Toni, you will feel like you're getting your money's worth. Try any of their "special rolls," to give your taste-buds a unique experience.
author: Joe L.

description:
I've been a sushi chef for five years now. So, I know a thing or two about making good sushi.

The california roll I ordered had no sesame seeds on it. no cucumber inside. The rice was squished. And they put so much fake crab inside you would think they were proud of it. 

The avocado roll had soo much rice in it. And the avocado was totally squished. 

I stopped eating after one bite of each roll. After this I was too scared to try any fish. I can't believe they messed up on such simple basic rolls. I mean avocado rolls are so classic to sushi restaurants, how can you mess this up!? It was like eating a handful of mooosh.

I can't belive they charged me $5 for a cali roll this horrible. No wonder their restaurant is always empty. 

The only reason I don't give this restaurant a 1 star is because I pity them.
author: Claudius P.

description: We had a really nice dinner at Sushi Toni.  What it may lack in decor, it made up for with the freshness and presentation of the sushi & the service.   If we lived here, we'd definitely be back (often!).
author: Diane S.

description: Best Sushi in Town! My Personal Favourite is The 49er Roll
author: Thorsten L.

description:
Like all the other reviews, the place has a nice, upgraded atmosphere.  The wait service was beck and call and the owner Toni was behind the sushi bar.  I chose this place mainly on the review and glad they were here to make my night for sushi decision.

The sushi was very fresh as the owner Toni promised.  I tried the Scallop and Tuna sushi and it was excellent.  I had the green tea which was refreshing and apparently comes with every meal.  I also had some kind of Monk fish that had been marinating in Saki for a few hours and then boiled.  I also got to try he shiitake mushrroms Brandy tried and was awesome.

I would highly suggest giving it a try if you live in the area or visiting from out of town.  You wont be dissapointed!
author: Jason D.

description: The only good points are that it's within walking distance to Union Square, and there's a generous sprinkling of parking within a couple blocks. The rolls are meh. Not terrible, but not notable. B notes that the chirashi bowl is of generous portions for the price.
author: Julia C.

description: Well, this was a total surprise. The food was great, the service good enough, and the atmosphere interesting, but good enough for us. I have two measures of Japanese - miso soup, and the nigiri saba. The miso was good enough, and the saba quite tasty. I had a tempura roll as well, which was great. The girls ate their udon and Kali rolls, and we tried a few other things. For being downtown and not knowing what we were getting in to, this was a total find for a family dinner.
author: Luke S.

description: Great sushi. Love the hamachi kama, sashimi and surprising maki rolls. Back in a heartbeat.
author: Ravi S.

description: Had sushi here the other night. Very fresh veggie and fish! Had the dragon roll...rainbow roll...catepillar roll..good service. Chill ambience. I will definitely go back and try some new stuff!
author: Jennifer L.

description: I wasn't impressed. The rolls were good but I wouldn't call it a sushi bar. It was really more of a fast food style roll joint.
author: Sven G.

description: Came in for lunch, by far the best dragon roll I have ever had! Felt sorry for the waitress thought. One girl servicing 7 tables in a small resturant
author: Anthony E.

description: This is my go to sushi place. It's low-key, casual and always good. The fish is always fresh and the staff is really attentive. I'm guaranteed a good meal every time I go.
author: Stefanie W.

description: What's new pussycat? Or, a better question is - what makes SF such a great town? Eating great sushi, and listening to great late 60's tunes (including the aforementioned Tom Jones classic). The Lion King roll was topped with cheese. Odd? Yes! Nontraditional? Yes! Delicious? Yes! The chef sampler of sushi was good.
author: Thomas C.

description: Very cute lil place and the food is really good....I would recommend it, first time here
author: Karen R.

description:
been eating there for @ 4 years.  not often enough.  the portions are correct.  not too big not too small.  the quality is quite good.  I am a sushi snob and this is the only "roll" heavy place that I'll eat at AND eat nigiri as well.  I've never had a single piece be the wrong temperature or old, or in anyway less than good.

the inventive rolls are to die for.  I think they get better every time.

I highly recommend eating here.  It's never as packed as it should be.
author: Emma H.

description: We walked into sushi Toni super hungry from walking around all day. It looked promising from all the yelp reviews...well not only was the sushi not very fresh (which I can generally tolerate without giving a bad review) but let's just say the sushi wasn't fresh to the point I was 10 pounds lighter from sitting on the toilet that night...I hate to give bad reviews and I'm generally a positive person but when my colon is involved I have no choice. Go somewhere else!
author: James D.

description: I was in San Francisco for a conference and decided to give this place a try.  I went in about 6:30pm on Monday.  The restaurant was pretty empty.  I ordered a Chirashi.  The fish was not very fresh at all.  I had diarrhea that night.  I was tried Maru Sushi around the corner the night before and the sushi there was surprising fresh.  I read the reviews for Maru where someone recommended Toni around the corner.  So decided to give it a try the next night...huge mistake.
author: LoveYelp L.

description: Stopped here in an attempt to find a baby friendly sushi place near Union Square.  Turned out, this was just the place we were looking for.  The place wasn't too busy, had friendly staff, and a quaint setting.  The sushi was good too!  Would definitely visit again, and recommend to friends.
author: Shawn C.

description: This was a random Yelp pick for me and my wife. The fish was incredible, prices reasonable, and a very quaint setting (maybe 8 tables and 6 seats at the bar!). I totally recommend this place for anyone, but especially travelers staying at Union Square.
author: Steve M.

description: Fresh sushi and the owners are super nice people.  We had a good time!
author: E N.

description: Food near Union Square is definitely hit-or-miss, so I was skeptical when we strolled in here one night. However, I was pleasantly surprised. Sushi Toni has some of the best rolls I've ever tasted - like the 49er roll (delicious). We sat at the bar and talked with Toni - a sushi chef with a lot of personality. Can't beat the combo of flavor and price.
author: Laralynne B.

description: Great attentive service and fresh sushi. Wasn't crowded and easy to find. menu had some variety and Toni was friendly and funny. Nice place for a solo diner.
author: Kam P.

description: 2nd time here on a business trip to SF.  The staff and sushi chefs are pretty friendly.  I ordered the usual sushi fare.... salmon, yellowtail etc.  I was impressed by their uni as it was nice and creamy and no fishy taste at all.  The sushi chef then recommended the live scallop to me.  He said that they only get some like once a month.  I thought "what the heck" so I went ahead and got it.  Its not just one piece of scallop over sushi rice, it is a huge scallop sliced into strips so that you end up with like 8 pieces of sushi.  Then they took out the muscle around the scallop, mixed it with some onions, and turned it into a fritter.  The live scallop cost me $24 but its worth it.  Highly recommended.
author: Al C.

description:
Sushi Toni is a good lunch spot, but I wouldn't dine here for dinner.   My son enjoyed the Donkatsu & Tempura lunch combo, which was a decent amount of food for the price.  It comes with a bowl of miso soup, small salad, 4 piece California Roll, shrimp and vegetable tempura, and a large fillet of Donkatsu with a heaping bowl of rice.  I ordered the Rainbow Roll and it was nicely presented. However, it was just mediocre.  It was fresh and tasty enough to appease a sushi craving, but it didn't blow me away.  

The decor is more on the tacky side.  The walls are lined with framed pictures of Japanese anime characters and there is a electric organ that sits against the wall.  If you ask me, it looks a bit out of place. The one thing that was a bit disappointing is that it's not authentically Japanese in the sense that it's owned by Koreans.  

All in all, the sushi wasn't bad, the service was prompt, and the sushi chef was friendly.  A good place for lunch.
author: Sunmy B.

description: The sushi here are cheaper compare to other sushi places I've been too.  The setting is small, more like a room.
author: Lee C.

description: Their maki rolls are creative, tasty and affordable. The 49er roll (tobiko, siso, avacado topped with salmon and a lemon wedge) tastes just as good as the salmon citrus roll at Michelin rated Sushi Ran. I'm a huge fan of seaweed salad, so the fact that I can get it over a spicy tuna roll and call is a Swamp roll is pretty perfect. Yelp reviewers rave about the Romeo and Juliet roll (salmon and avocado wrapped in soybean paper, topped with scallop) and I have to concur. I like the Family Affair roll (tuna, white tuna and cucumber) even though they get a little carried away with the white and green onion garnish on top. The Red Dragon and Crunch rolls are also worth trying out. They're also able to make spicy scallop handrolls, which are a favorite of mine ever since I moved to SF. Basic maki rolls range from $4.50-$6.50 and specialty rolls are on average $9-$10. Everything is rolled well and made with quality ingredients. If you're looking for an affordable sushi dinner, this is the place to go
author: Larisa J.

description: I liked that their menu had the basics but also offered different flavors such as the Hannukah roll (lox sushi) and the volcano roll (either baked cheese or baked mayo ... weird but edible.  We should've tried some of the other stuff that Yelpers had recommended below, but because I didn't read enough, my group and I missed out.  Nevertheless, we did enjoy the Dragon Roll so much we ordered 3 of them for our group of four.  Service was OK and prices were reasonable.  I would come back here again.
author: Elena F.

description:
New restaurant in the neighborhood . . . so it's a must try. 
Damn it's good!  Bright, colorful, friendly atmosphere, good service.
The owner Sushi Toni is a jovial guy, takes great pride in his restaurant;
food and service.     
My husband is a devout sushi eater, loves his sushi and the sushi here is fresh, original and tasty . . .YUM!  
I am not a devout sushi eater but I thoroughly enjoyed the Spider roll.  
We'll be back for more . . .
author: Mary N.

description:
the sashimi was frozen, and one piece had a bone in it.
the seaweed in the rolls was not chewable
author: I B.

description:
This is not the place you'd immediately pick for your sushi dinner if you walk by, but don't be fooled by the relatively small venue:  This place has great sushi and it's very authentic.

Toni, the owner, stands behind the sushi bar counter and talks to all the locals.  "How are your kids?".  "Great meal as always, Toni".  There is a reason they come back.  Prices are very fair, the service is friendly, unpretentious, and attentive.
author: Ivan M.

description: Awesome sushi...try the salmon roll...really delicious...
author: Keith N.

description:
The place is nice and the location is very close to Union Sq.

The sushi is average and overpriced for the quality. They should include prices for their desserts. Really.

The staff is nice, but we felt we were being hurried to finish up and leave. 
Most probably will be looking for a different place next time.
author: alberto c.

description: My wife and I selected some basic rolls as well as 1 special roll.  It was a bit late and there were just a few other parties of 2 in the dining room.  We ordered some edamame which was served a little heavy on the salt.  She went for her usual California roll and I followed the advice of fellow Yelpers and got the Red Dragon roll.  We also shared a veggie and shrimp tempura.  Everything was tasty and the Red Dragon was a nice blend of flavors with a hint of spice.  Service was prompt and the price was a good value.  Worth a hike up the hill from Union Square.
author: Ron G.

description:
Soggy tempura, watery miso soup, scary looking lumpy hamachi sashimi slices and a moment of "how can red snapper be this affordable?... oh, that's why..." 

I'm sorry to leave a negative review but this is the only time in years that I've had to stop eating sushi while still hungry.  

I should add, judging by the other reviews my experience may have been an isolated one- and I really hope that's the case, but there's nothing worse than a $50 meal you can't eat.

All in all, I won't be eating there again, but I guess you can try it for yourself.
author: Thomas G.

description:
EW. That about sums it up. 

I'm from Vancouver, home of some of the greatest Japanese restaurants in North America. I also spent 2 years living in Japan and have a best friend who's Japanese. I'm fortunate enough to get some home cooked meals at her parent's place so I know what good Japanese food is. 

Toni Sushi does NOT have good Japanese food. The only reason why other people gave higher ratings can only be because they have NO idea what REAL Japanese food is like.

My boyfriend and I ordered very simple because we were not feeling adventurous or very hungry for that matter. He go a California roll (ok I know it's not authentically Japanese but whatever...) and we shared the Mixed Tempura meal. The cali roll was FIVE DOLLARS!!! WTF??? We aren't even talking real crab meat!! The rice was hard and roll was teeeeny. Not worth $5.

The tempura tasted like the oil they used was 4 years old. The batter wasn't very good and the rice that came with the meal was cold and crunchy. The miso soup they served was bland and tasteless; it needed WAY more miso. And the salad...oh lord the salad was SO not what i was expecting. They said it had a "special Japanese dresssing." REALLY? is Ranch really a special Japense dressing???

Bottom line...DON'T WAST YOUR TIME OR MONEY!!!
author: Ali H.

description:
Service is good - that was the best part, sadly.
The food is overpriced. Food tasted fine. There are other Sushi restaurants with better food & pricing & portion sizes.
The Chef's Special Roll was nothing special - even if I mentioned that Salmon is one of my favorite & I preferred white tuna than regular, both of which did not show up in my "special" roll. I was given regular tuna & yellowtail which he assumed I wanted after asking me if I liked that - which I said, "Yea...h I suppose."
On that note the other "Family Affair Roll" I ordered was similar portion-wise, so that tells me that the "Chef's Special Roll" DEFINITELY was NOT worth $15.00!
Worse of all, me & my daughter experienced an dull ache in the stomach afterward as if the food wasn't clean... I know this could be an isolated case, but I wanted to note that anyway.
We were polite & didn't say anything - I regret that. This review wouldn't even surface actually if not for the stomach ache we experienced. I feel indignant that there is bodily discomfort which prompted this review.
It was more like the more you think about what you were served, the more it was frowned upon ESPECIALLY with the "Chef's Special Roll" which was a custom ordered item with what the customer wanted. I didn't get my salmon nor my white tuna - totally INCONSIDERATE...!!!
author: Heather W.

description: I went on a late Saturday night and surprisingly it wasn't exteremly busy. We walked in and got seated right away. The chefs welcomed us with a smile which made me feel very comfrotable and at home. The sushi is very resonably priced. I would recoomend this place to everyone. Very freindly, cheap, and fresh!
author: Yadira G.

description: It is a nice place, but not a four star, more like a nice lunch place. We ordered 49ers roll & shrimp tempura. It tasted nice but not the best I have had. Location is good so is service . hope it improves quickly
author: Sean S.

description:
I was looking for some good cheap sushi and found it here! 

The Kappa Maki was absolutely delicious (and only $3). I also got the Veggie Tempura and Inari (tofu) nigiri - which was more like a cake wrap. Everything I had was really fresh and tasty. The waitresses were also really nice and the chefs were humble :) I ended up ordering more after eating what I had first I couldn't resist! 

Worth the visit for a nice relaxed quick feed.
author: Lucy L.

description: Really yummy, cute little sushi place. The cooks are really friendly. The rolls are a little on the large side though, which make if uncomfortable to eat, but if you're okay with getting a little messy then it's perfect. We ordered the dragon roll, crunchy spicy tuna, and the philadelphia and were very pleased. And saki bombs are always good times.
author: Ann A.

description: This is one of my favorite place to get sushi.  I'm going to be honest, so don't stop reading...the sushi here is not the best I've had.  If you want mouth watering, melt in your mouth sushi, then definitely go somewhere else.  They don't have great looking sushi like Kabuto either.  However, if you're looking for above average, reasonably priced sushi then definitely try this place out!  If you're looking for great personality and kind service, then you've found your spot.  Toni will hook you up with his amazing spicy tuna and insightful baseball facts :D.  His wife will give you smiles from the moment you walk in until you leave.  The service and atmosphere gives this place the extra star to make it 4 stars.
author: Tony N.

description:
We had a small feast here. The live scallop roll, with live scallop tempura, and live scallop liver was amazingly delicious and fresh.

The Romeo & Juliet Roll was one of the most beautiful flavor combinations I've had. The Caterpillar Roll with fresh juicy avocado was also delicious, but nothing surpassed in luscious lip-smacking succulent flavor-fullness the live scallop items.

Between three hungry dudes, it ended up being about $100, which was pretty reasonable. ($25 of that was the live scallop).
author: Jan M.

description:
the reason i didnt give it 2 stars is because the price is decent given the location. 

we only tried sushi so cannot speak for the dinner boxes or grilled stuff.

but the quality of the fish is fairly mediocre and the rolls have lots of rice, and barely any other ingredients. 

the eel nigiri was really good tho.
author: Danielle A.

description: Horrible, I am the best customer in the world when it comes to something I like, but this place was absolutely horrible. I got soft shell crab roll, it was only shell, and tasted like fish. I also got the CA roll, and it was just cucumber. I gave them a dollar tip, and I will never go back there. There is also a much better place 3 blocks down bush st.
author: Nathan M.

description: Great service coupled with great food. Everything form the rolls to the raw fish was delightful. It is a smaller place, so you may want to call ahead and reserve a table.
author: James R.

description: This place was recommended by the door man at our hotel.  It was delicious!  We had the tempura roll, the lion king roll, and the 49er's roll.  They were all delicious but the 49er's roll was my favorite!  It had very thin sliced lemons on top that gave it a great end taste!
author: Lesley R.

description: I was in town for business and was looking for some place in the general vicinity of the hotel. I took the advice of the people on Yelp and went for it. Food it good, the chef is really cool. He says most of his business is local and I can see why. If in in town again I'll be back...
author: David I.

description: In staying at the Larkspur hotel around the corner, i searched for good sushi joints with good reviews on YELP. This one came up. We gave it a try. A little tiny spot tucked along the street. They did not have a huge selection of sushi rolls (didnt have my favorite, the philly) but, what they did have was AWESOME! so very fresh the rice just melted in your mouth. Tempura was great too. And best of all, they were rockin the Ramones while the chef was making the sushi, doesnt get better than that!
author: Mahoney s.

description:
Not as good as expected.

I ate here with a friend on June 7 based on the Yelp recommendation. Fish was fresh but uninspired. The 2 sushi chefs on duty were not Japanese, not even Asian. All in all, a decent restaurant but nothing to get excited about.
author: Bruce B.

description:
I picked up this place by chance based on Yelp rating and I was truly satisfied.
The fish is very fresh, prepared very nicely, portions very generous and Toni himself is very friendly.
I highly recommend.
By the way, don't forget Toro nigiri :)
author: Peyman R.

description: This is now my friends and mine new local sushi place. I love the little anime pictures on the walls and the place is bright and clean inside. Also its open on Sundays in downtown!!! Plus its open late till 11pm.  The rolls are fairly well priced at about 7.50 each and the sashimi is about 12.50. The waitresses are very prompt and the food comes out rather quickly as well! The Owner is always behind working at the bar and greets us every time anyone comes in. Fish tastes fresh and I love the dessert. They have mochi mochi! SO good I highly recommend the strawberry.
author: Belinda A.

description: I can always depend Sushi Toni to delivery fresh and delicious sushi!  The sushi chef/owner is funny, friendly, and very welcoming.  I would definitely recommend sitting at the bar to talk to Chef Toni =), and you can have complete trust in his suggestions!  They will only serve the freshest seafood.  Sometimes they get fresh oysters, and they are the BEST I have ever had!  The way they prepare the fresh half shell oysters are spectacular!
author: Kimberly L.

description: Ok, Sushi Toni is not going to be the most amazing sushi you ever had. The menu is not super inventive and the teriyaki leaves something to be desired. BUT - the service is very good and the price is reasonable for Union Square. My advice is to stick with basic options (my favorite is the tuna sashimi) and not try anything too too fancy. The miso soup is also a great basic.
author: Emmy L.

description: One sentence review: This is my local sushi joint and offers tasty sushi rolls at a reasonable price.
author: Kevin W.

description: Great service, even better sushi! The fish is fresh, the rolls are creative and very tasty!
author: Shannon M.

description: I consider myself somewhat of a sushi connoisseur, converting many of my friends to sushi.  This would have been one of those I'd take them to in order to give sushi a good name.  Nothing fancy and kind of small, but the quality of the food is good, especially considering the reasonable prices.  Not a ton of combos, but an effective selection allows you to cater to what you may feel most like eating at the time.
author: Lucky J.

description: I have been eagerly awaiting the opening of Sushi Toni since moving to the neighborhood.  I had the chance to visit this week and was impressed.  The owner was super friendly and talkative.  He even gave us items not on the menu to sample, like some awesome marinated shiitake mushrooms and fruit for dessert.  While I usually enjoy a more lively 'nightclub' vibe with my late night sushi, Sushi Toni did not disappoint.  I recommend the Philly roll- perfect ratio of salmon to cream cheese!
author: Brandy B.

description: The sushi here was quite good, definitely fresh, but I wouldn't say it's one of the top sushi restaurants I've been to. For the price, however, you can't beat it. For about $50, my friend and I had miso soup, the Chef's choice sashimi platter, two orders of nigiri (eel and red snapper), two rolls (spicy tuna and salmon), and an order of green tea mochi for dessert. Plus, the service was great, and everyone there was very friendly and welcoming.
author: Nika S.

description: Awesome little sushi place.  Yelp'd before I went and it was a couple blocks from my hotel.  Sushi pieces were large and fresh.  Toni is great entertainment when eating alone.  Great vibe and great fish!!
author: Kandace P.

description: I ordered take out from here, so I'm not sure about the restaurant atmosphere, but the sushi was amazing! They have your everyday rolls and then they have some interesting special rolls too. I had the California roll, the Philly roll (always love the cream cheese), and I tried the Lion roll. They were all great choices and the prices are very reasonable.
author: Carly W.

description: This is a fantastic sushi bar! Very fresh fish and excellent service! I would highly recommend! Don't go anywhere else!
author: Lindsey C.

description: Sushi Toni is a hidden gem that I never would have tried if it weren't for the Yelp reviews! The fish was amazingly fresh and everything we tried was wonderful. A must order is the Lion King roll. I've tried other Lion King rolls, but nothing compares to Sushi Toni's! Make sure to call ahead for a reservation. This place is small and fills up quickly.
author: Charlotte P.

description:
I'm not a sushi expert, haven't lived for years in Japan, but for this sushi amateur this place had the goods. 
Don't expect fancy decor at Sushi Toni. The furnishings and general decor is all in good order but just the basics. There were some nice prints on the walls when I was there. A friend of the owner apparently is a photographer who has a pretty good eye for the city. All said, I go to eat, not to admire the sticks.
I ate here two consecutive days, once for dinner, the next for lunch. I have to say the food was not consistent on both visits, two different chefs. The first night appeared to be the owner and the food was great. Well prepared, well presented, and tasty. The next day it wasn't quite the same, not quite as well wrapped or presented, but still very good, just not great.
The service was friendly and overall efficient. 
We sampled many of the sushi places around Union Square and this is the one we returned to. Give it a try.
author: Bruce B.

description: We basically yelped our way through dining plans during our 3 day stay in the nob hill area.  Sushi Toni was on our walk back from union square.  It was meant to be.... Awesome food, service, and the freshest fish. As stated in others', it's very casual, which is the way we like it. What we care about is the quality of the food. Had: 49'er roll, Crunch roll, And the Chef Special. Regarding the special, Toni's wife asked what kind of fish we really liked, we said ahi, and Toni made the best roll I've had! We'll be back.
author: John B.

description:
I walked in and the chef greeted me with a hearty hello dripping with a thick coating of his native Japanese. I could tell from the get go that I would like the man, and of course I ended up enjoying his company immensely. I ordered a 24 ounce Kirin, which is of course nothing more than rebranded Japanese Budweiser, but I did not mind. I am indeed a beer snob, but when put to the task beer is always better than no beer. When the chef demanded to see my new ink work I obliged. You could tell the locals from the out of town crowd - the tourists stared at half an arm still seeping ink while the neighborhood folk didnt even look up from their rolls. I love San Francisco, and San Franciscans even more. They didnt look up, not that they had reason to, the food here is tops. Better than tops, its genuine. The waitress warned me of a sushi oddity, their deep fried tempura 49'ers roll. I grew up a Broncos fan and never forgave the Niners for blowing my team out of the water in the super bowl, but this roll made me rethink forgiveness. I downed them with a grin and enough gusto to make the waitress politely smile, and the aforementioned chef laugh heartily.

I finished my beer and left, but have been back since. You should too.
author: Chuck H.

description: my first yelp disappointment, so much so that I had to write a review. order the mega sashimi platter... small pieces and the salmon and tuna did not see fresh. udon was terrible, would have done better with instant. should have gone to sakana down the street instead.
author: J C.

description: Antoni was behind the sushi bar tonight and kept us entertained!  Very friendly and energetic.  Food was great - tempura udon and fresh sushi.  We will go back.
author: David V.

description:
Staff is super friendly and there's live music here from 8:30 pm-11pm I think.

For the Rainbow Roll, Unakyu Maki roll, Tuna Sashimi, and philadelphia roll plus 2 orders of mochi's it came out to about $45, so prices aren't too high. 

I'll eat Sushi to Beyonce and Bob Marley anyday
author: Anthony J. C.

description:
sushi toni is a great place, toni himself is full of insightful stories and opinions on what is his top pick on his menu. since it was downstairs from where we were staying it was something we had to try. 

i dont remember exactly what we ordered but it was all very good. we didnt order any sashimi items, but more of the  fusion fancy stuff. they had just a perfect balance of sauce. i believe i went on Monday so it was really quiet just a couple other people in the restaurant, which is nice since this place isnt that big. i could imagine one of the busy nights would be quite packed and a lot louder.

the service was really good, toni being so friendly and his wife was pretty quick refilling water or getting us another round of sake/beer. 

if i head up to san fran again i will definitely stop by again.
author: Mike T.

description:
almost a 5 star but not there yet.

went here w/ my buddy for lunch on my b-day and found out that sushi toni's had only been open for a month or two.  we sat down at the bar and decided to go omakase.  what came next were a plethora of items.  live scallop nigiri, soup w/ shrimps head, tempura of said shrimp's body, a fair amount of very good nigiri, collarbone of hamachi and black sesame ice cream.  what's holding me back from going the full 5 stars is that i've had better fish in the city, namely sebo.  not to say there's anything bad going on here.  in fact, it's pretty damn good.

toni was working the bar and we had a great time just talking and hanging with him.  not sure of the attention time we'd get w/ him at peak time but it was just right especially on my b-day.
author: Swarup B.

description: great sushi! read a bunch of yelp reviews trying to decide where to go, this one won out. We almost didn't go in as it was pretty empty. Sure glad we did. We had the rainbow roll, the Romeo and Juliet, red dragon and the 49ers. And a seaweed salad. It was all great and really fresh. Very friendly staff. By the time we had finished eating the place was packed with some people waiting for our table.
author: Cara B.

description: Nice cozy place with chill atmosphere.  Not over the top and not low budget but a good middle ground.  All your usual sushi suspects are here so you won't be disappointed and although I didn't sample them personally it does look like they have a good selection of high quality sake for sale.  Maybe next time.
author: Rob C.

description: This is what a sushi place should be. Relaxed, comfortable atmosphere. A great chef, and delicious fish.
author: Tom L.

description: This place is an inexpensive, hole in the wall sushi restaurant.   The location leaves something to be desired, as it's located next door to an "adult theater. " Also, the decor is nothing to write home about. (Don't bring a date here.) However, its clean and the staff are friendly.  The sushi is good for the price.  The nigiri portions were large and fresh.  However, the rolls were not as well done.  But, overall, my experience was good.
author: Mike T.

description: Overall, great Sushi with a relaxed environment!  If you are looking for Sushi that is doctored up with a twist, Sushi Toni is the place for you.  It is however not the freshest Sushi I have had in SF.  Great place for lunch and def ask Toni for recommendations.
author: Matthew F.

description: Its ok. I mean although Maru Sushi was overpriced, it was still pretty solid food. Sushi Toni doesn't have the greatest food, but the service is good. Everyone is really friendly. Prices are kind of standard for a Japanese restaurant in the area. (read: highish.)
author: Aaron F.

description:
I've been here twice, once with an old roommate and another time with my boyfriend.

The staff is friendly and courteous -- maybe even too much. The food is yummy and fresh. The only thing I don't dig is the lack of vegetarian options. There's pretty much only one option and it contains eggs (so no vegans). I know you don't expect vegetarian items from a sushi restaurant, so I can't really blame them.
author: Jenny T.

description: I've eaten here several times and everything about this place keeps me coming back for more. The fish is always fresh, and Tony is a genius with his sushi. He can make pretty much anything you ask for, and rolls are fairly large for what you pay. Ask for the live scallop if they have it, it is DELICIOUS! The waitresses are very attentive and always quick to bring me refills. There's a new younger one who doesn't look asian but she is GORGEOUS. Sometimes I can get her to take a shot with me, which is awesome. It's a great place for celebrations and I see a lot of groups stopping in before they go clubbing. but I would recommend calling ahead if you're bringing a big group or coming on a weekend. Definitely worth the hike up the hill!
author: Rich Q.

description: Any time my girlfriend and I are in the mood for some sushi, we always think of Sushi Toni. Being located in the Hayward city, in the Eastern part of the Bay Area, we literally take Bart to San Francisco just to eat at Sushi Toni. This is truly a hole in the wall treasure that people wouldn't have realized existed when walking by it. One day while my gf and I were in San Francisco, we thankfully decided to go check out Sushi Toni, after reading its good reviews on Yelp. The reviews were spot on; everyone in the restaurant were so welcoming greeting us in, and they were exactly the same waving bye on our way out, treating us like family. Their sushi is the best that I have ever eaten, and at the same time, one of the cheapest! Whenever my girlfriend and I go, we tend to get a specialty roll and two other common rolls (i.e. Californai Roll), splitting the 3 rolls between the two of us. I'm so glad, that we found this place!
author: Humberto R.

description: Very lovely place! We came here on the recommendation of other Yelpers and had a very sweet experience here. We came on 8/23 during our visit to SF, and Sushi Toni had the best tasting, best prepared hamachi kama we've ever had. It was fresh, tender, and perfectly grilled. The one waitress working seemed just a tad flustered but service was excellent.
author: A L.

description: Not a to-die-for sushi place, but definitely worth it if you're in a sushi mood. They have a pretty standard menu. I forget which rolls I've had, but they were all good as far as I can remember. They also have good udon, in case you're craving something else. I like that the place is small and relatively un-crowded on most weekdays. Be aware that the close proximity to Union Square means that it can get packed (I've been there on days where there was hardly any space to move).
author: Priyam D.

description: Went here during our honeymoon and had a great meal.  Tony gave us a fresh albacore dish on top of our sushi order and was extremely friendly.  The black sesame ice cream was unbelievable.  We will definitely come back here when we go to SF.
author: Michael P.

description: This place has some amazing sushi rolls. The volcano roll is great and something I never had elsewhere. If you're in this neighborhood, you should try this place out. Looks very tacky and small but the sushi is worth every $$
author: Rishi K.

description: Very good sushi at good prices.  The staff is very friendly and attentive.  The decor could use a little work and it's a very small place but worth the sushi.
author: Kirsten D.

description:
So my friend and I came here on a Saturday night and this was our experience:
1. We were the only patrons at 8pm
2. The owner's friends (with their rather loud and annoying 5 year old daughter) were lounging near the bar
3. The california roll was falling apart
4. The fish quality was good
5. The service & price was good
6. Simon & Garfunkel = fun!

I won't go back; I was disappointed b/c of the good reviews I read on here, but I wish we had gone to the one around the corner.

ps. Family Affair was NOT good. Be careful with the special rolls :)
author: k t.

description: We're giving this place a 4 star review just because Toni is so hilarious.  He's really a class act. He's funny, interesting, and surely will entertain you.  Sit close to the sushi bar.  We had the baked salmon roll, salmon teriyaki, vegetable tempura, and vegetable udon.
author: Zach S.

description: Delicious and friendly! Toni is a laugh and a half. Excellent salmon nigiri and super spicy swamp roll.
author: G. J.

description: So I went here for good sushi, I was very upset when my roll was not only not what it was advertised as, but also the staff denied that it had cheese on it, when it plainly did. Sushi with nacho cheese, all bad
author: Elroy M.

description: This review is only for the rolls. My wife and i came here last week and order around 4 special rolls to share. The sushi were small and had very little meat and alot of rice. The price of these rolls weren't cheap also; the most expensive roll we ordered was 13.50 for eel and rice (literally). I guess I'm just spoiled with other sushi restaurants.
author: Jimmy C.

description: Great sushi, reasonably priced with friendly staff. There are a ton of sushi restaurants in this neighborhood but Sushi Toni is the best! I have a friend who lives in the Mission who walks all the way here just to get their avocado rolls. Great food for great value.
author: Lindsay D.

description: we dined here on our last night in the "old neighborhood" before moving to our new condo... this was a much more pleasant experience than my last encounter at this same site (back when it was still sushi man). the restaurant has a rather unusual theme (or non-theme) to it, including anime cells on the walls and reggae playing on the stereo, but it doesn't detract from the solid japanese food and sushi rolls. under par compared to katana-ya or sakana but way better than sushi rock!
author: Andrey C.

description: The best sushi I have had in SF hands down ( with the exception of Sushi Ran which is actually Marin but just thought I would mention it!!). The fish is fresh and delicious and the cooked foods are amazing as well. I have had the Udon, terriaki, tempura and all are amazing.  I am a bit of a sushi snob and am often surprised that I can find great sushi in this city.  Now I have found my favorite Sushi restaurant in SF!    oh and dont forget to try the Black Sesame Ice Cream! wow.  Delicious!!
author: JEFF B.

description: Sushi Toni is a nice sushi place in the city with a really friendly staff.  The sushi was well prepared.  The place isn't huge but we had no issues getting seating.  The dinner combinations are a pretty good deal, and I thought the salmon and tuna sashimi I got was very tasty.  We also ordered a few rolls including a rainbow roll which was quite good.  The chef came out at the end and even shared a few stories with us, which were quite funny and amusing.  Overall, it wasn't unreasonable - probably you will spend about $20 or so per person.
author: Larry C.
